4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante

Recommandé
133.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 octobre 2014
Legend of Grimrock 2 is a game that truly deserves the ‘2’ behind the title. It’s bigger and better than Grimrock 1 in every regard while staying true to the feel and gameplay concept of its predecessor.

Not surprisingly Grimrock 2 is still a dungeon crawler in the spirit of games like Dungeon Master or Eye of the Beholder. You move your party of four characters through the gameworld using a grid based movement system, solve puzzles and kill monsters in real-time combat along the way.

So what did change since Grimrock 1? Quite a lot.

Instead of a single, linear dungeon you now have a semi-open world with beautiful outdoor locations and lots of different dungeons to explore. And you can explore them in almost any order, so if you get stuck on a puzzle you don’t have to check out a walkthrough guide to proceed, instead you can go somewhere else and come back later with new ideas or hints in your backpack. One other advantage of it is the games' increased replayability – in Grimrock 1 you maybe missed a few secret areas while fighting your way through the dungeon, in Grimrock 2 you can finish the game without ever seeing a good part of the gameworld.

Combat is much more challenging now, enemies move and react faster. Their AI was improved as well so many of the cheap tactics that you could use in Grimrock 1 don’t work anymore. Single, slow monsters can still be defeated quite easily using the ‘strafe and run’ tactic, but there are more than enough challenging fights with multiple and/or fast enemies.

The UI and some of the gameplay mechanics were overhauled as well. The skill system is more versatile and makes more sense now, alchemy is more useful as there is a larger variety of more powerful and interesting potions available, there are new weapon types like firearms and many other detail changes.

And of course there is much more content – the game is easily twice as long as the first game, there are more different dungeon types, beautifully crafted outdoor locations, more different weapons, more different enemies, more puzzles, more everything.

If you are interested at all in the genre this is a must-buy. It doesn’t get any better than this…until Legend of Grimrock 3 comes out.
 
phittte

Évaluation publiée le 2 novembre 2014
Best Dungeon Crawl Ever

Almost Human has surpassed not only the original but every grid-based dungeon crawler I've encountered. My friends would lament the passing of the grid-based dungeon crawls and fondly remember "Dungeon Master", "Eye of the Beholder", "Wizardry", "The Bards Tale". Few will review this game and not re-count how amazing those games were to those who remember them. I think this game doesn’t just build upon the classics, it surpasses their accomplishments. It’s the finest grid dungeon crawler ever made.

I loved the original Grimrock, having myself given up on the style years ago, it was like meeting an old friend from high-school. It was stylish and fresh. However, like many a first outing, you spent your entire time delving to the deepest level of the dungeon only to find the game itself lacked depth. The fighting tactics were simple “square-dancing” and the magic system was a little sparse. It was an adventure but from a gameplay standpoint it lived in the shadow of former classics. It was wonderfully atmospheric and playfully told but not as grandiose or sprawling as the later Bard's Tales or Eye of the Beholder sequels.

This game does away with the limitations of scope imposed by the original and improves upon the gameplay fundamentals of what made this game great in the first place. The fighting, monster design, artwork and music have all been significantly improved upon. It's significantly more open and the artwork on display during outdoor sequences is beautifully rendered. Music and sound design sets the tone appropriately and is wonderfully epic in tense moments. In a lesser game the grandiose pretentions would seem bombastic but the effort you have to put into defeating the game makes it feel like your genuinely overcoming huge obstacles.

Character generation is more interesting but still simple enough to avoid being paralyzed by the tyranny of choice. Puzzles and secrets are everywhere. You'll start tripping over hints and clues as soon as the game hits its stride. Many puzzles are straightforward once you understand what is being asked of you but Grimrock is coy about showing you the way. Normally this would be a recipe for some very impenetrable and time-consuming exercise in guessing what the developer intended for you to do; In Grimrock the puzzles reward observation and careful guesswork but not baseless guessing.

After the simple fundamental tutorial puzzles are concluded, Grimrock avoids puzzle designs I’d seen in past games including the original. There is no laborious map-breaking teleporter maze puzzle. It seems grid based dungeons ALWAYS have a teleporter maze puzzle and I’ve seen many that are needlessly miserable. Grimrock II consistently finds new ways of creating puzzles with switches and pressure plates with less reuse of puzzles veterans will have seen many times before.

Fighting is more fluid generally and many fights are more memorable and unexpected. You still have to abuse the grid system to succeed in fights but it's made less easy by how many encounters are staged. Enemy types behave very differently and many need specialized tactics to defeat efficiently. The introduction is still gentle, the middle is tense, and the end-game is full of surprises. Combat was rarely tedious, except for backtracking, which except for those trying to wring every secret from the game isn't too excessive.

It’s an amazing game. I’m looking forward to the next installment already but for right now I’m happy to have experienced a great game.
 
PoetIsland
6

4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante

44.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 octobre 2014
Legend of Grimrock 2 is a perfect sequel! Stands beautifully on it's own, and expands on all the greatness of the first. Best of all, instead of exploring a single dark multi-level dungeon, now you get a whole island to explore! Each area filled with it's own dungeons, and each dungeon filled with challenging puzzles and secrets. I dare say that there is almost a Skyrim level of content here, as far as exploration and secrets go. And they've even fixed the some of the silly issues/exploits that sometimes made the first game too easy. Once in a rare while I even got the feeling that the game was trolling me a little, in a fun way tho.

For those that don't know, Legend of Grimrock is a dungeon crawler, in the style of those old 90s D&D PC games like Dungeon Master, Eye of the Beholder or Ultima Underworld; Except with beautiful modern graphics, and all the benefits of modern game-play mechanics (there's even a day/night cycle on the island). Movement is sorta grid-based like those old games, but movement and combat happen in real time, not paused-turn-based. This creates an interesting hybrid of old school movement-rules, mixed with real-time stat-based cool-down-turn combat. If an enemy is too strong to face head-on, you can kite them around and try to dodge their attacks, but you also have to stop long enough to land your own attacks. You level your character's stats and skills just like any other stat-leveling RPG, and thankfully Grimrock's stat-system is easy to understand, and works exactly how you expect. Just like the first Grimrock, stat management is satisfying and fun, if that's your thing.

Legend of Grimrock 2 does quite a few things better than 1. Not only are the locations, puzzles, and monsters more varied.. They've also GREATLY improved the monsters' AI, to the point where it's DOWN RIGHT SCARY how intelligent they can be. They did this to make monsters more challenging, because in the first game once you learned how to kite around one monster, you could pretty much do the exact same thing to every other monster in the game, to the point where stats would become less important because you could just manually dodge around everything.
LoG2 "solves" that problem, by making the AI more clever, varied, and unpredictable. Try to kite around the wrong monster, and he might see it coming and have a counter attack ready for you, or they might ambush you with a special ability you've never seen before, or sometimes even just start running away, so you have to chase to get your experience points. Now it's a perfect balance of needing to have good character-stats, a good strategy, and needing to know/learn each monster's behaviors. Kiting around monsters is still an important aspect to combat, but it's no longer an easy-win strategy, by any means.
There's also a few non-standard enemies, who's AI seems to be on a whole separate level from the rest.. That's where it starts to get freaky.. I wont spoil anything, but the way these things behave sometimes, at least in comparison to the other monsters, you'll swear they're really alive!

Grimrock 1 took place entirely inside a multi-level dungeon. It was huge, and each few levels had their own theme for the walls, and sometimes their own set of monsters. It was great at the time, and enough to keep you exploring, but if LoG2 only offered us that again, I think it would have gotten old/dull fast. Luckily LoG2 gives us waay more to explore, the whole island of Nex! With outside locations as well as underground ones, forests, beaches, swamps, even the occasional castle and underwater area, and I'm not even listing them all. Oh, and the outdoor areas, while allowing you more freedom to explore and things to look at, still have a great dungeon-layout feel. The locations and visuals never get dull.

Bottom line, Legend of Grimrock 2 is a great game, that deserves way more recognition. It's every bit as good as a big-budget mainstream title, and is WELL worth your money! It will keep you solving puzzles, fighting monsters, and exploring for at least 20 hours, more if you're hunting secrets, and it manages to stay fun and addictive the whole time. And like Grimrock 1, The puzzles and riddles, while challenging and sometimes quite elaborate, give a great sense of accomplishment when solved, and reward the player with cool loot or new areas.
If you like this type of game or the general genre, certainly give this one a shot, it wont disappoint. If you're new to the genre, both LoG games are a great place to start. ;)
And if you liked the first one, what the heck are you waiting for?!
 
Nik
321 produits enregistrés

68.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 octobre 2014
Es gibt sie doch noch, die Gamedesigner die andere Vorstellungen von Rollenspielen haben als die großen Publisher mit Ihren Zielgruppenanalysetools. Mir steht deren sinnfreies “Tripple A Gekloppe“ so unter dem Kinn, dass ich diesen Mist einfach nicht mehr spiele. Legend of Grimrock2 hingegen ist ein Abenteuer, dass mich nicht mehr los lässt. Die Gamedesigner von LOG2 machen, und dafür danke ich allen Göttern, fast alles anders als die Fließbandprogrammierer “moderner“ Rollenspielfabriken. Beispiele gefällig ?
Es gibt keine(!) tausenden Kisten und Items die gestapelt, verwandelt und aufgewertet werden können. Keine Millionen Items die durch Zufallsgeneratoren in jeder Ecke verteilt werden, und deren Sinn nicht erkennbar ist.
Nein, in LOG2 ist weniger viel mehr! Das was der Spieler an Schätzen findet löst Freude aus. Alles macht Sinn und hilft dem Spieler erkennbar. Je schwieriger die Schätze und die Geheimräume
zu finden sind, umso besser die Belohnung. So muss das sein!
Und diesen ganzen Zufalls Mist gibt es einfach nicht. Wunderbar.
Es gibt auch nicht dieses kranke Levelscaling, ein Gegner in LOG2 ist das was er ist, Punkt. Bist du zu schwach, lass dir was einfallen oder komme später mit besserer Ausrüstung und höherem Level wieder. Herrlich.
Die Atmosphäre ist ebenso grandios. Das Licht, der Sound, die Stimmung allgemein, lässt echte Rollenspieler fast glauben wirklich ein Teil des Abenteuers zu sein.
Und dann wird dem Spieler auch noch etwas zugetraut. Die Rätsel sind teilweise sehr anspruchsvoll, aber nie absurd. Sie sind bisher immer plausibel und mit etwas Hirnaktivität durchaus lösbar.
Spiele wie LOG2 erinnern mich wieder daran, wie sehr ich diese Form der Unterhaltung liebe und schätze. Danke Almost Human, für dieses Rollenspiel.

Best
ZG
 
LS

Recommandé
10.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 octobre 2014
Первая Legend of Grimrock снискала у публики невиданно теплый прием; почти сразу начавшаяся разработка второй части поставила целью улучшить провисающие аспекты, но не чинить то, что не сломано. В результате получилась количественно и качественно подросшая игра, действие которой происходит теперь не только в подземельях.
   Для тех, кто не знаком с серией, краткое описание выглядит так: мы собираем партию приключенцев, вооружаемся чем повезет (для начала) и отправляемся исследовать мир. Перемещаемся по виртуальным плиткам, используем кнопки и рычаги, ищем секреты, в бою задействуем всех персонажей вручную. Если помните игры вроде Eye of the Beholder или Lands of Lore, знайте: это один из самых блестящих их духовных наследников.

   Итак, к четырем имеющимся расам (людям, минотаврам, ящерам и инсектоидам) добавились ратлинги - ловкие крысолюды, из которых получаются талантливые воры и механики. Как и раньше, разные персонажи лучше приспособлены для тех или иных ролей, а вот жесткое ограничение по классам убрали. Магическими навыками, к примеру, может теперь обзавестись любой; но герои широкой специализации все же проигрывают узко заточенным профессионалам. Хотя куда в эту систему занести класс "фермер", который отвратительно дерется и получает очки опыта за то, что ест еду, я пока так и не решила. Не может же целый класс быть создан исключительно ради лулзовой ачивки... правда?
   Боевка выглядит и ощущается ровно так же (не считая того, что мы можем получить ранение в определенную часть тела), плюс поля для маневра стало куда больше, а роль дальних атак возросла. Трудно недооценить возможность убить монстра метким броском штанов. Многие виды оружия обзавелись спец-атакой, которая задействует запас энергии - как, к примеру, заклинания. Никуда не делись такие чудесные формы времяпрепровождения, как алхимия, поиск черепов для героя-минотавра и сбор частей легендарной экипировки. Добавились хождение под водой, ловля рыбы голыми руками, откапывание кладов, использование отмычек и проращивание трав прямо в инвентаре по ходу игры. А еще можно рубить кусты и находить в них пули для огнестрела.

   Графика ожидаемо отошла от аскетизма первой части: количество анимаций и ассетов решительно выросло, палитра стала куда богаче (ну еще бы, ведь мы выбрались на поверхность!) и даже портретная галерея расширилась аж до полусотни отменных изображений. Чтобы не допустить экспоненциального увеличения веса, авторы пошли на все возможные ухищрения, дабы из одних базовых моделей и текстур (в том числе и старых) сделать как можно больше визуально различных объектов. Результатом их стараний стал вполне умеренный размер игры и совсем чуть-чуть возросшие системные требования.
   Музыка как таковая состоит из эмбиента и шумов, но не инструментальных композиций. Это опять же сознательный шаг: разработчики верят, что именно такое сопровождение способствует лучшему погружению в игру, нежели мелодии невидимых менестрелей, которые умудряются ходить за партией и играть напряженную музыку в бою. А главная тема, into и outro выполнены при участии коллектива Scoring Helsinki и диво как хороши.
   На полный забег по игре у одного из разработчиков ушло 22 часа, а со всеми сценами игра обещает быть в среднем на 25% длительнее первой части. Учитывая солидное количество комбинаций рас и классов, как минимум пара прохождений обеспечена. Но главное - несмотря на возросшие масштабы, Legend of Grimrock 2 дышит все той же ламповостью, которая когда-то безоговорочно подкупила игроков и критиков. Конструктор пользовательских модулей уже в наличии, так что и в Мастерской скоро начнут появляться отменные приключения.
 
Shess

Évaluation publiée le 10 juin 2015
Basic review for the first one:
Review of first one

What I liked:
  • OMG it's outside this time, and it's got day, night cycle
  • New spells, classes, enemy variety
  • Discovery in this game is still fun
  • The puzzles are still good ( had to resort to a guide for more than the first game)
What You Need to Know:
  • New enemy tactics and kinds of enemies to fight (AOE attacks, grabs and better counters to kiting)
  • There is no voice acting, cutscenes or anything to get in the way of pure gaming.
  • A freaking rope!! (so no more damaging your group by jumping off cliffs to get secrets)
  • Not much weapon variety
  • Lighting is so freaking good

Compared to the first game:
  • Combat tactics and variety is improved
  • Less puzzles are easy to figure out on your own ( less logical ones, more WTF do I do one)
  • Final boss is not as fun as the first one. I think because the map is too open. I didn't even die once fighting him
  • Added way more classes and one new race
My Score:
A

Paid: $12
Completed in: 31 hours

Games similar:
  • Vaporum
  • Divinity Original Sin
  • The Fall of the Dungeon Guardians

Évaluation publiée le 9 décembre 2014
Если первый Гримрок был просто отличным данжон краулером в олдскульной манере, то второй - это лучшее, что случилось с жанром со времен Wizardry и Lands of Lore.

Вместо линейной цепочки уровней - открытый мир, в котором никто не ведет игрока за руку.
Вместо одинаковых подземелий - леса, моря, пустыни, болота, пляжи, заброшенные кладбища (и подземелья тоже!)
Вместо 12 локаций - более 30.
Больше заклинаний, больше навыков, больше противников, больше боссов, больше головоломных загадок.

Шедевр. 10/10.

Évaluation publiée le 24 octobre 2014
ダンジョンマスターが好きな人にお勧め。


と、その一言だけでも良いのですが
せっかくなので1からの変更点。
今作からスカルキープのように屋外も探索可能になり
高低差の概念や水中など様々な要素が追加されました。
難易度は前作より高いです。

敵のAIは賢くなり、変則的な攻撃をするモンスターが増え
ボスの追加などアクション性が強化されました。
前作で強武器だった飛び道具の弱体化や
装備し難かった重装備の改善などバランスも調整されています。

・敵のAI強化
・クラスの増加
・負傷システムの追加
・UIの改善
・睡眠の高速化
・水中の追加
・高低差の追加
・スキルシステムの変更
・銃の追加
・LVアップ時にヘルスやマナの増加

その他諸々、1からの改善点が多く
正当進化している作品だと思います。

ダンジョンに潜る機会が減ったのは
人によってはマイナスに感じるかもしれませんが
屋外もバラエティ豊かで飽きさせない工夫が散りばめられています。

欠点は、謎解きのヒントが前作と比べて
少々テキストに依存されるようになり、
勘や発想だけではクリアできない謎が増えた事。
日本人には、少々取っ付き難くなったかもしれません。

英語を翻訳すれば何となく解けますが
Scrollのフォントが見難いのが難点。


負傷システムの導入でよりDungeon　Masterらしくなり
後は水のシステムが追加されれば、個人的には嬉しい限りです。
Dungeon　Master亡き今では珍しいシステムなので
3Dダンジョンが好きな人にも是非お勧めしたい作品ですΣd(ﾟдﾟ*)

～10月24日～
LoG2のガイドを作成しています。
初心者用の冒険メモや調合・魔法のレシピなどをまとめています。
大きなネタバレは避けているので
気が向いたら流し読みでもどうぞ。
Legend of Grimrock 2 ガイド 
Un guide pour Legend of Grimrock 2
Par : Meat Man
Legend of Grimrock 2の簡易説明書や 魔法・薬のレシピ、謎解きのヒントをまとめています。 ※11月15日 Steam側の画像ファイルの仕様が変わった為、 少し空白の乱れが発生しています。

Recommandé
32.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 octobre 2014
This is how you do a sequel.

Writing a brief review of Legend of Grimrock 2 is the easiest thing in the world: it's just like Legend of Grimrock, except much bigger, more complex and better. Fixing all of the first game's minor woes (like the skill system, now completely reworked to be much more flexible and less exacting), it brilliantly survived the transformation from a straight dungeon crawler into a more open-world type of design, going for broader rather than deeper dungeons in a rich (and sometimes genuinely surprising) variety of environments while still keeping everything tight and focused: exploring an island where everything is related to everything else, hidden paths tie it all together and nothing is quite accidental.

With the addition of multi-level maps to really amp up the complexity of puzzles and more varied enemy types to spice up the fighting, Legend of Grimrock 2 is more than just a worthy successor to the brilliant first game; it's an expansion on everything the first game promised and delivered. A huge, beautiful, clever and fantastically polished RPG experience and easily one of the best games I've ever played.
 
basilisk

Recommandé
42.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 septembre 2016
Legend of Grimrock 2

虽然说众筹平台救活了目前的CRPG御三家（Obsidan，InXile，Larian），让古典RPG有死灰复燃的迹象。不过同样古典的巫术RPG风格第一人称四向式地牢探险游戏，拿的出手的，似乎就只有如今这个魔岩山传说系列还在苟延残喘了。

其实也不能说苟延残喘，只是如今的第一人称RPG，目前的上古辐射和辐射就能说是这类游戏的变种，只是四人小队变成了单个主角，格子式的行走模式变成了自由探索，而地牢也化身为更加庞大生动的开放世界，算是游戏形式在某种程度上的演化吧。

那么，四向行走古典玩法的魅力如今还存在吗？魔岩山系列的销量和风评便给了我们这个答案：当然还存在。

====

魔岩山传说，就是这么一个返璞归真的游戏，要素很简单：探索，解谜，战斗，成长。它甚至没有大多数RPG游戏都有的货币系统，在地牢里打来的装备只有穿上和扔掉两个选择。

应该说，之所以以格子为基础的Dungeon Crawling游戏目前完全比不过其他RPG的人气，最致命的地方还是在于真实性。
战斗、探索、解谜全是以格子为单位，再加上是第一人称的视角，“格子”的概念就会无限放大。在玩过大量的现代RPG再去回味这样的古典风格，就会觉得走格子打怪的感觉傻里傻气的，会非常缺乏实感。

但格子也正是游戏的魅力。正因为所有的战斗简化成了格子，所以整个系统在策略深度的设计上就可以更加地考究。而格子上的设计无疑是降低了难度，让每个怪形成自己的战斗逻辑和风格是很容易的。狼可以在移动后立即攻击，亡灵战士可以在瞬间侧向攻击，蘑菇人会在随机方向放毒气，冰元素则可以在一条直线上施放冰锥……在这样的战斗系统中，简简单单的在场地上放几只怪，放几个障碍物，就可以形成一个非常有趣的战斗场面。每一次战斗都会像是一次下棋，玩家随时要注意自己的走位保证自己不腹背受敌，尽量不让敌人打到自己，慢慢地靠近敌人逐一击破，这种感觉是很爽的。
而加大挑战性的是游戏完全采用即时制的，加之要同时操作队伍里四个人的攻击和特殊技能，这也就意味着每次行动给玩家思考和操作的时间是非常短暂的。便会让游戏的节奏变得十分刺激。

我们常说老滚的战斗系统特别蠢，其实就是因为行动过于自由和追求真实，导致游戏进入战斗后，玩家和怪物面对面只能无聊到互相平砍，打不过了就跑远放弓箭和法术，略显单薄。其实老滚也能做到优秀的战斗设计，但那需要大量的成本去制作。同样道理，B社的游戏出的越新，其中副本的关卡设计反而是越来越线性和套路，失去了惊喜感。而对于魔岩山传说这种粉丝向的游戏，它所谓的“怀旧”正是剥夺掉了目前主流游戏所追求的实感，而采用了这种低廉怀旧的形式来制作更精致、也更庞大的迷宫与敌人。

====

谜题则是游戏的另一大亮点，阴湿的地牢里充斥着大量谜题，脑洞大，逻辑要求强，难度也是非常的不留情面。但自己解出来的感觉自然是非常有成就感的，至于解不出的……嗯有些谜题确实引导很差而且不按套路出牌，脑洞跟不上就看攻略呗。不管怎么说，大量谜题的存在让整个迷宫的探索不拘泥于纯粹的探路和打怪。不断的通过解谜和打怪来加深游戏中这片神秘岛屿的认识，慢慢揭开地图上空白的部分，是游戏最核心的成就感来源。

所以复古的格子带来的探索感就是这么一个道理。因为每一个迷宫就是实打实的“迷宫”，层次感强，整个迷宫的逻辑清楚但谜题困难，只有一格格的发现，小心陷阱，解决谜题，地图的轮廓就越来越清晰，这就叫作真正的“步步为营”。

说到底像魔岩山这样的游戏，游戏素质最看重的还是关卡设计师的能力。就我个人而言，在玩这类游戏的过程就是在享受设计师带来的一个个精心设计又恶意满满的关卡，动手解决这些有趣且充满挑战的关卡就是让我最享受的时刻。
只要不出什么大改革，三代若是一样地塞给我更多地牢，只要是看的出来是用心的，我照样会掏钱买。所谓魔岩山系列想要给玩家的体验，就是这些精心设计的迷宫，而我，也确实醉心于这么多五花八门，有着不同花样的迷宫，在其中探索，能给我带来极大的满足感。

====

魔岩山的一代我也玩了一定的时间，但没有通关，因为一代“是男人就下20层地牢”的游戏推进形式实在是太压抑了……
二代最大的改进应该就是地形风格变得更加丰富了，不再是单种风格的地牢，很聪明地将地图改成了一座岛，即所谓的开放世界，岛上分地上部分和地下世界的“地牢”，地牢也分成了风格各异的墓地、山洞、下水道种种，让人不会对画面产生腻味。主菜当然还是“地牢”，但地上地下的来回，可以看到阳光的感觉也至少让人能在游戏长时间的探险节奏中长舒一口气。

至于二代其他的改进，例如特殊武器攻击，断肢系统等等，其实都只是一代的些许改进，改的还行，不过都没什么革命性，只能说二代是一代的全面进化吧。由于两作之间剧情没什么联系，所以单玩二代并没有什么损失。

====

是，没错，大多数人肯定无法接受这种过于复古的玩法。但粉丝向的游戏当然没有迎合这些主流的人，正如大多数早期技术问题无法拟真的游戏一样，我们需要的仅仅是脑补真实。只要你愿意去想象，魔岩山传说游戏背后的复杂机制和一座座精心设计的巨大迷宫绝对是极度充实，令人满足的。

Dungeon Crawling类型的游戏从主流来看甚至已经不能称作是RPG游戏了，因为它甚至没有一个像样的剧情。魔岩山传说2，其实大概就是讲一个老不死的岛主想往死里搞这四个莫名其妙上岛的逗比，故事本身就是完全次要的存在。

不过，探索与成长仍然是RPG的核心，正因为你深爱着自己花好长时间建立起来的四位角色（？），操纵着她们征服一个又一个充满敌人陷阱的可怕地牢。而这种体验并不是能靠一个出色的剧本做到的，而游戏本身也并不指望用什么故事来吸引人。

游戏希望的是凭借精致老练的关卡，玩家能通过自己探索，谱写出属于自己的故事。
就单凭这一点而言，魔岩山能带来满分的体验。
 
Jasy
1,230 produits enregistrés
4

Recommandé
157.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 novembre 2017
Legends of Grimrock 2 is a Dungeon Crawler with real-time combat, lots of riddles and secrets, magic and potions, all wrapped up in gorgeous graphics. I’ve just replayed it after a couple of years and it is still fantastic, the best dungeon crawler out there.

Highly recommended!


+ 77 secrets, 11 buried treasures, 17 “epic items” to find in 34 different areas

+ Lots of different enemies with various attack types and weaknesses

+ The game looks fantastic, the enemies and the different areas are very unique and memorable

+ Absolutely worth its money length-wise, easily 35 hours or more if you don’t play with a guide

+ An (optional) auto-map that allows you to make notes and mark places

+ Very fitting soundtrack, creepy sounds

+ You can build your own dungeon with the dungeon creator or play lots of fan-made dungeons!

o Some people might not like the real-time combat (It can get hectic but it is definitely doable. I’m a middle-aged woman who usually plays strategy or point-and-click adventure games and I just beat the game on hard; if I can do it you can, too)

- The weapons and magic system could have used some more balancing (for details see below)



Story

You are stranded with a band of four on an island that is teeming with monsters and other hostile creatures. You hack and slash (and use spells, and shoot, bash, and throw things) your way through several dungeons and the extensive surface levels while gearing up because it is clear: If you want to get off of this blasted island, you will have to eventually confront the mysterious Island Master, who leaves you taunting messages and really seems to have it out for you.

There are two different endings and you can find a bit of lore in item descriptions and elsewhere but this is not a game you play for its elaborate story line.


Gameplay

You move in a grid-like fashion with WASD, move items around and push buttons etc with left mouse button, and use attacks or apply items with the right mouse button. Combat is real-time which can get hectic but weapons and spells have a cool-down period, so there is a limit to how fast you can attack and often it is more your movement rather than button spamming which decides a fight.

The game starts with assembling your group. There are several species (Human, minotaur, insectoid etc) and character classes (Barbarian, Knight, Wizard, Rogue, Alchemist etc) to choose from and to combine. The species have specific unique traits you can choose and different stats, the character classes determine some additional perks and which stats are increased when you level up. You also get a skill point each level-up that you can use to increase various things like accuracy, proficiency with different weapons or magic types etc.

Having a good group is extremely important and you can make the game very difficult for yourself if you don’t pay attention to the descriptions while assembling your group. My tip is to just play with the default group for an hour or two to get a feel for the game and then start a new game with your own group.

There are three different difficulty levels (“hard” is really hard, let me tell you) and a few different play modes that restrict how often you can save, for example, and an old school mode which has auto-mapping disabled because there are apparently enough people who like to punish themselves.


Secrets and puzzles

In one word: Fantastic. There are 77 secrets in this game, 11 buried treasures, 17 “epic items” to find. You’ll likely spend more time solving puzzles and looking for hidden buttons than fighting enemies.

There is an (optional) auto-map feature in the game that lets you mark puzzles you haven’t figured out, yet, so that you can return to them later. The game is not linear for the most part, almost all areas are open for you from the start. You’ll get murdered in an instance if you happen to enter an area that you’re supposed to leave for later in the game but there are always a few actually accessible areas you can go to while you think about a puzzle and maybe even find additional clues to solving it.


(Mild) criticism

As I’ve said in my summary on top, there are a few balancing issues surrounding the weapons and spell system. Good heavy weapons are more frequent than strength- and dextery-based light weapons. There are only a handful different missile weapons in the game; one of the better ones is in a place where you have to choose between this very good bow (while not knowing its stats or how rare these are) and three other loot boxes containing also potentially very useful equipment.

Firearms are completely useless since their damage doesn’t scale with skillpoints and/or your stats. The most powerful firearm in the game requires a special ammunition of which you find less than 50 in the whole game. The most powerful spell in the game is fire magic. If you specialise on any other type you won’t get anything even remotely comparable.

The game is also extremely unforgiving if you put a skillpoint towards the “wrong” skill; especially for first-time players there is no way to know how many skillpoints you can expect to get or what you might need them for and it can happen that in the end you might have to choose between getting heavy armour proficiency and being able to use a really powerful spell (which you also didn’t know the requirements for) because way back at the start you put one point in athletics since extra health can’t be that bad, right?
A couple more available skillpoints really wouldn’t have hurt.

All of these are problems mainly for first-time players who don’t know these details but it is also bad for replayability since it leaves you with less choices in creating your group and picking their specialities, at least if you want to play optimally.


I highly recommend this game for people who want a challenging game with lots to explore and discover!
 
just.like.that
0

argvarg

Recommandé
160.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 31 mai 2017
A criminally underrated game, I have seldom seen a developer take their original hit which was already almost perfect, and actually manage to improve on it in every way shape and form. You do not need to have played the original to play or enjoy this game. Their stories are completely seperate.

The game itself is much less linear than its predecessor. The best way I can explain the feeling of going through the environments without referencing Grimrock itself is by saying it felt an awful lot like Myst to me, just with combat. Required puzzles for progression were challenging but not impossible, some of the secret challenges were much more difficult. I admit I used an online guide more than a few times, but it did nothing to diminish my enjoyment of the game. It is immersive, challenging, and satisfying.

The only drawback I can think of is the difficulty. It feels like you cannot win with any group composition, I suggest no more than 2 of any class or weapon/armor type user. I went with a warrior, two rogues(one range), and a mage, this way you as well makes you unlikely to complete a difficult fight or puzzle and be rewarded with something you cannot use. Combat itself can be challenging as I said, but you will rarely feel like you are simply incapable of winning. There are obvious ways to optimize the way you approach an encounter the second time if you die the first.

Be prepared to immerse yourself, you must pay attention to your surroundings, read and remember notes you find, explore every nook and cranny you can find, and you will be rewarded. Good luck!
 
Takngitslo

Recommandé
41.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 aout 2015
Игра сложная, местами даже хардкорная, от некоторых настроек, что можно задать вначале, волосы дыбом встают, после того как хоть немножко вникнешь в суть происходящего. Погибнуть здесь – легче лёгкого, иной раз хватает пары неосторожных телодвижений, но запутаетесь и заблудитесь вы, вероятно, раньше этого, ибо карты и головоломки такие, что просто не понимаешь: что делать и куда дальше идти? Подсказки на минимуме, да и те весьма туманные. Чего уж говорить про тот факт, что поиски скрытых кнопок и секретов как в первой части никуда не делись. Секретов тут вагон и маленькая тележка, конечно можно не заморачиваться их поиском, но тем самым вы серьёзно усложните себе жизнь и прохождение игры в целом. А прохождение включает в себя кроме решения задачек и поиска секретов – сражение с монстрами в неком поклеточном вальсе, иначе не назовёшь. Откаты ударов, рисование заклинаний на магической доске, маневрирование в строго ограниченных пространствах, попытки не дать окружить себя толпе мелких противников или увернуться от огненного шара. Однозначно в этом есть изюминка и прелесть, но с непривычки может вызвать любую реакцию вплоть до отторжения. Как бы то ни было игра стоящая, интересная и самобытная, но далеко не всем придётся по вкусу.

Плюсы: необычность.

Минусы: чрезмерная запутанность.
 
Zlish

Évaluation publiée le 30 novembre 2014
HIGHLY RECOMMENDED 100%. Any gamer would be a fool not to play this.

It's a non-linear version of Legend of Grimrock with a mix of indoor and outdoor environments to explore, with countless improvements.

+ Huge island to explore. It's non-linear so you can venture whereever you want and get to end game. I beat the game in about 50 hours, but some people have beaten it in 20 or so hours. I did a lot of backtracking
+ Much refined character development and skill point system
+ Combat is greatly improved, You can't cheese battles like you could in LoG.
+ More rewarding puzzles. Some of them are tough, but if you get stuck you can just skip it and go elsewhere. You usually figure out puzzles in your sleep anyway.
+ Amazing soundtrack
+ Gorgeous graphics
+ More varieties of enemies
+ It's like Dungeon Master 2!!

- Can't think of anything bad about this game.
 
darkcecil13

Recommandé
44.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 juin 2017
Clever, tricky and downright gorgeous - Legend of Grimrock 2 improves on everything that made Grimrock 1 one of the best dungeoncrawlers in the past decade.

Instead of a grimy old dungeon, you get to explore an entire island full of a huge variety of locales, from seaside beaches infested by crabs, graveyards filled with fancy undead coming out of their graves all around you to pyramids, castles, haunted villages and of course many more dungeons.

The puzzles are still constructed, and fun to solve. The bossfights are meaty and clever, and the party composition actually allows a lot of freedom to accept your own playstyle.


If you were looking for a worthy successor to Dungeon Master and Bloodwych, play Legend of Grimrock 1 first - and then come here, prepared to have your mind blown.
 
Vexing Vision

Évaluation publiée le 24 octobre 2014
Цельноолдскульное ядро, бережно обернутое в современную оболочку.
Legend of Grimrock 2 — это тот самый глоток свежего воздуха, которого зачастую так не хватает игровой индустрии. Ребята из Almost Human сумели вложить душу в свое творение, что ощущается уже на первых этапах игры. Проект получился поистине уникальным, ведь он сочетает в себе необъятное множество геймплейных элементов, совокупность которых выгодно подчеркивает особенности игры.
Got ya! 
Une capture d'écran de Legend of Grimrock 2
Par : Disciple

Так чем же именно Гримрок привлекает публику?
  • Интересные головоломки;
  • Богатые на приключения локации;
  • Большое количество внутриигровых предметов;
  • Современная графическая оболочка и проработанная механика игры;
  • Магия! Удобно кастовать и юзать;
  • Продолжительная одиночная кампания;
  • Разносторонний подход разработчиков, обеспечивший сохранность интереса как у «софтовых» новичков, так и у «хардкорных» геймеров;
  • Простая и удобная система управления персонажами, навыками и пр.;
  • Интуитивно понятный редактор подземелий;
  • Адекватная обратная связь с сообществом: разработчики ведут открытые диалоги с игроками — как на официальном форуме, так и в обсуждениях в Steam;
  • Шикарнейший саундтрек, который отлично вписывается в атмосферу игры.
Этот список можно продолжать до бесконечности...
And i was like "WHAAAAAAAT?!" 
Une capture d'écran de Legend of Grimrock 2
Par : Disciple

А теперь немного конкретики:
LoG 2 — невероятно живописная игра, в которой каждый новый уровень краше предыдущего.

* Головоломки здесь встречаются разные, но большинство из них имеет наипростейшие разгадки — достаточно лишь убрать чрезмерную настороженность, немного абстрагироваться и дать волю логике: можно потратить на поиск решения несколько часов, а затем обнаружить, что ответ был у тебя прямо под носом.

* Заклинаний в игре всего 15, но это не делает магию примитивной и менее универсальной.

* Схватки требуют сосредоточенности, поэтому приходится учиться выполнять множество действий, не прерываясь на раздумья.

* Уровни насыщены элементами, с которыми мы можем взаимодействовать, но большинство из них скрыты или же требуют определенных знаний для того, чтобы с ними можно было взаимодействовать, что лишь подогревает интерес к игровому процессу.

* Реиграбельность диктуется не популярной нынче темой, когда уровни генерируются случайным образом, а желанием доказать себе самому, что ты способен найти больше и сделать лучше — кошмар перфекциониста, у которого плохо складываются отношения с пазлами.

* Новички и те, кто просто «мимо_проходил» могут быстро пробежаться по головоломкам и не отвлекаться на монстров — на сложности Easy ты практически неуязвим. Если же твое сердце жаждет испытаний, а задница находится в непрерывном поиске приключений — хватай блокнот, карандаш, валерьянку и начинай кампанию, установив галочки напротив «Old School Mode» и «Ironman Mode».

Первая часть игры смогла вновь пробудить интерес к жанру не только у игроков, но и у разработчиков — взять хотя бы тот же самый M&M: X. А что до второй части, то она, вне всяких сомнений, смогла поднять планку LoG еще выше, хотя, казалось бы, расти проекту вверх уже некуда...
Legend of Grimrock 2 
Une capture d'écran de Legend of Grimrock 2
Par : Disciple

Таким образом, спустя ~50 часов созерцания красот Гримрока, я созрел для изложения собственных впечатлений, оставленных игрой:
Начинать без каких-либо знаний об игре было бы тяжело, поэтому опыт общения с первой частью пришелся как нельзя кстати. Возможно, интерфейс и выглядит немного запутанным, но разобраться в нем сможет даже ребенок. Система кастинга стала более удобной, враги умнее и сильнее, головоломки сложнее, а путешествия и схватки – разнообразнее.

Ставлю игре 10\ 10 и выражаю огромную благодарность всем, кто хоть как-то причастен к разработке первой части, а также к тем усовершенствованиям, что настигли LoG 2.

P.S. заходите в гости: https://vk.com/hardcoregamer
 
Disciple
3,422 produits enregistrés
8
52 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
64.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 octobre 2014
This is how a true sequel should be made!

It's larger (amazingly large, actually!), more complex (with levels over levels, multi-level environments with ladders and submerged areas and a large outdoor "overworld" area) and more beautiful that the already large, complex, and visually pretty Legend of Grimrock.
The multitude of puzzles is intriguing and makes you feel smart when you solve them, and the fights with the new, improved AI is much more tense and challenging.

Many enemies in LoG1 could be kited and "danced" around, turning the fights into a real cheesefest- but in LoG2, that cave troll you used to dance around will now patiently wait for you to make a wrong move, deliberately turning so that you have difficulty approaching. The wargs will jump around you with great agility, not giving you any time to try and flank them yourself. The little blue fishmen guys will nimbly dodge your attacks and attack-jump toward you. The giant frogs will snatch your weapons from your hands, leaving you severely weakened until you manage to defeat them and get your items back. Every enemy type requires careful thinking and different tactics to defeat, and the challenge feels great!

As was the case with the first game, in Grimrock 2 there are also loads of secrets, rewarding a perceptive dungeon explorer with great loot.

There are new classes (the farmer being the most amusing for sure), a new PC race, loads of new items and weapons (firearms, too!!!), new monsters (and some nasty traps and surprises!), and huge new levels.

Do yourself a favor and go play this amazing gem of a game.
 
Mrmo
1
52 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
44.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 novembre 2014
I loved the first Legend of Grimrock, it successfully updated the old Dungeon Master first-person dungeon crawler. It was one of my favourite games of 2012. If it had flaws, it was the lack of variety in combat and environment.

Legend of Grimrock 2 fixes all those flaws, and is immediately a much better game for it. The only thing it loses is its gradual "descent" into the depths of the dungeon. Here the world is laid out across a much wider area, although there is both depth and height to most dungeons now. The outdoor areas are the most noticeable change when you first start, and they add much needed life to the game. Some of the sights you'll encounter are impressive, not something I was expecting from a grid-based crawler, but the game can be often beautiful. Indoors the engine now deals with height within the same dungeon level, so ladders lead up and down onto platforms, and coupled with quite a few different mechanics leads to a lot more variety in the kind of puzzles that are possible. I didn't find the puzzles to be quite as challenging as Grimrock 1, some of which relied heavily on very tight timing, and in the sequel clues tend to be spread across the map rather than being just around the next corner. A lot of hints are very opaque at first, but gradual dawning realisation will occur much later in the game as you start to piece it together. Personally I really enjoyed this, and being able to make notes on the map is pretty much essential to keep track of them.

Combat is a vast improvement as well. There's much less reliance on dancing around enemies to stay out of harm's way, facing-off is far more feasible this time (on normal difficulty at least!) due to better character balance, progression, and smarter use of character traits. Of course, there are always exceptions, and the developers are clearly having fun keeping the player on their toes with new enemy types. This is not a turn-based game, but it should be manageable.

It took me a little over 40 hours to beat the game, although I've been quite thorough. I know others who did it in half that time. Even after beating the game, there's one major secret that I've yet to conquer, a way of ending the story more satisfactorily. I'm sure it will keep me busy a while longer. This is easily a contender for my favourite game of 2014.
 
krayzkrok
991 produits enregistrés
0

Recommandé
116.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 octobre 2014
Im Vergleich zum Vorgänger gibt es ein paar dezente Änderungen am Interface und Skill System (z.B die Hotswap Funktion, die das schnelle Wechseln von zwei Waffenkonfigurationen ermöglicht) sowie die Möglichkeit, verschiedene Symbole auf der Map zu benutzen. Letzteres mag zwar banal klingen, aber es sorgt doch für wesentlich mehr Übersicht, wenn man sich viele Notizen macht (und das sollte man!)
Grafisch ist Legend of Grimrock 2 auf dem Niveau des Vorgängers, nur mit dem Unterschied, dass die Level deutlich abwechslungsreicher, und teilweise auch unter freiem Himmel sind. Dass es dort einen fließenden Tag- und Nachtwechsel gibt hat zwar keinen echten Einfluss auf das Gameplay, kommt aber der ohnehin grandiosen Atmosphäre zugute.
Die Rätsel werden im Verlauf des Spiels immer schwieriger, und selbst auf dem untersten Schwierigkeitsgrad kann man schon mit den Gegnern Probleme bekommen. Dieses Spiel ist eine echte Herausforderung, und das ist auch gut so!
Negativ anzumerken gibt es höchstens, dass LoG2 nur auf Englisch ist, wobei es an sich nicht wahnsinnig viel Text zu lesen gibt. Die Item Beschreibungen, ein paar Briefe, Hinweise und Schilder, und das war‘s auch schon.
Selbst wer den Vorgänger in- und auswendig kennt kriegt hier einige Rätsel serviert, die ihn ordentlich ins Grübeln bringen dürften! Allerdings muss man den ersten Teil nicht gespielt haben, um hier zurecht zu kommen. Schwierig ist es so oder so.

Recommandé
6.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 octobre 2023
Ein Schritt nach dem anderen, ein Schritt nach dem anderen...

Du liebst hektische, schnelle Shooter?

Fastpathed, göttliche Reaktionen verlangende Thirdperson Action Games?

Du weichst aus, blockst, lernst die Movesets von Bossen auswendig, dodged dem Gegner in den Rücken? Viele Male bis der fällt?

Joa - dann hier ist das GENAU das Game für Dich ... NICHT :-)

Dieses Game hier stammt aus dem Anbeginn der Zeit der Computerspiele.
Als schnelle Action auf Heimcomputern noch nicht möglich war.

Ein herrliches grid-based oldschool-RPG.

Wenn Du ganz genau weisst, was das genau bedeutet, gehörst Du bereits zur Zielgruppe!
Zweimal "genau" in einem Satz zeigt Dir, in welch illustrer Runde Du Dich befindest ;-)

Legend of Grimrock 2 
Une capture d'écran de Legend of Grimrock 2
Par : steve6678


Mit Deiner klug gewählten Party aus Heroen (die optimale Mischung der Klassen und Fertigkeiten macht den Sieg) stapfst Du Schritt für Schritt durch diese schöne Welt.

Löst Rätsel, bekämpfst Monster, suchst Questgegenstände.

Die ersten 3D-Games wie Wolfenstein und Doom haben hier viel übernommen gehabt.
Schlauchige Labyrinthe, die Schlüssel und Gegner und Loot für Dich verstecken.

Legend of Grimrock 2 ist dabei so ein Vertreter wie das geniale und großartige Bards Tale 4 (hab ich auch einen Test dazu: https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198012246112/recommended/1091980/)

Beide Spiele sind stark rätsellastig und quälen uns zu unserem Vergnügen mit knochenharter Rollenspielkost.

Eventuell wirst Du erst einmal mit zugänglicheren Titeln wie Might & Magic, Wizzardy, 7 Mages oder Dungeon Master warm.

Hier ein Test: https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198012246112/recommended/238750/

Vielleicht auch mit den japanischen Versionen wie zum Beispiel Ettrian Odyssey.

Alles sehr gute Spiele!

Schrittweise durchkämmt man hier die Gebiete aus der Egoperspektive und versucht weiter und weiter in der Welt zu kommen, während die Gefahren größer und die eigenen Helden stärker werden.

Bards Tale 4 und Legend of Grimrock 2 dagegen sind eben kopfliche Schwergewichter.
Hier ist nichts mit Dungeon Crawling im Sinne einer Lootspirale: Metzeln, Looten, Leveln, Laufen, ... Metzeln, Looten, Leveln, Laufen,...

Legend of Grimrock 2 
Une capture d'écran de Legend of Grimrock 2
Par : Nord


So manches Rätsel und viel Quicksave/Quickload wird Dich fluchend - aber auch Glückshormonüberladen bei Sieg und Lösung - zurücklassen.
Ganz wie ein Dark Souls.

"At last i had found the last piece..........now the full set of Crystal armor was mine!!" 
Une capture d'écran de Legend of Grimrock 2
Par : The-Skull-Will-Conquer


Fazit:
Ein herrlich nostalgischer und doch moderner Ausflug in ein Nischen-RPG, dass eine gewisse Toleranz, Spaß am Entdecken und viel Köpfchen voraussetzt. Nach Bards Tale 4 mein Lieblings-Oldschool-RPG

Évaluation publiée le 24 mars 2015
I had an absolute and total blast revisiting the world of Grimrock... this game is monumental compared to the previous game... It is so much bigger and so much more complex, with a much more open world. There are some great new enemies that really challenge how you fight.. and some new puzzles that are interesting and challenging.

If you enjoyed the first Grimrock game, then you absolutely must play this, and if you're a fan of the old grid based dungeon crawlers and haven't played Grimrock yet, then you really should.. Both games have been really good, but this is far and away a worthy sequel.

Great game for the most part.
I do not like how they made a rpg with twitch aspects though.
My characters are supposed to be strong and agile not me on the keyboard.
Do not expect to beat the island master(2nd ending) unless your very agile with your fingers.
At 50 years old it is impossible to get him down past 3/4 health.
Too much twich and not enough character skill.
Games like might and magic you never had to be agile with the keyboard.
Guess this one goes under my "Ending too hard category"

23.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 octobre 2014
Вы хотите знать, почему вам обязательно нужно поиграть в Legend of Grimrock 2? Что ж...
Скажите, вам знакома жажда, возникающая при чтении захватывающей книги?

Имели ли вы счастье читать что-то из того небольшого количества книг, которые планируешь почитать немного, перед сном, а потом лучи утреннего солнца начинают светить прямо в лицо, выдергивая вас из водоворота повествования?

Если да - вы в точности знаете, что такое Legend of Grimrock 2. Потому что это и есть одна из таких книг, только лучше. Здесь вы - рассказчик, и только от вас зависит, какие радости и невзгоды падут на закованную в цепи четверку бывших заключенных. Берегите их, ведь кроме вас - неведомой силы, ведущей их к свободе - у них нет никого.

Безразличны вы к ним или нет, но у каждого из них есть своя история: и у пленного Минотавра-варвара, и у пойманного в королевской сокровищнице вора-Крысолюда; непростая судьба и у покрытого еще мягким хитином юнного волшебника-Инсектоида, и даже простого Фермера, невероятным образом попавшего в эту разношерстную компанию. Но они верят в вас. Вы же не дадите им погибнуть прямо на берегу, в клетке? Дверь заклинило, но если бы кто-то дотянулся до той палки...

Надеюсь, я смог донести до вас атмосферу приключений этой игры. А что касается занудных технических деталей: графики, звука и прочего... поверьте, вы о них даже не вспомните. Просто начните игру.
 
Tander
1,060 produits enregistrés
8
27 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
33.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 novembre 2019
Legend of Grimrock II is a landmark in the genre, easily one of the best real-time dungeon-crawlers ever made.

In 2012 the first Legend of Grimrock revived a style of RPGs that had died in the 90s, the first-person dungeon crawler, or "blobber". It did that by faithfully following the formula while adding fancy 3D graphics. It was a fun game, but not a great game, as it was repetitive and relied too much on side-stepping during combat.

Grimrock II sees the same team back for a bigger & better sequel, employing all the tools, techniques and feedback from the first game. Instead of one dungeon, now you explore and entire island that has been expertly designed. The pacing is excellent, mixing puzzles, exploration and combat, while the combat, UI and character system was greatly improved. And the game is packed with optional content and very rewarding secrets.

It has a few small issues, like the still-average combat system and a couple of moon-logic puzzles I had to google (looking at you, Serpent Staff), but they are not enough to frustrate the very positive and fun experience I had.
 
Felipepepe
1,362 produits enregistrés
0
46 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
34.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 octobre 2014
Игра сложная, игра большая, игра замечательная.
Первая часть была великолепна, атмосферна и загадочна. Вторая часть мало отличается от первой - новая большая локация, парочка новых расс и классов (фермер? 0_о), новые враги, новое оружие со специальными ударами. И все. По геймплею это та же самая первая часть. И это не плохо. Это отлично! Когда я открыл для себя первую часть, я проходил ее взахлеб, обыскивая каждую стенку в поисках кнопок, стараясь собрать все комплекты брони, оружия, и решая паззлы. Со второй частью у меня получилась такая-же история. Игра затягивает, и не отпугивает своей сложностью, а наоборот бросает тебе вызов. В общем для меня это лучшая игра в своем жанре, и однозначно обе части стоят у меня в топ-10 лучших игр.
Рекомендую

Recommandé
105.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 31 décembre 2017
So, a few months back I decided to play the Legend of Grimrock series. I wanted to go retro and revisit a dungeon crawler type of game I grew up on (late 80s early 90s) and through a bundle deal I grabbed both games.

Here is my
Legend of Grimrock Review?
https://steamcommunity.com/id/Euther/recommended/207170/

So, What is the Legend of Grimrock 2 (LOG2) game about?
LOG2 is the 2nd game in the series and continues being an action role-playing video game developed and published by Almost Human. It is the sequel to the 2012 title Legend of Grimrock, and was released for Microsoft Windows for PC on October 2014. Like LOG, it is a first-person action role-playing game with realtime game mechanics. The Player again manages a party of up to 4 NPCs which they move through a grid-based dungeon.

Plot
Like LOG, the player in the game is again a prisoner. The games starts out where you and three- (3) other prisoners are located in the hull of a prison transport ship, in a cage... Yea! How Joyous!
Once Again... Prisoners... Really? :D 
Une capture d'écran de Legend of Grimrock 2
Par : Euther Pendragon

As a result of a strong storm and unknown magic (hehehe) the party of prisoners gets stranded on the mysterious Island of Nex. The prisoners need to explore the island and discover its secrets if they are to survive. Unlike LOG, this game is played outside and inside. You will travel through forests, rivers and swamps, as well as, ancient ruins and crypts below the island.

There is another Big Bad Guy, too, the elusive Island Master who alternates between providing hints to the prisoners and taunting them of upcoming challenges.

The party of prisoners will need to gather a elemental gems scattered around the island, and use them to enter the Castle that towers in the middle of the island. On top of the castle, they encounter the Island Master! Defeating him is possibly their only escape... or is it?

Gameplay
Gameplay consists of using a Keyboard/Mouse to navigate through the the Island, Underground Dungeons, solving a combination of puzzles and combat. Characters within the party gain experience for slaying creatures and beasts within, allowing them to increase in level and progress skills which enhance combat abilities and allow the casting of new spells, and equipment is obtained through exploration and solving of puzzles throughout the dungeon.

Game Thoughts:
I had a blast with this game, too. It met my expectations of an Action Role-Playing, Dungeon Crawler set in an atmosphere of constant dread and mortal danger.

- Multiple Endings... :D
- Graphics are still just OK. Respective to the year of release. Could use retexuring and re-releasing!
- Great atmosphere and story, IMO,
- Awesome soundtrack,
- Boss fights were not so challenging (for me) once you learn the "fighting dance", Google it!
- Highly repayable if you have the time.
- Via the Dungeon Editor - Plenty of Dungeon & Quest MODs attached to the steam workshop!
- For me, 106 hrs to complete base game + Item Collections + Achievement Hunting,
- 1st Playthrough achievement progress: 56 of 60 (93%) achievements earned
- Normally $24... I'd wait for a sale.... or catch the bundle
- Great game!

 
Euther Pendragon
232 produits enregistrés
6

Évaluation publiée le 16 octobre 2014
So far this is a HUGE improvement and expansion on the original, it's more open-ended, you spend as much time out on the surface as you do in dungeons, there's a night and day cycle, more secrets, more loot, more everything! It's a challenging game but you can always chicken out and check the solutions to puzzles on the internet if you can't brain your way through it. If combat is too hard for you, just set the difficulty to Easy. Great fun game, fantastic atmosphere and sense of mastery!

Recommandé
29.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 octobre 2014
Grimrock 2 requires that you think outside of the box from the get-go, because the game is constantly building upon everything it teaches you. There's no handholding, and I don't mean that in the "so hardcore it craps 8 shades of bits", but in the "you're in this situation, deal with it".

You won't always have the tools to deal with the challenges. Sometimes you'll have to remember that one spot in the game world where there's something you can do or deal with. Sometimes a puzzle solution might not be apparent or you might not even have the in-game knowledge to solve it. It's a game that requires your attention, that frequently puts you in a "Are you ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ me?" situation, but that's ultimately rewarding when you do figure out what was going on.

The puzzles themselves are probably the best part of the game and are quite self-aware. They are laid out so that the play with what previous puzzles have taught you, which means sometimes they iterate on an approach, or break a misconception you may have had, but never do they feel like they are repeating themselves.

Compared to Grimrock 1, the skills are more streamlined, the classes more interesting and the openess and scope of the game makes the first game seem almost like a demo. If you like RPGs, puzzle-solving and exploration, Grimrock 2 will deliver nicely on every front.
 
RealSlavicBear

Length of Time Played: ~50 Hours (Non-Steam Version)
Distance Played: Beaten the Story
Personal Grade: A

Opinion of Each Aspect

Grading System - Based on a 5 point rating system.
(5 = Outstanding, 4 = Good, 3 = Average, 2 = Poor, 1 = Awful)

Gameplay: 4/5
Stability: 5/5
Story: 4/5
Controls: 3/5
Graphics: 4/5
Music: 4/5
Sounds: 4/5
Difficulty: 5/5

Notes: + (Positives), = (Small Gripes), - (Negatives)

+ Significantly improved AI compared to the 1st Grimrock
+ Environments change as you go along
+ Great difficulty curve
+ Excellent music that fits the game
+ Nice transition between night and day
+ Additional races and classes to play as

= Does require a mouse to play effectively
= Interface is a bit awkward at times
= Some of the puzzles seem a bit too challenging

- The final boss is a bit of a joke

Évaluation publiée le 3 novembre 2014
Tak się powinno robić kontynuacje!

Gra pod każdym względem lepsza od pierwowzoru. Otwarty świat pozwala na częściową dowolność w odwiedzaniu lokacji i dungeonów. To duży krok na przód w porównaniu do pierwszej części gdzie zwyczajnie pięło się do góry po kolejnych poziomach. Duży plus za zagadki - trudne, a przez to satysfakcjonujące. Cieszy fakt, ze znacznie zmniejszono liczbę ukrytych przycisków, a wykorzystano inne i znacznie ciekawsze formy. Rozwój postaci też jest znacznie ciekawszy - pojawiają się perki, a rozwijając umiejętności można liczyć na dodatkowe profity np. dwuręczna broń może być trzymana w jednej ręce itp.

Fabuła tylko opowiadana w niedzisiejszy sposób - zapiski czy to na grobach, ścianach czy listach. W sumie to cała ta gra jest mocno niedzisiejsza, ale to dobrze. Twórcy nie poszli na żadne kompromisy.
 
Kil M
623 produits enregistrés

27 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
40.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 octobre 2014
J'ai découvert le dungeon-crawling avec Legend of Grimrock qui a dépoussiéré le genre un peu disparu à priori et j'avais bien aimé.
Legend of Grimrock II, je l'ai adoré.

A peu près tous les aspects du jeu ont été améliorés. Liste non exhaustive :
  • Des environnements intérieurs seulement et avec 3 textures de murs dans le premier opus, on découvre ici des environnements variés aussi bien extérieurs qu'intérieurs.
  • Des monstres avec des comportements différents qui ne peuvent plus toujours être dupés sur des espaces de 2x2 cases ou plus.
  • Des énigmes / puzzles bien plus recherchés. Les forums risquent de vous être d'une grande aide par moment.
  • Des compétences qui ne sont plus limitées selon la classe. Dans la pratique ça ne va pas changer grand chose mais ça peut en intéresser.

Vous l'aurez compris, le principe du jeu reste le même : Vous parcourez le monde avec 1 à 4 personnages en quête d'aventures, de challenge(s), de trésors ou quoi que se soit qui vous motivera à avancer, ce n'est pas ce qui manque :p. Le monde est plus vaste, plus "interconnecté", les lieux s'imbriquent.

L'équipe que j'ai créé pour parcourir ce monde fût similaire à nos bons vieux prisonniers du premier Grimrock et assez classique : 2 bourrins devant prêts à encaisser (un chevalier et un guerrier ici), et 2 bourrins derrière à protèger un peu, bien qu'ils n'étaient pas si fragiles que ça en fait (un voleur double dagues et un mage de bataille).
L'aventure pris fin au bout de 29h30 pour eux*, environ 39h pour moi. Eh oui, presque le double du premier opus, avec une grande partie des secrets trouvés, il m'en manquait une dizaine. Quand ils disaient "plus de 20h de jeu", ils n'ont pas menti !
*Pourquoi presque 10h de différence ? Sûrement à cause des diverses pauses en jeu pour lire et/ou répondre sur les forums à propros d'énigmes et divers secrets essentiellement, et des quelques rechargements de sauvegardes. Et pour ceux que ça intéresse, voici mes stats de "fin"[i.imgur.com]. Des guillemets parce que j'ai joué un peu après, et j'en ai déjà trop dit.

Bref, j'ai à peu près tout dit. J'espère vous avoir communiqué mon amour pour ce jeu et tout ce qu'il vous propose. Je n'ai noté aucun défaut majeur.
Je sais que certains aimeraient l'avoir en français. Si vous ne comprenez pas l'anglais et ne vous sentez pas prêt à utiliser Google Traduction ou autre outil similaire, vous pouvez toujours patienter. Peut-être que les développeurs feront un effort pour au moins nous permettre de traduire le jeu convenablement.
Le seul petit défaut que je note c'est lors du chargement d'une sauvegarde, ça prend un certain temps (hors SSD, une dizaine de secondes). Je ne sais pas s'il y aura une amélioration, ça peut gêner ceux qui aiment recharger souvent leurs sauvegardes pour diverses raisons.

TL;DR : Plus varié que le précédent dans tous les domaines, plus long (durée de vie +50% à +100%). Si vous avez aimé le premier, vous adorerez celui-ci.
 
Harest
1,091 produits enregistrés
0

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante

17.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 octobre 2014
Legend of Grimrock II 4/5: Almost Human se ze své lásky k žánru krokovacích dungeonů (nezaměňovat s krokovacími RPGčky jako je z nedávných kupříkladu Might & Magic X) dostatečně a kvalitně vyznali již v prvním díle, který umně kombinoval důraz na klasické staromilské mechaniky v přístupném hávu. Zadařila se jim tak málokdy vídaná věc, kdy oslovili i uspokojili jak nostalgiky mezi námi, tak tímto svébytným žánrem dosud nepolíbené hráče. Ve své podstatě mrtvý žánr resuscitovali.

Od té doby se však díky vzedmuté indie/Kickstarter vlně urodilo hned několik zdařilých titulů a tak nestačilo nabídnout pouze „podruhé to samé“. A věděli to i tvůrci, kteří se poučili z chyb jedničky (souboje, jednotvárnost), dokázali celý koncept posunout zase o něco výše, ale přitom zůstali staromilsky (skoro až zpátečnicky) věrni pravidlům žánru a tak stále jde o dungeon crawler (jakkoli zde mnohdy pod otevřeným nebem) až do morku kostí; tedy žádné questy, NPCčka, obchodování, dialogy, příběh… Jen a pouze přežití nástrah jednoho ostrova skrze souboje, časté (jakože opravdu časté!) puzzly a objevování skrytých zákoutí. Nic více a nic méně.

Akorát se znatelně přitvrdilo v obtížnosti a tak i bez zapnutých hardcore modulací (žádná mapa, žádné libovolné ukládání) jde o výzvu jak v soubojích (již nefunguje postupné upižlávání nepřátel skrze „tile dancing“ z jedničky, kdy se tímto způsobem bojovalo od úvodních potvor až po ty závěrečné; zde většina soupeřů má proti tomu obranu a vyžadován je tedy jiný přístup „potvora od potvory“), tak i hádankách a puzzlech (většina současných logických her i adventur může jen tiše závidět nad jejich nápaditostí, rozmanitostí i obtížností).

Navíc se tu výtečně pracuje s atmosférou. Nejsou na hráče vrhány zástupy nepřátel. Naopak se tvůrci nebojí nechat ho celé minuty bloumat po prázdných chodbách. Jenomže ve hře, která ve své škodolibosti nedává nic zadarmo (uvidíte-li bednu v místnosti bez protivníků/puzzlů, tak si můžete být jisti, že to bude mít háček) to má za následek, že budete napjati „tady zatím rohem už to musí přijít, zase nějaká ta zákeřnost, po které budu opětovně nahrávat pozici“. A i nadále platí, že zdejší posedlost zkoumáním každého centimetru všech stěn při hledání tajných tlačítek mnohdy hraničí až s náběhem na diagnózu obsedantně kompulzivní poruchy.

Druhý Grimrock tedy je v technickém hávu odpovídajícímu roku vydání (opětovně) úspěchem po všech stránkách, který na ploše několika desítek hodin důsledně razí přístup „minule jsme vám dali vzpomenout, jaké to bylo v dobách, kdy světu her vládly dungeon crawlery, a nyní vám konečně ukážeme zač je toho loket a jakou výzvou ty hry tenkrát byly“. A díky za to!
------------------------------------------------------------------
-: Případná další (ne)doporučení jsou k nalezení na mé kurátorské stránce :-
 
DaViD´82

Évaluation publiée le 3 décembre 2014
Genre - 3D tile based RPG (Fantasy)
I am an 80s child and have fond memories of Dungeon Master, Ishar, Eye of the Beholder and Lands of Lore. Then it all went very quiet for a long while, but along came Legend of Grimrock and it was ace! It went quiet again then it came back! It is a true sequel adding new environments, game mechanics, puzzles and monsters. You move around a tile a time, need to eat, solve puzzles, find loot and slay monsters. The graphics are the best I have seen for this genre and is a fair challenge. A well balanced game for old farts and those who are willing to try a more retro style game. Ten times better than WoW, although you can't chat up Female Trolls played by men in this...

2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante

Recommandé
32.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 décembre 2014
10/10 What a Sequel Should Always Be! (Expand the Review for a summary)

Pros
- Mod Support
- Level Editor
- Secret Chests and Rooms
- "Untold" Story
- Great Soundtrack
- Guns GUNS GUNS!
- Outside Environments
- Multiple Difficulty Options
- Very Good Character Customization
- Nicely Laid Out Puzzles
- VERY HIGH REPLAY VALUE

♥♥♥♥
- Some Puzzles, though nicely laid out, lack thought or "Obvious" completion paths
- Atrocious Anti-Aliasing

Just wow. It is not very often that a sequel to a game that I thought was "meh" comes around blows me way the ♥♥♥♥ away. This is one of them. I have been having an absolute blast playing this game, closet comparison I think I can make for Grimrock is Wizardry (mainly 8.) One of the things that I really liked about the first Grimrock game was the replay value and Level Editor that was added, and my god did Grimrock 2 deliver in those areas too! The level editor is fleshed out in a pretty serious manner, mods have already been developed for the game. The way the story is told, outside of the opening cutscene is pretty much through things you discover for yourself, letters in the world, things you see, the closest comparison I can make is to Dark Souls where the lore is indirectly fed to you, I like the setup, and it adds to the mystery of the Island. One of the new things they added was outside areas, which was one of the best editions this game could have made, for one, it allows for some serious modding potential, (Eye of the Beholder anyone?), the other thing is it just expands more on the world itself allowing you to be a bit more immersed. Another thing that was added was a Day and Night Cycle, it is also very well done and definetly adds to the atmosphere in a few areas (The Cemetery.) Next, I would like to give a big shout out to the guns. There are guns in this game! They added Guns! I really shouldn't have to go on any farther on that subject, although mechanically speaking they can be weak, they jam, and bullets are hard to come by. Its a matter of choice though, some people seem to really like them. Lastly on game mechanics themselves I would like to talk about the Puzzles. I found most of the puzzles to be intuitive and fun but there were a few that just stuck out because they were so basic or because they were so complex. The example the comes to mind at the moment is the Gate in the Cemetary, I had no clue what to do and eventually gave up and looked it up. I would have never had a single clue if I had not done that, although there was probably a note or something somewhere. One more thing, the Anti-Aliasing in this game is terrible, SweetFX can fix it, and I am sure if you have a 780ti, 970/980, or a 290x you could downsample to make it much better, but that is something I notice, and I am sure many others do too.

Bottom line though, this game is bonkers, I was stoked about it when I got it and I am still having fun with it. Great game, maybe even my favorite game of the year.
 
PaulaDeen
434 produits enregistrés
1

2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante

Recommandé
45.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 octobre 2014
What is Legend of Grimrock 2?

Legend of Grimrock 2 is an old school first person non-linear dungeon crawling role playing game. Improves on the first game in every way. Incredibly challenging. Lets us go outside!

Read the full, and lengthy, review below!

Vidéo YouTube™: Legend of Grimrock 2 Let's Play - Part 0 - Introduction & Character Creation 
Vues : 15,457
Legend of Grimrock 2 Let's Play, PC! Legend of Grimrock 2 is an old school grid-based dungeon crawling role playing game wherein players take control of a party of four prisoners that survive a...


Is it Adventure Worthy?

Legend of Grimrock 2 is an old school grid-based dungeon crawling role playing game wherein players take control of a party of four prisoners that survive a shipwreck and wash up on the mysterious Isle of Nex. They soon find out, however, that they are not alone and to make it off the island alive they have to overcome the challenges devised by the ominous mastermind of the island.

After playing around 10 hours (and counting) of Legend of Grimrock 2 I can tell you without the shadow of a doubt that the game has managed to take everything that I loved from the first Legend of Grimrock and somehow make it better. Almost Human Games have given us extra flexibility and variety when creating and setting up our party with new races, classes, abilities and perks, an expansive and open world to explore and survive in with a full day and night cycle, new multi-tiered zones ranging from tropical shorelines to rat-infested mines, lush jungles, to creepy graveyards, overgrown ruins to long forgotten tombs, ancient temples to poisonous swamps and then the freedom to move between them all at will and with ease. The game's engine handles the great outdoors wonderfully, too, and it all looks much better than I thought possible for a game of this type. There are now more secrets, puzzles, riddles and items than ever before and then, most importantly, the same great, addictive and thoroughly challenging old school style of gameplay and combat. Progression through the main plot of the game is done in a non-linear fashion that rewards players that take their time, explore and immerse themselves fully.

Grimrock 2 also features a built-in Dungeon Editor that seems a lot of fun. I've only briefly tested it but in the 15 minutes I spent using it I was able to create an actual dungeon I could walk around in. I plan on sinking some time into making my own content for the game once I've completed it.

Well, Is it?

All of that said and after playing an unhealthy amount of the game over the past couple of days I can say with much surity that Legend of Grimrock 2 is well worth your time and definitely worthy of a grand adventure! This game will appeal to long-time fans of the series, and now almost extinct genre, and newcomers alike. Although, it must be said, both of the aforementioned groups will still find themselves struggling with some of the enemies, challenges, puzzles and riddles presented to them during their time on the Isle of Nex.

Check my likes and dislikes below!

Legend of Grimrock 2 was developed and published by Almost Human Games and is the sequel to 2012's Legend of Grimrock. If you don't own and haven't played the original yet I recommend buying the Legend of Grimrock Bundle and playing the first game before the second, it is also a great experience and will let help you hit the ground running in Legend of Grimrock 2.

Likes / Dislikes

Here's my quick(ish) list of Grimrock 2 likes and dislikes. I didn't include everything in here, but hey, should still be enough to get you informed.

Likes:
  • New Party Creation System - Grimrock 1 had four races, three classes and only a handful of abilities to choose from. Legend of Grimrock 2 has a total of five races, eight classes and a large number of abilities, traits and more. You get to create a much more varied and fun-to-play party.

  • Freedom - After a brief introduction area you are thrown into a incredibly (for this type of game) large open world to explore at your own pace. This game is as open world and free as a first person dungeon crawler and grid based game can be and it works great. Is one particularly challenging puzzle or fight getting you down? No problem! Just leave it for later and try something else in the mean time. You get to go where you want, do what you want, fight what you want and loot what you want when you want.

  • The Great Outdoors - While playing through the first Legend of Grimrock I couldn't help but wonder what it would be like, and look like, if we could actually exit the dungeon and see the great outdoors... Wish granted! As I said above in Legend of Grimrock 2 we get to explore tropical shorelines, lush jungles, creepy graveyards, overgrown ruins, , ancient temples, poisonous swamps, long forgotten tombs, dungeons and mines, the beds of rivers with actual water in them (yes, underwater exploration is now a thing... see below.) and much more.

  • More Depth - The level design in Legend of Grimrock 2 has been improved upon greatly and levels can now be multi-tiered both indoors and outdoors. Why is this important? It all just looks that much better and feels that much more expansive when exploring. Makes for great, and confusing, puzzles!

  • Day / Night Cycle - You thought walking around a dungeon or mine was scary in the dark? Try a cemetary, or a poisonous swamp or even the bed of a river you just accidentally fell into... Night time in Legend of Grimrock 2 is great and terrifying all at the same time.

  • Secrets - There's always something more to find out there, trust me. With the game now being as open world as it is there are just so many more opportunities for hidden caches of treasure or secret areas than ever before and it truly is satisfying uncovering all the no doubt long-lost secrets.

  • The Challenge - Legend of Grimrock 2 is not easy. Even on the easiest difficulty setting the game can be brutal at times and I personally think it is for the better. Whether you're being teleported into a room full of face-eating zombies or whether like five swarms of killer wasps are spawning on top of you... It is always an exhilirating and ultimately rewarding experience to try escape with your party, and sanity, in tact.

  • A Better Map - In a game with as many secrets, hidden areas, puzzles and riddles as this it really, really helps to be able to put your thoughts down somewhere before losing them and the updated map is really great for that. The new visual style of it and the fact that you can have the all of the sprawling open world visible in one place is also kinda great.

  • The Sound - The Legend of Grimrock 2 sound and soundtrack is just absolutely brilliant. I honestly don't understand how they do it. I recommend playing the game with a headset turned up nice and loud. Also, the main theme.... Chills! Every time I listen to it.... CHILLS!

  • The Dungeon Editor / Custom Dungeons - SO GOOD! Even a map-making newbie like myself can actually throw something relatively decent together in no time at all and then, conveniently, share it on the Steam Workshop!
Dislikes:
  • The Island Master - He's a real jerk. Play the game, you'll understand.

  • Water - Wait, what, you're scared of water? HAHA! No, really, trust me on this one I'm not even joking around. The water on the Isle of Nex is the bane of anyone playing this game's existence. Unfortunately, however, as adventurers it is our sworn duty to explore everywhere... Even under the water... the dark, murky water...
I'll continue to update the likes and dislike section as I play through the game and learn more about it. Thanks for reading and rating, I hope you all have as much fun as I am playing Legend of Grimrock 2!

HAPPY THAT! :D
 
Lumin

Évaluation publiée le 25 octobre 2014
Excelente continuación de la 2ª parte, mejorando gran parte de los defectos de la primera entrega.

Ahora hay distintos enemigos, que hacen mas ameno el juego y no te hacen decir.. "vaya.. otra vez un caracol.. qué sorpresa!" (aunque hecho de menos a los caracoles.. que aquí no hay xD).
El combate es más díficil, algunos enemigos pueden golpear mientras se mueven lateralmente, lo cual el tipico "rondo" a las 4 casillas no siempre funciona. Eso sí.. me he encontrado enemigos mucho mas poderosos que algunos bosses...
Como he puesto antes, han añadido bosses al juego, además de las tipicas emboscadas al coger un item.

El juego es mitad al aire libre, mitad en mazmorra, así se hace menos agobiante y menos repetitivo, y ahora dan la posibilidad de "nadar".. o mas bien de hundirse hasta el fondo y avanzar bajo el agua mientras los pjs tengan aire xD.
Otro punto importante, es que no es para nada lineal, he tenido que dejar de lado algunos puzzles por imposibles.. y a las 3 horas encontrar una pista para solucionarlo en la otra punta del juego.

Hay mas clases y una raza nueva, han "simplificado" un poco el árbol de talento, pero aún así no lo considero tan malo como he leído en otros análisis.. como mucho tendrás 3 habilidades al máximo (He llegado a nivel 15.. y el nivel 16 lo veia bastante lejos). Por otra parte.. la alquimia ahora me resulta mucho mas importante e interesante, se pueden hacer bombas, pociones mejoradas y hasta pociones de estadisticas (fuerza, destreza...) .

Los puzzles como siempre geniales.. algunos realmente complicados y otros tan simples.. que tardas bastante tiempo en completarlo pq no se te ocurre esa solución que tienes enfrente.., o como cierta prueba de FE .. que probé al estar desesperado.. y esa era la solución.. xD

Por poner algo negativo.. es que la comida SOBRA, he acabado el juego ♥♥♥ 1 cajón y unas 5 bolsas llenas de comida. Esto se debe en parte de que ahora hay respawn (selectivo, porque no lo he encontrado en todas las zonas). La magia, al igual que en la 1ª parte también la veo escasa.

Respecto al argumento.. pues mas o menos es el mismo que el del 1º.. sólo que esta vez los prisioneros chocan en una isla.. deibdo a que una misteriosa figura altera el rumbo del barco. Hay bastantes guiños a la primera entrega, sobretodo uno que me ha dejado O.o xD

Nota final 9/10 . Pese a que está en inglés.. se merece esta nota.. y que bueno.. no hace falta traducir mucho, aunque debes de tener un minimo conocimiento para entender las pistas que te proporcionan tanto las notas como las estatuas.

♥♥: Tendría que hacer el mundo de Lemuria.. xD
 
Thronak
