Recommandé
45.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 décembre 2018
Legend of Grimrock 2 je výborným pokračováním série dungeon crawleru. Tato hra, stejně jako první díl, získala velkou popularitu nejen mezi starými, ale i mezi novými hráči. Příběh je již o něco zajímavější než v předchozím dílu a také dost tajemný. Dva odlišné konce to potvrzuji. Oldschoolový gameplay, lehce vylepšený moderními prvky, je opravdu záživný a od hry se člověk těžko odtrhne. Již se nepohybujeme jen v podzemí, jako to bylo v předchozím dílu, ale take putujeme pod širým nebem a objevujeme různorodé lokace. Graficky hra vypadá dobře a je opět plná skrytých míst pro pozorné hráče. Myslím, že tato hra se autorum opravdu povedla. Doporučuji tuto hru všem kdo má chuť na pořádný dungeon crawler a těm komu se líbil první díl.

+ záhadný příběh
+ oldschoolový gameplay
+ originální vizuální stranka
+ slušný výběr vybavení a schopností
+ různorodé lokace
 
Vartter

Évaluation publiée le 29 décembre 2016
I love this game and even did a second play-through earlier this year on hard difficulty. It is such a great game. I think it improves on the first game in almost every way although I'm undecided on whether the open world in the second game is better than the more linear dungeon crawl of the first. Ultimately, they are both really enjoyable games.

The areas in Legend of Grimrock II are wonderfully crafted, the exploration is fun, the atmosphere is fantastic, the combat is challenging and the puzzles are great. Can't recommend it enough. I intend to come back to this game at some point to try out some of the awesome looking mods on the Steam workshop.

I also really need to play through the first game again at some point as I enjoyed that one so much too. If you don't already own the first game, I suggest picking up the Legend of Grimrock bundle. This is an amazing series and I look forward to Almost Human Games announcing Legend of Grimrock III!

Recommandé
27.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 février 2020
Legend of Grimrock 2 is a first-person dungeon crawling experience, written and created in the same spirit of older games such as Eye of the Beholder, Lands of Lore and Dungeon Master. You play as a shipwrecked party of 4 (which you can create and customize yourself), who must work together to overcome monsters and puzzles in order to escape the island of Nex.

The game is a spiritual successor of its predecessor in virtually every aspect of the franchise. While in LoG1 you adventure through the eponymous Grimrock, a linear dungeon consisting of about 12 levels, LoG2’s Nex is more open world, providing an overland experience into different swamps, forests and beaches that house different dungeons. LoG also introduces the Ratling race, and includes the Battlemage, Alchemist, Knight, Barbarian and Farmer into playable classes.

Gameplay and combat take place on a 3d rendered grid, where every movement takes place on a “tile” of the map. Two party members serve as the “front line”, and two take their place in the back, usually with ranged weapons, spells or far-reaching weapons if they have the appropriate skill points.

The game’s difficulty is consistent; from the first giant turtles and Mermen you fight at the beginning to the Medusa, Ogres and Magma Golems you fight towards the end, the game will constantly push you and make things difficult, even when you think your party is balanced and fully-fleshed out. This makes party composition and each character’s builds vital, as spreading out their points too much will result in failure. Some skills are better than others – while alchemy and armor are almost vital, skills such as athletics and endurance fall off in their overall usefulness. Additionally, races and classes tend to subvert typical fantasy tropes and expectations. For example, you would think that a knight would stack strength and vitality, but their most prized stat is dexterity because it improves their chances to evade attacks. Minotaurs are more ideal for dealing ranged damage with throwing weapons because throwing attacks scale with strength instead of dexterity.

Much of the game is based around puzzles, which can range from being based on reflexes, logic, or riddles. Some of them are moon logic; for example, in order to get to the Temple of Water, you have to stand on a corner near the river at night and look towards the temple – eventually, a leprechaun will appear and walk over the air, creating a bridge behind him as he goes (consider that one a freebie). Some puzzles are solved by switches, which are disguised as circular or rectangular buttons in walls which can be easily missed at times.

TLDR – while the game does have a high learning curve and frustrating elements, the overall experience feels rewarding once you succeed
 
Spyder

Recommandé
153.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 juillet 2017
I never realized how bloated most RPGs are till I played Grimrock 2

There is, no economy, four party member slots, four stats and elements, and enough skill points by the end of the game to max three of the fifteen skills in the game, meaning everyone is gong to be real specialized. Yet the whole thing works seamlessly and flows like lavender flowers in a summer breeze. You can access your alchemy, inventory, everything just by hitting 1-4 on the keyboard to bring up that character; the action never stops. Iv'e been in the middle of fights, trying to keep it together long enough to just right click my motor and pedestal to make a health potion, or ducked out to allocated skill points because everyone leveled up.

On the whole, Grimrock 2 streamlines the whole RPG system without every feeling dumbed down, something Bethesda has been trying to do for over a decade now. I didn't know I wouldn't miss jamming my inventory with junk to sell, or staring at two very similar weapons for a minute or two to figure out which one does more damage. You have a sword? Here is a long sword, it does more damage. Done deal, drop the other one cause you can't sell it.

Oh, and the secrets. Grimrock 2 is packed with finding hidden levers and pressure plates leading to the best loot in the game, and for every really hard puzzle secret you figure out, you are rewarded proportionally. On the whole this is a major part of the game and I would spend and hour every time i saw a shiny thing I couldn't get too, going over the walls for that hidden button to get to it, which for some reason always felt exciting.

Finally let's talk about what really makes Grimrocker 2 Electric Boogaloo such a damn fine game. The world building and sense of adventure. I can't say I have ever been sucked into a fantasy world quite as hard as this one, the scenery is creepy and wondrous, then breath taking, then moody. It's all so immersive and fascinating. I really felt like I was in this place, experiencing the wonders and terrors of it. Kinda like how you feel when looking at concept art for a game, only to play it and realize that feeling didn't retain in translation. In Grimfandango 2 it does, wholly.

So picked it up, play it, master it. Once you know everything you can blow through it in eight hours or less, but spend that first play-through hunting and exploring, since you'll never get to experience it like that again once you've unraveled the secrets.
 
Zenuge

Recommandé
27.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 février 2017
Отличное продолжение отличной игры.

Разработчики не стали изобретать велосипедов и менять то, что и так работало, а просто сделали продолжение по простой формуле "больше и лучше".

В первой части декорации подземелья начинали навевать уныние и скуку ближе к середине игры? Пожалуйста, во второй части вы побываете и на пляже, и в лесу, и на кладбище, и в храмовой пирамиде. Пейзажи просты, но выглядят крайне свежо - чему немало способствует и смена времени суток (на чем, кстати, даже завязан ряд загадок и игровых механик).

Не хватало классов, рас, классов и перков? На здоровье, держите еще целый ворох, что безусловно делает создание отряда еще более увлекательным занятием. Особо порадовало введение огнестрельного оружия: после приевшихся арбалетов и луков выпускать залпом сразу пять пуль из многозарядного мушкета оказалось достаточно весело.

Бестиарий всевозможных чудищ тоже пополнился - большая часть мобов уникальна для этой части и в предыдущей не встречалась. Монстрам из прошлой части радуешься буквально как старым знакомым. К многим врагам требуется свой индвидуальный подход: чего стоят лиственные элементали, которых вообще не берет физическое оружие.

Насчет загадок и секретов: их также стало гораздо больше, а качество тоже возросло. В целом задачки стали очевиднее, но это не синоним "проще": в этой части почти не осталось различных секретных кнопок в самых неприметных углах, открывающих сюжетно важный переход в другом конце данжа. Большая часть загадок снабжается довольно элегантными подсказками, разгадывая которые получаешь массу удовольствия.

В целом, на сегодняшний день это, пожалуй, лучший современный данжн кроулер, который умудряется прекрасно выглядеть и столь же замечательно играться. Если вы любите игры такого плана, очень советую к покупке - 20-30 часов, отведенные на прохождение, пролетят совершенно незаметно.

8.5/10
 
Wayfinder
0
14 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
71.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 mars 2015
I'll start this review with saying, that I loved the first LOG and once I completed it, I went straight to google and queried "games like LOG" and "LOG 2 release date", knowing full well, there wasn’t a chance it was being developed yet, but just hoping it was, as the experience was fantastic. Well I got my wish! At current I have around 14hrs into the 2nd installment and have not been disappointed.

If you are reading these reviews to get an idea of gameplay, I can say the grid based movement system can be odd or awkward at first, if you have never experienced it but you really feel like you’re playing an old school dungeon crawler or a tile based board game and sink right into it after a handful of minutes. Don’t get this confused with turn based or real time pause type games like wasteland 2 or dragon age. This is real time with you being limited in movement to linear paths only. You move as you would with any other game using w a s and d in a linear fashion on an invisible grid. You can rotate within a grid square using q and r or rotate by dragging and pulling your mouse. You are also able to look around with the mouse within your FOV up, down and side to side. You are probably wondering why even utilize this and not just use free roam? The grid based system has a direct influence on combat, as you can only engage an enemy that is in a tile(s) directly in front of you - ranged weapon, firearms or magic can be cast/fired beyond 1 square. You cannot move diagonally. This makes combat difficult and tricky when multiple enemies are engaged with you. Back yourself into a corner and hope you have enough health potions to duke it out before your entire party gets wiped out.

This is a good spot to describe the party system. It’s a four party group stacked 2 x 2. The front two, typically are your tanks, damage dealer type heroes with the back being your spell casters and ranged weapon guys. This is pretty standard but important to understand how that works within the grid system. When facing directly in front of an enemy, the front two take the brunt of the damage while allowing your back row to cast and fire. Let an enemy flank your party and the back row now becomes the focus of the full force of an attack. This can be very troublesome as they typically don’t have the protection or armor the front row has.

Attacking can be confusing for a new player as you don’t actually click on the enemy to attack, like you would in a standard first person hacker. As long as the party is facing the block with an enemy in it, you simply click the item/weapon in your hand to perform the attack (in party box lower right hand corner). To cast a spell you first need to find the scroll, have the required skills/traits to cast it and finally to use, right click the hand and select the correct glyphs to perform the spell. You have to memorize these and perform them every time you cast a spell. There is no hot key for spells. Spells with multiple glyphs need to be drawn, by holding and dragging the mouse across the designated glyphs. This stumped me for a while as I was simply clicking them which are fine for single glyph spells but useless for more complex spells.

The world is full of secret chests and loot so keep an eye out for button like stones on walls. In fact whenever I go through a new area I always look left and right at every wall surface to find hidden wall buttons. Get used to doing this. Getting through the game will be considerably harder if you are not finding the secret items. All secret chests need lock picks to open! You find these in the world so search every last block. This is not like path of exile or another action RPG where they dump items on you. These lock picks are few and far between, in some cases you will have to make a decision which chest you want to open. In these circumstances I simply save it and test each one out for its contents (CONTENTS ARE NOT RANDOM) when you decide which chest has the most useful loot go to it, loot it and save it. Another great aspect of the secret chests is that some are buried around the world, so you may be given a treasure map and tasked with digging up areas looking for it.

So now to my favorite part of this game - the puzzles! This game has the best combination of RPG elements and adventure game puzzles. If you like complicated puzzles that you would often find in classic point and click adventure games, you will love these. They really make you stop and think, all while testing your sanity. They can be downright frustrating for some and near impossible for others, who don’t have the constitution or mental makeup for them. All, however, are very logical when the solution presents itself, from either trial and error, or simply when you fold and look it up online. Solving some of these will make you feel like a genius! And your efforts will be rewarded with a shimmering melody and a rare item or clue.

Without giving away any spoilers I would like to touch on the story and level layouts. Each unique area you access consist of outdoor open environments, coupled with a labyrinth of dungeons beneath. This differs significantly from the original where you were confined to the claustrophobic dark of the tunnels. This offers a nice respite from the stress of dungeon crawling IMHO. Its always a breath of fresh air, literally, when you make it out to the bright summer sun after spending hours, laboring in the rat infested deep. You are able to back track to previous levels in case you want to open a locked chest or forgot to do something important. I cant speak for the entire game, but at least to where i am, 14hrs in, i was able to go as far back to the opening beach. There is a running theme through the levels/areas, in regards to story quest items. You are not simply leveling and grinding for the sake of leveling. You collect story unique items which will most likely be used in some synergistic fashion at the climactic ending. I am no where near this but seeing how the levels have progressed thus far, it would be a logical deduction.

There are many game options at the start of a new game all of which allow you to scale the difficulty. Easy Normal and hard are the difficulty levels. In my opinion Normal can be difficult for new players or if your party is not balanced correctly so choose wisely. You also have the option of disabling the map function which forces you to draw your own maps on grid paper which is lots of fun tbh. It forces you to slow down and take note of things around you, as opposed to running through the dungeon in which case you can become quickly disoriented and lost. You will never really become lost but they are useful when running from an enemy(s) so you can keep your orientation so not to back yourself into a corner which as explained earlier can be game ending. Another option is to allow quick save anywhere in the game (f5). This in my opinion is too easy to spam so I choose the option to save at save crystals which are sparingly spread across the levels. One final option is to only be allowed 1 save per crystal. This is extreme and to be used with caution. You can do a lot before you come across another save crystal so dying before you reach it can be disastrous and for some a game ender all together.

I can't recommend this game any higher. Pick it up and you will have hours upon hours of fun. I am sitting at work writing this review because I can’t wait to get home to play it!
 
Glowing_Rose
2
15 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Meraviglioso. Vasto. Impegnativo.

Un gioco ♥♥♥ una struttura old school, ma nello stesso tempo moderno.

Giocato ai livelli più alti è davvero una sfida, e ♥♥♥ la miriade di segreti ed enigmi da scovare e risolvere, vi porterà via ore e ore , passate però sempre col desiderio di scoprire qualcosa di più di questa benedetta isola.

Grafica appagante e paesaggi e interni meravigliosi.

Un titolo che non può mancare nella vostra libreria, assolutamente.

Évaluation publiée le 24 novembre 2021
On se souvient de Canard PC tombant à genoux devant ce titre il y a quelques années.
Retour du "Dungeon Master" à l'ancienne : le case par case, en vue subjective, dans un donjon froid, humide et mortel.
Le 2 propose des passages en extérieur, mais on reste en galère.

Grimrock 
Une capture d'écran de Legend of Grimrock 2
Par : Sucrelune ✰


C'est un genre de tactical / survival / square / rpg à l'ancienne, sur des graphismes plus modernes et honorables, avec une belle ambiance old school, qui sent bon l'embuscade au bout du couloir, l'énigme tordue, et la torche qui vacille.

Personnellement je préfère les RPG ouverts, cheveux aux vents, la liberté d'une vaste map, avec villages et bergères égarées, mais GRIMROCK reste un bon moment. J'avoue ne pas l'avoir terminé car être perpétuellement en bute à un problème quelconque (♥♥♥-de-sac, casse-tête, ennemi trop gros etc) finit par me faire fuir vers des mondes ouverts où je fais qu'est-ce-que-je-veux-d'abord-ok.
 
Sucrelune ✰
815 produits enregistrés
0
14 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
28.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 octobre 2014
Mit Legend of Grimrock ist den Jungs von Almost Human Games etwas Besonderes gelungen: Sie haben damit schlicht und ergreifend das längst ausgestorbene Genre des First-Person-Dungeon-Crawlers wiederbelebt, modernisiert und sogar fast schon perfektioniert. Unser Test zu Legend of Grimrock 2 zeigt, dass sie der Perfektion noch mal ein gutes Stück näher gekommen sind.

Über den Entwickler:
Almost Human Games wurde im Jahr 2011 von einigen ehemaligen Remedy-Mitarbeitern gegründet, die beispielsweise an Titeln wie Max Payne 2 oder Alan Wake gearbeitet haben. Das Studio hat seinen Sitz in Espoo, Finnland und Legend of Grimrock war ihr erstes Projekt.

Darum geht es:
Rein spielerisch ist Legend of Grimrock 2 seinem Vorgänger sehr treu geblieben und es hat sich recht wenig verändert. In diesem Dungeon-Crawler steuern wir eine vierköpfige Gruppe aus Gefangenen, die auf einer einsamen Insel gestrandet ist. Es gilt, die mysteriöse Insel zu erforschen, düstere Verließe zu erkunden, finstere Kreaturen zu bekämpfen und jede Menge Rätsel zu lösen! Letztere machen einen Großteil des Spiels aus und bestehen aus kniffligen Item-, Logik- oder Schalterrätseln.

Das macht das Spiel besonders:
Eigentlich bietet Legend of Grimrock 2 keine wirklich Innovation, denn die meisten Elemente waren auch in den Klassikern Eye of the Beholder oder Dungeon Master sowie dem Vorgänger enthalten. Es ist aber einfach nur beeindruckend, um welch grandiose Fortsetzung es sich hierbei handelt, denn Teil 2 toppt den eigentlich bereits extrem guten Vorgänger in allen Bereichen! Das Spiel ist wesentlich länger, bietet neue Charakterklassen, neue Gegnerarten, neue Zauber, viele neue Items und sogar eine offene Spielwelt. Während Teil 1 noch ausschließlich in einem Dungeon stattfand, erkunden wir hier eine riesige Insel mit vielen abwechslungsreichen Umgebungen und sogar einen Tag/Nacht-Wechsel gibt es. Die offene Spielwelt lässt sich ein wenig mit der Dark Souls-Reihe vergleichen, denn auch hier können wir uns zurecht legen, welches Gebiet wir als nächstes bereisen. Hängen wir also bei einem Boss oder einem Puzzle fest, verlassen wir einfach das Gebiet, besuchen ein anderes und schauen einfach später wieder vorbei. Ohnehin gibt es auch abseits des Hauptstrangs viel zu tun, denn die Insel erweckt den Entdecker in uns. Überall findet man versteckte Items, vergrabene Schatztruhen oder optionale Rätsel. Man muss dazu erwähnen, dass der Schwierigkeitsgrad ziemlich hoch angesetzt ist, selbst auf der Stufe leicht stellt das Spiel eine Herausforderung dar, jedoch ist Legend of Grimrock 2 als einer der einsteigerfreundlichsten Verteter des Genres zu bezeichnen.

Das könnte das Spiel besser machen:
Es gibt wirklich nur sehr, sehr wenig, was man in Legend of Grimrock 2 besser machen könnte. Ich persönlich fand es eigentlich nur schade, dass das Spiel bislang nur in Englisch vorliegt und noch nicht für Linux und Mac OS X zur Verfügung steht. Das soll aber in Kürze nachgereicht werden. Andere Spieler könnten Probleme damit haben, dass die Story nicht wirklich anspruchsvoll ist und der Titel zudem über keine Sprachausgabe verfügt.

Preis/Leistungsverhältnis:
Legend of Grimrock 2 ist auf Steam zum Preis von 21,99 Euro zu haben. Der Preis ist absolut fair, schließlich bietet das Spiel nicht nur eine Spielzeit von weit über 20 Stunden, sondern eben auch einen Dungeon-Editor mit dem man dank Steam Workshop-Anbindung seine erstellten Dungeons mit der ganzen Welt teilen kann. Somit ist quasi für unendlichen Spielspaß gesorgt, zumal die Community des Spiels auch äußerst kreativ und fleißig ist! Die verschiedenen Schwierigkeitsgrade und Spielmodi/Schwierigkeitsstufen, wie beispielsweise den Old-School-Modus, in dem man seine Karten selbst einzeichnen muss, sorgen für weitere Spielzeit.

Fazit:
Ich kann mich nur vor Almost Human Games verbeugen, denn mit Legend of Grimrock 2 ist den Finnen nicht nur eines der besten Rollenspiele der letzten Jahre, sondern eben auch eine der besten Fortsetzungen überhaupt gelungen. Der zweite Teil ist dem Erstling in nahezu allen Bereichen überlegen, speziell die offene Spielwelt mit ihrem Tag/Nacht-Rhythmus bereichert das Spiel enorm. Ganz große Klasse!
 
nai
3,004 produits enregistrés
0
30 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
38.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 avril 2015
An amazing tile based dungeon crawler which, unlike the first game, has expansive outdoor sections. The visuals and art direction of this game mold an extremely impressive aesthetic appeal, taking advantage of current generation technology and bringing new life into the classic tile based RPG genre.

The difficulty Legend of Grimrock presents is just right, not consisting of too much gauntlet difficulty while not being too easy. Legend of Grimrock 2 also features and impressive soundtrack and the audio is of high quality. The level design is non-linear and effective, making a fascinating world of many paths to explore.

As a massive fan of games like Stonekeep and Wizardry, this game delivers an enjoyable experience for hardcore tile based-RPG players while being accessible to new players of the genre at the same time. Being a game of such nature it requires an in-depth party creation, stats, items, spells and good level design to keep interesting, of which Grimrock 2 delivers superbly.

This is a gift to players who are nostalgic of the 90's era RPGs who want something of the same except current, and to new players who are willing to invest some time into a different kind of RPG experience.

Legend of Grimrock 2 is a revival done right and gives me hope of the future of indie games, this is trully an extremely high quality product with a lot of love and care put into making it. AAA games these days are getting shallower and more boring by the release so really nice to see a rare gem like this pop up every once in a while.
 
Mr Hanky
1
13 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé

Évaluation publiée le 29 décembre 2019
10/10
While the first Grimrock was an homage to Eye of the Beholder 1, this one takes the concept and goes in a completely new direction. The island is a great world to explore with lots of different terrains, enemies, and puzzles to solve. Leaps and bounds better than the original (which was still quite good), my only complaint is that there isn't a Grimrock 3.

Recommandé
65.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 mai 2017
Идешь бывает по тоннелю, а за стеной, что то хрюкает или шипит, значит, что то упусти и начинаешь искать. А искать нужно много, конечно мелкие кнопки(секреты) под конец искать надоедает. Но в целом игра умная. А еще она умнее, когда играешь с одноразовыми сейвами(кристалы). Стоишь и думаешь, сразу ломанутся на удачу в ловушку, или еще посмотреть, понять механизм ее работы, потому, как в группе уже 1 сдох, а травок на зелья воскрешения не осталось. Дилемма. Рекомендую игру для "гамеров" с смекалкой. А если она тебя покинула, как меня еще в универе, то есть руководство в стиме.

Took everything good about the first game in the series and expanded in every direction. The open world concept and non-linear progression add to the replayability. The character creation alone can give you a solid 3-4 playthroughs that are completely different depending on your class set up. Love this game, and (not so) patiently awaiting the 3rd installment.

Recommandé
116.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 septembre 2018
Light years ahead of it's older sibling though just as, if not more puzzle heavy. Immaculate presentation concerning animation, lighting and environments. Real time combat, the signature of this series remains strong with improved monster A.I. however there isn't enough combat. Open world so you can navigate where you want however difficulty lessens as your party gets stronger. Elites so to speak are unfortunately easily exploitable by game mechanics. Very much recommended but may wear thin for many. Personally I had enough and did not bother with the "true ending".

My largest complaint with the first game was the need to examine almost every wall for secrets. Thankfully the sequel is not as dependent due to more varied environments though wall scanning is really a lousy way to implement environment secrets.
 
Sysgen

Évaluation publiée le 12 novembre 2014
ПРОСТО НЕЙМОВІРНА ГРА! Так можна описати гру, в декількох словах після денної гри в неї :)

Дуже цікава гра, за неї варто віддати гроші, ви не пожалієте. Вона забире у вас багато годин гри, днів, навіть тижнів. Геймплей простий, до неймовірності. Ходи, вбивай, шукай, сь і все. Але вона... бляха затягує тебе повністю. Ти навіть і не замітиш скільки часу пройшло від твого старту.

Багато різноманітніх монстрів, босів, загадок, цікавих предметів. Після кожної розгаданої
головоломки, ти вигукнеш: "ТАК! Я це зробив! САМ розгадав!" У грі дійно багато головоломок, які не так вже й просто вирішити, без допомоги інтернету.

37.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 octobre 2014
Legend of Grimrock 2 est sans aucun doute un beau bijou, malheureusement serti sur une monture de piètre qualité. Des décors en extérieur sublimes, des environnements variés, des puzzles intelligents... L'ergonomie du jeu reste quant à elle inchangée et les soucis du précédent opus sont toujours présents, ce qui ternit sensiblement une expérience qui aurait pu être réellement novatrice si elle ne ressemblait pas autant à une simple « campagne additionnelle ». La critique complète sur indius.org : http://indius.org/tests/legend-of-grimrock-2/

364 produits enregistrés

29 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
356.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 octobre 2014
Bigger isn't always better. But in Legend of Grimrock 2, it's better most of the time.

They've kept what made Legend of Grimrock great, rectified some of its failings and generally expanded much on variety and content. The latter brings a failing new to Grimrock. Some of the puzzles and their clues span the game world and can require quite a bit of backtracking if you missed some clue along the way, or didn't bother writing it down.

But these incidents are few and far between compared to all the goodness this game has to offer. New dangerous-looking enemies make it harder to dance around the less-than-up-to-it AI of the first game. I won't spoil it for you, but some enemies were just genious. The new environments, including outdoor ones, are varied and beautiful. New puzzle elements bring spice to the old formula, allowing you to feel different kinds of clever upon solving them. (Or different kinds of stupid!)

Class and skill systems have been revised, with additional classes and a new race - the ratlings.

In short, if you liked the first one, you're gonna love this one.

9/10
 
Andvari

El equipo de Almost Human Games vuelve a sorprenderme gratamente ♥♥♥ otro excelente juego de mazmorras estilo años 90. Cuando yo pensaba que ya lo habían dado todo ♥♥♥ Legend of Grimrock, dan a luz esta segunda parte que es, como se suele decir, lo mismo, pero mejor, siendo un juego más grande, abierto y variado.

Hago un análisis más detallado en este vídeo de Tormenta de plomo:

Vidéo YouTube™: Tormenta de plomo presenta: Legend of Grimrock 
Vues : 205
Hacía más de 20 años que nadie ponía un pie en aquellas oscuras y frías mazmorras. Las leyendas hablan de trampas mortales y criaturas malignas, pero también de tesoros míticos, magia y aventura.
 
Ricardo
598 produits enregistrés

14 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
46.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 aout 2019
Несмотря на «Палец вверх», это скорее нейтральный отзыв. Я не могу рекомендовать эту игру всем, но каких-либо негативных впечатлений она не оставила.

Серия Legend of Grimrock — дань классическим ролевым играм из 80-90-х, яркий представитель того, как можно сделать приятную на вид игру с набором интересных задумок на скромный бюджет.

Как оно выглядит?

Как было сказано выше, у игры достаточно симпатичная картинка. Мною был сделан выбор в пользу второй части, т.к. в первую я не играл и посчитал, что видеть только одни подземелья будет скучно. И, пожалуй, не прогадал. Песчаный берег сменился густым лесом, а за ним древние руины и замки. Под поверхностью многослойный пирог из подземелий. Но, как мне кажется, дизайн всего этого добра оставляет желать лучшего. Нет, проблема не в отсутствии фантазии у авторов. Скорее, наоборот, в ее бурности. Складывается впечатление, что в игру старались засунуть как можно больше всего, как будто отыгрывались за первую часть, где были сплошные подземелья. И нагромождение различных архитектурных стилей выглядит странно и делает локации бессвязными.
Звуки природы, эхо в тесных подземельях сделаны на славу и, как по мне, создают большую часть атмосферы. Но вот хоть убейте, звуки при ранениях и «последний вскрик» персонажа, у которого упало HP до 0, будто бы взяли из Gothic 1-2.

Как оно играется?

Геймплейно игру можно разделить на две части: пазлы и сражения. Пазлам могут позавидовать классические point & click адвенчуры. И под стать хардкорным старым играм они бывают зубодробительными. Не знаю, чтобы я делал без интернета, так как некоторые из загадок могли решить только чертовы гении! Исследования для игр такого типа является важным элементом. И здесь оно отлично сделано: внимательность вознаграждается замечательным лутом и необходимой информацией.
Небольшие элементы выживания работают на атмосферу. Партии необходимо время от времени кушать, и на помощь приходит рыбная ловля. Хотя еду можно найти в многих местах. Тяжелые ранения поможет исцелить алхимия.
Со сражениями не все так однозначно. Очень простая и незамысловатая на вид ролевая система с практически стандартным набором классов и рас (в плане характеристик). Однако, система неотлаженная и очень несбалансированная. Атрибуты (за исключением Ловкости) дают минимальные бонусы и мало влияют на что-либо. Среди навыков также есть перекос: есть как совершенно бесполезные скиллы, так и просто жизненно необходимые. Но о значимости навыка ты поймешь только тогда, когда начнешь играть. Достаточно любопытная система магии на рунах. Новые заклинания можно узнать не только из находимых свитков, но и экспериментируя.
Люди, которые жаловались на BG-подобные игры с тактической паузой, могут прийти в ужас от местной боевки. Она реалтаймовая безо всяких пауз. Да еще и перемещаться приходится периодически! Но не все так страшно, к ней быстро привыкаешь и легко осваиваешь. Разнообразный бестиарий врагов не даст заскучать, и каждая тварь со своими особенностями. К сожалению, с боссами не все так радужно. Практически все они просто жирные противники, да еще и в последствие встречающиеся как рядовые враги. И тактика в сражении с ними сводится к «бегай вокруг и тычь всем по кд».
При этом у игры отличный баланс между решением загадок и уничтожением всего живого. Тебя не забрасывают мясом до посинения или не заставляют сидеть сутками над решением головоломок.

А как же сюжет?

А его нет! Вступительный ролик и финальный. Все что тут есть. Персонажи — лишь портреты в углу экрана и не воспринимаются как полноценные личности. Есть только мотивация у игрока пройти игру, а не у персонажей выбраться с острова. Отсутствует коммуникация персонажей с миром и между собой. Конечно, есть Мастер, который общается с игроком через записочки. И под конец, только если выйти на «истинную» концовку, игроку объяснят, что все было не зря.
Очень скупой лор, который объясняет все лишь в размытых мазках. И хотя этого достаточно, чтобы понять ключевые особенности мира Grimrock’а, но он заслуживает больше пары слов.

А что там внутри?

Игра сделана на собственном движке студии. Что вызывает уважение, учитывая, что студия маленькая (если верить интернету – она состоит из 4-х человек). Замечательная особенность движка в том, что фанаты сами могут создавать приключения на базе игры, что, несомненно, в плюс и игре, и разработчикам.

Ну и какой из всего этого вывод?

Не поймите меня неправильно, играя, я получил удовольствие. У игры прекрасная атмосфера Робинзона Крузо с мечом и магией. Чувствуется дух приключения и исследования. У игры четко выверенное равновесие между элементами геймплея. Но разработчики заключили свой талант в чересчур архаичную оболочку. Legend of Grimrock слишком близка к своим идолам, по образу которых она создавалась. Хардкор здесь сосредоточен в пазлах и банальному непониманию что делать или куда идти. Эту игру стоит рекомендовать с большой осторожностью, и она скорее понравится тем, кто хочет узнать, как играли наши предки.
 
Sergio_Corey
356 produits enregistrés
9
11 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
45.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 janvier 2018
Ca faisait quelques années que Grimrock 2 se reposait tranquillement dans ma bibliothèque. Il aurait pu faire parti de ces nombreux jeux jamais joués mais c'est sans compter sur mon impression de Grimrock, premier du nom, qui m'avait fait découvrir le Dungeon Crawler et j'avais adoré !

J'avoue que j'ai encore plus adoré.

TEAM-BUILDING
J'ai adoré passer deux heures à plannifier mon équipe de 4 héros. J'ai adoré lire des guides qui t'expliquent que, contrairement aux croyances, c'est le mage le plus tanky, j'ai adoré voir toute la diversité et les possibilités de construction de personnages. Puis au bout de 4 heures à avoir construit avec la plus grande planification mon équipe (et avoir recommencé le jeu car je m'étais trompé), j'ai eu le sentiment d'accomplissement qui est plutôt rare pour un RPG. Ma voilà parti avec mon Gros Insecte Barbare Danseur d'Epées, mon Petit Insecte Mage de Combat, mon Mage Fermier (qui gagne de l'exp en mangeant), et mon Minotaure Rogue-Crit Lanceur de Haches !

Et c'est là où vient le premier argument qui peut être un défaut comme un avantage : c'est clairement old school et légèrement nerd. Si vous correspondez à cette catégorie, vous passerez les premières heures les plus kiffantes de votre vie à planifier votre équipe (avant même que le jeu ne soit lancé), sinon je vous conseille de mettre le jeu en "facile" sans trop se prendre la tête pour un jeu qui reste dur. Le jeu reste très punitif si vous planifiez mal votre équipe (j'ai joué en hard et c'était pas de tout repos).

UN JEU MAGNIFIQUE
Le second argument est l'univers. Alors qu'on était dans le plus grand dongeon de l'univers vidéo-ludique à ma connaissance dans le premier Grimrock (qui était aussi une prison), vous vous retrouvez sur une île splendide où presque chaque endroit est une belle découverte : une plage paradisiaque, une pyramide egypticienne, un désert, un marécage, un cimetière et les couloirs de ses catacombes ! Vraiment, j'ai adoré découvrir l'île, voyager, se faire surprendre tant par le décors que par les monstres et pièges qui l'habitent. Le jeu est beau.

UN JEU A L'ESPRIT OLD SCHOOL
Finalement, le dernier argument, c'est la qualité et la profondeur du gameplay : tout tourne autour d'énigmes dont certaines sont extrêmement difficiles. Autant l'avouer : la plupart du temps j'ai eu besoin d'indices en cherchant sur internet (ouai, j'avoue ^^) mais cela n'a rien retiré de la qualité du titre et je suis persuadé que les joueurs patients et aimant se creuser, en essayant toutes les combinaisons possibles, seront ravis. Pour moi, c'est surtout ça que j'ai adoré dans cet esprit "old-school" : vous n'êtes pas pris par la main. Vous pouvez tout accomplir par votre seule intelligence, votre patiente et votre persévérance mais pour les autres, il reste internet et le jeu n'a pas besoin de vous prendre par la main.

CONCLUSION
Finalement, j'ai adoré la fin qui est bien plus satisfaisante que le premier et qui récompense réellement ceux qui ont été observateurs. Vraiment parfait pour un Dungeon Crawler. Je conclurai par un défaut : c'est un monde ouvert où les moins acharnés auront vite fait d'êtres ennuyez par la complexité des énigmes et la mauvaise idée et de laisser le puzzle qui vous a bloqué et partir à l'autre bout de l'île faire autre chose. Il faut faire le jeu de manière méticuleuse et organisé sinon ça peut vite tourné à la catastrophe : c'est à dire finir les dongeons un par un de manière complète pour s'assurer de ne pas avoir oublié d'objet nécessaire pour la suite de l'histoire. Là dessus, bon jeu :)

Si l'avis vous a aidé, n'hésitez pas à mettre un pouce en l'air, sinon mettez un pouce en bas ou réagir en commentaire (ça peut aider les autres lecteurs). Si d'autres de mes avis vous intéressent : La liste de mes recommandations

Vous pouvez voir mon profil complet ici : Blaystro désolé pour le moment, je n'accepte pas les demande de connexion :'(
 
Blaystro

Classic in the genre that still holds up today. The sequel has more open stage design, player frequenting between both outdoor and indoor segments of the island, which has allowed the developers to craft really fun and creative exploratory experience.

Combat from first Legend of Grimrock are kept and improved, so I definitely recommend this game to those who enjoyed the gameplay of the predecessor.

1
Recommandé
10.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 juin 2021
Giving this game a thumbs up because its fun and it is definitely an improvement over part 1 in terms of combat/leveling/abilities and stuff. The problem I have with it is that it's not linear like part 1. "But wait, isn't non linear a good thing??" you might say. Not really! Not in a game like this because it takes a lot of doubling back in order to progress and very soon you start to forget where you have been and where you still need to go.

In a linear game like part 1 you just go forward constantly so it's really impossible to get lost. In this game you are basically forced to take a lot of notes or have a second computer next to you with a map/walkthough opened up. I can't make progress in this game just by keeping track of things in my head or with only the in-game provided tools (map/journal). I always have to use outside help in the form of a walk-through. If this doesn't bother you then go ahead and buy it.
 
ChestRockwel
0
20 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
71.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 décembre 2014
前作legend of grimrockの正統進化作品。
前作の方がボリューム、難易度ともに遊びやすいので
3Dダンジョンモノに興味がある方にはまずそちらをオススメします。


前作からの変更点
・キャラメイクがバリエーション豊かに
前作に比べて種族数が1、クラスが大幅追加されキャラメイクの楽しみが増しています。何の特技もないやりこみ用クラスもあり。
キャラクターのポートレートを追加するのも本体ファイルをunpack→追加→再びpackingと面倒だった前作に比べ、画像ファイルをtga形式にしてフォルダに放り込むだけと簡略化されています。

・マッピング機能の充実
前作では文章書き込みくらいしかありませんでしたが記号が追加されたためマッピングしやすく
また、あとで読んだ時に一目でわかりやすくなっています。
手書きマッピング用にはなんと雰囲気のあるプリント用の方眼紙画像まで用意してあります。

・戦闘難易度の上昇
前作に比べ序盤から敵の数が多く、素早い敵や振り向きながら攻撃する敵も増えているため難しくなっています。
負傷（部位によって行動に制限を受ける）という要素も追加されたため、
pitに落ちると腰を負傷し魔法使いクラスがMPを自然回復しない、
殴りあっていたら前衛が腕を負傷し武器を振れない、といった状況に陥りなれないうちはそのまま崩れてしまうことも。
（負傷はポーションで回復可能な他、武器を別の腕に持ち替えれば攻撃することはできます。）
とりあえず興味があって前作未プレイの方は前作を先にプレイしたほうがいいかもしれません。

一方で謎解きの難易度も高くはなっていますが
理にかなったものや見方を変えることが大切なものが多く、その点ではオススメできるでしょう。


不満点は優遇されている武器、属性とそれ以外での差が大きいこと。
属性に関しては状態異常や敵の攻撃に対して抵抗を持つので基本的にどうとっても損はないですが、
唯一水属性だけ属性レベル1で扱える攻撃魔法が無いため最序盤は後列に立っているだけになってしまいます。

武器攻撃に関しては強さの多くの部分を武器のステータスに依存するため後半に強い武器のないスキル持ちは火力がやや出しにくいです。
が、どうやっても役に立たないという武器種はないのでこちらはあまり気にせず選べると思います。


目についた点はとりあえずこれくらいで、全体的にかなり遊びやすく進化しています。
個人的にはこの手の3Dダンジョンの中でもトップクラスの面白さでした。
前作を楽しめた方は是非！
 
olba
0
12 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante

Évaluation publiée le 4 décembre 2022
While I love everything about this game, there's a glaring flaw to this game however. This game is NOT deaf/HOH friendly. There's a few puzzles that requires you to hear. There's ways around this however, but it takes a LOT more trial and error to understand what happened. :(

Recommandé
55.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 septembre 2017
Bought this game in the bundle with part 1 and am currently playing it.

I think I'm about halfway through and so far enjoy it incredibly!
It has all the positive aspects of the first game, in that is is a fun, true-to-the-genre kind of grid-based Dungeon Crawler with a solid automap, amazing puzzles and interesting level design, but boy, does it have more!

After the success of the simple-yet-fun first game, this one has a lot more production value to it. There are more tilesets in the first hour or two than in the entire first game. There are way more monsters, way more options for your characters, and so on. They also improved (in my opinion) the already-solid class, leveling, magic and alchemy systems of the previous game.

I feel that the difficulty is sometimes quite a bit higher than before. There's a bunch of fights that just seem broken, but once you figure them out, and finally decide to use some of those consumables you've been hoarding "in case you ever need them", become doable. But you need to think and play well. An actual challenge, who'd have thought!?

The one thing I disliked at first was the new injury system. One bad roll of the dice against the wrong enemy, and your hero can't use one of his hands anymore, walks super slow, or the likes. But then that makes you actually use (and not just hoard) all those healing potions, which turns out is kind of a good thing.

I highly recommend the first game to anyone interested in this genre and I absolutely recommend playing the first one first, because having played it definitely improved my experience of the second one. But man, the second one is even better! :D
 
TrixieButtons
0
100 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
14 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
3
Non recommandé
22.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 janvier 2017
I really want to recommend this game, but it's hard to bring myself to do that when I am looking for other games to play before I have even finished this one.

I played the first game and I LOVED it. I couldn't wait for the second one to come out. Now that I have finally managed to get around to playing it (I have tons of games and sometimes I don't get around to it) the second doesn't live up to the first.

The first game was fairly linear. You go through a level of the dungeon, find everything and move on. Sometimes you come across a puzzle, usually very satisfying with a little bit of chin stroking, and feel a sense of accomplisment when you were done.

In the second game however, when you come across a puzzle or an area that you can't seem to pass, you have to ask yourself, "Am I missing something? Something that I am just not seeing? Or do I have another objective on the other side of the damned game map that I have to finish first?" Annoying as ♥♥♥♥!

Don't get me wrong, the puzzles are smartly made, but if I have to travel to the ends of the Earth and back just to get an item to pass this puzzle, I would like a clue that tells me as much. That's a major problem with this game, it doesn't tell you if you are stuck because the puzzle is either that hard, or you are missing an item, switch, or button.

I have found myself skipping large areas because I thought I had to come back later, then I got stuck in another area, ran around the map for HOURS trying to figure out what to do next, then I finally came back to the original area only to find out I missed a God forsaken button....♥♥♥♥! I have a wife and 4 kids, I don't have hours to stick my thumb up my butt looking for buttons.

Oh, and these puzzles aren't for finding secrets, they are to advance the main part of the game. It would be different if they were just side areas. That would vastly increase the replayability. You know how to beat the game, you just want to play it again to see what else there is or whatever reason you would replay a game for.

Anyway, I can't recommend it unless you have too much time on your hands and you either don't mind wasting it, don't mind googling the solutions, or you have lot's of thumbs and butts to put them in.
 
undefind1223
472 produits enregistrés

Recommandé
54.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 juillet 2020
Je viens juste de battre le boss de fin… petite cinématique alors que je quitte enfin l’île… mais ? une personne observe mon départ, ne serais-ce-pas la bonne fin ? Je me disais aussi que j’avais des cristaux en trop dans mon sac… Voilà Grimrock 2 : quand on a fini il en reste encore.

Vraiment beaucoup, beaucoup de choses à explorer dans ce Grimrock 2. Si on commence doucement, très vite les zones à explorer sont de plus en plus vaste et avec une grande quantité de puzzles et de secrets à découvrir. J’ai trouvé les combats plus difficile (même en normal) que le précédent, les énigmes quant à elles trouvaient assez facilement leurs réponses, à part quelques-unes plus obscures. Mais rassurez-vous la plupart du temps on arrive à progresser, en effet, le jeu est tellement dense en terme de pistes qu’il est parfois préférable, lorsque l’on bute sur une porte/grille/situation, d’essayer un autre endroit pour reposer son esprit et de revenir à la charge plus tard.

Fans de Eye Of The Beholder et/ou de Grimrock 1 n’hésitez pas!

Recommandé
85.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 décembre 2017
One of the best games I've ever played.
The dungeoning, the gameplay, the puzzles... oh god and the amazing atmosphere. You really feel like you're in the game itself, fighting to survive out there, trying to solve the mystery of the island. I love how some of the dungeons legitimately frighten you, like the graveyard, the pyramid and the final dungeon. Kept going forward at a snail's pace, haha. The first person view fits this game so well, it makes the game one big adventure. What's also great is the satisfaction you feel when you solve a (difficult) puzzle - and there are plenty of those in this game, some of which are particularly memorable (like the laboratory pit puzzle).
Can't recommend this game often enough!

Few will review this game and not re-count how amazing those games were to those who remember them. I think this game doesn’t just build upon the classics it surpasses their accomplishments. I

Recommandé
14.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 janvier 2015
O game segue na linha do primeiro, mas com gráficos melhorados, cenários externos, uma nova raça e algumas classes novas. Ótimo jogo para os fãs do gênero. Outra grande vantagem é que o jogo não é mais linear, permitindo mais exploração.

Entretanto, ainda falta no jogo NPCs mais trabalhados, comércio e outros elementos que podem ser encontrados em similares como Might and Magic Legacy ou clássicos como Eye of The Beholder. As classes ainda são muito centralizadas em um único atributo e habilidades não relacionadas a combate praticamente não tem valor nenhum.

Évaluation publiée le 12 mai 2020
This fantastic throwback to old school RPGs improves upon the first game in nearly every way. The more open environments above ground are beautiful and bring a welcome change of scenery over the first game.
This game does seem a touch more difficult than the first but I am still early in the playthrough so that may change.
If you enjoy the old school dungeon-crawlers, well-crafted RPGs, or just love hunting for secrets, definitely give this game a shot!

Recommandé
25.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 31 octobre 2014
"Горячие финские" парни уже во второй раз показывают, какой должна была быть Might & Magic 10. Хоть вторая часть и вызывает несколько вопросов по сравнению с первой частью, но впечатления от игры сугубо положительные.

Из плюсов:
- Красивая графика. Выглядит это все, конечно, не как в "этом самом крузисе", но очень достойно;

- Сложные загадки. Как и в первой части, паззлы заставляют подумать. Некоторые заставляют думать и по десять, и по двадцать, и даже по тридцать минут;

- Достаточно открытый мир. Открытость относительная: можно проходить 5-6 ключевых локаций в разной последовательности, но это добавляет разнообразия;

- Улучшенный по сравнению с первой частью интерфейс. Многие вещи стало более удобно делать: крафтить, выбирать набор оружия и т.п.

Теперь минусы. Минусы достаточно специфичны, некоторые могут с ними согласиться, некоторые - нет:
- Подача сюжета. Хуже - только в польских шутерах. В первой части мы находили записки от заключенного, который добрался очень и очень далеко в тюрьме. Во второй же части нас ожидает какой-то невнятный злодей "Ухаха, я мировое зло". Дракон в комплекте прилагается. Нет связности, нет логики, нет проработанности. Короче, авторы забили полностью;

- Сомнительная система прокачки. Во-первых, НЕ качайте Firearms. Пули расходуются и улетают в никуда, а вот стрелы, ножи и камни - нет. Во-вторых, все как-то чрезмерно упростилось. Универсальных солдат сделать вам не дадут, а слияние отдельных видов оружия в разделы Heavy Weapon и Light Weapon несколько убивает интригу;

- Очень плохой дизайн локаций. Я думал, что будет лучше, но дизайн очень плохой. Местами и редко, что радует. Но эти моменты выбесят вас гарантированно. Некоторые плиты, открывающие ключевые ворота, освещены настолько плохо, что непонятно, как вообще их можно разглядеть. Некоторые сюжетные кнопки и прочие механизмы слишком сильно замаскированы - да так, что можно застрять на этих областях очень надолго;

- Очень плохой дизайн локаций-2. В сравнении с первой частью авторы решили пострадать гигантоманией и отгрохать просто гигантские данжи. В итоге проходить что-то однотипное приходится часами, и это очень часто надоедает. Да, в первой части - данжи, данжи, данжи. Но там очень сильно менялась местная "флора и фауна", это добавляло разнообразия. Тут же приходится убивать по сто двадцать пауков без намека на кого-то другого. Вдобавок, появились квесты из разряда "принеси вещь из одного конца карты в другую карту".

Что в сухом остатке? Игру я определенно рекомендую, особенно если вы не играли в первую часть. Если играли, то с некоторой долей вероятности вас заденут некоторые новые особенности геймплея. Не то, чтобы "ВАЩЕ НЕ ПОНРАВИЛАСЬ, ВЕРНИТЕ МНЕ МОИ ДЕНЬГИ", но где-то "скука, скука, скука, оп, новый топор, радость, радость".
 
Tyler Insight
0
11 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
39.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 juin 2022
An enjoyable, old school dungeon crawl (with modern conveniences). While the first game took place entirely in underground dungeons, much of this game takes place on the surface with various dungeons scattered throughout. Graphics are improved over the first game, a new race is added, a new weapon type is added, and there are many other small improvements made over the first game. I managed to beat the game on Hard, but it was no walk in the park. I enjoyed character creation and combat, but I must admit that I HATED the puzzles so much that I likely would have quit the game were it not for a fan-made guide I printed before hand (I found the guide online). With the guide in hand, the puzzles were a breeze. But I probably would have quit in frustration if I did not have a guide handy. Some of the puzzles are just too tough. Do yourself a favor and print a guide first.

Recommandé
60.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 décembre 2015
Autant le Legend of Grimrock 1, bien que sympathique, n'était pas à la hauteur d'un dongeon master (le premier dongeon crawler du genre - les gars, si vous n'y avez jamais joué, sautez sur un émulateur, les graphisme sont pourris aujourd'hui je vous l'accorde, mais le jeu est mythique), autant ce deuxième opus a pris en considération tous les défauts du 1 pour les balayer.

Désormais, la progression des personnages est mieux foutue, les objets plus intéressants (bien que j'ai toujours un doute sur l'utilité des objets à charges limitées), et surtout le scénario plus complexe et la carte moins linéaire : gigantesque sans qu'on s'y perde (un véritable challenge pour le game designer). On peut reprocher, et on le comprendra, le manque de consistance de ce genre d'aventure, sans rencontre ni dialogue, hormis quelques parchemins glanés ça et là, mais ce genre de jeu pose l'intérêt autre part : la recherche d'une progression à travers un bourbier de monstres et d'énigmes qui imposent des choix drastiques, une réflexion sur les priorités, du plaisir à monter ses persos et une réactivité parfois instantanée.

Pari réussi !

Messieurs les Scandinaves, ça fait plaisir de voir un jeu stylé de la vieille école revisité avec talent !

Évaluation publiée le 28 juin 2016
My old review sucked, and only 1 person found it helpful.

First off, Play Legend of Grimrock 1 first. I strongly recommend doing this, as it will help you get into the right mindset for this game.
I also recommend some Might and Magic games, X is my favourite but many people will tell you it's not the best.

Now, this game, the one I'm supposedly writing a review for...... Right, Well, Let's get started.
Compared to the first game, this one has a lot more customization for your party, and a much much MUCH larger world. Many more puzzles and chests are potentially evil bastards. (Mimics anyone?)
If it was just more Grimrock, then I'd be happy, because more Grimrock is good, but this is more Grimrock and updated content to be better! My old review hated this game, I will point out that for the first few hours I was really bad at it and didn't give it much of a chance, that is why I think you should try the first one and similar games first.

Sorry, I've rambled a bit, my ability to write reviews is questionable. But you should definitely try this game and if not this one, others that are similar.

I might clean this review up some day, it's kinda messy. But eh, we will see.

FallenDrow
0
10 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
128.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 décembre 2016
Özet

İlk oyunun ardından hemen ikinci oyuna başlayınca insan cidden yerinde duramıyor. Bu sefer tek zindan yerine kocaman bir ada var. Karakter yaratımında ırk ve sınıf çeşitliliği arttırılmış, yetenek ağaçları sadeleştirilmiş ama daha işlevsel hala getirilmiş. Aynı şekilde silahlar ve zırhlarda artış sağlanmış ama büyücü ve avcı sınıfları için yeteri kadar zırh konmamış. Büyü sayısında bir tanecik artış olmuş ancak büyüleri çeşitlendirmişler ama yetersiz. Büyü kullanımı hızlandırılmış ki bu en güzel şeylerden biri. Zorluklarda hala bir dengesizlik mevcut ama düşman baskınlarını azaltmışlar. Düşman tipleri, saldırı biçimlerinde çeşitlilikle birlikte bir sürü bölüm sonu düşmanı bulunuyor. Bilmece ve bulmacalar ise tadından yenmeyecek kadar çok, ilginç, zor ve çözmesi keyifliler. Elimizde tekrar tekrar oynanabilecek yaşayan kocaman bir adaya ve bilmeceleriyle birlikte dolu dolu bir oyun var.

Lands of Lore gibi sıra tabanlı savaş sistemini içeren oyunları sevenler için hayal kırıklığı olabilir ama bu türden bir oyunu ilk defa deneyecek oyuncular için kesinlikle önerilir.

Maceramız...

Tutsak olarak bulunduğumuz geminin yolculuk yaparken büyüsel bir gücün ve fırtınanın etkisiyle savrulup karaya oturmasıyla başlıyor. İçinde olduğumuz kafesin sağ salim kıyıya vurması ile kontrol bize geçiyor. Başta her şey rastgele olmuş gibi gözükse de aslında olaylar biraz daha farklı olduğunu kısa sürede öğreniyoruz. Bulunduğumuz sahilden biraz ilerlediğimizde başka bir geminin kalıntıları arasında bir mektuba rastlıyoruz. Adanın Efendisi tarafından yazılmış olan bu mektup, koca adayı bizi sınamak için tasarladığını ve maceramızın sonuna kadar hayatta kalırsak bizi nelerin beklediğine dair ufak bir uyarısı. Adanın iç kısımlarına ilerlediğimizde büyük bir kale girişi ve dört elementi temsil eden heykellere rastlıyoruz. Bizden önce adada bulunan Kaptan Kilgahan, Büyücü Xafi gibi kişilerin notları, adaya ait yazıtlar ve mezar taşları ile ada hakkında bilgiler edinsek de ben pek dikkat etmedim. Başta sadece hayatta kalmaya çalışsak da zamanla Adanın Efendisi'nin mektupları ile ona ulaşmamız gerektiğini öğreniyoruz. Senaryo genel itibari ile bu, ilk oyunda olduğu gibi yemek ve hayatta kalmak için önümüze gelen düşmanları alt ediyor, bilmece ve bulmacaları çözüyoruz. Adanın Efendisi, bıraktığı notlar ile bir şeylerin farkına varmamızı istiyor. Dört elementten farklı olarak beşinci bir elementin varlığından haberdar oluyoruz. Etraftaki büyülü heykel yüzler bize bolca bahsediyor bundan. 'Görüşünüzün ötesinde..." gibi.

İlginç sırların olduğu macera adası

Tek parça ada olmasına rağmen zindan, mağara, piramit, mezarlık, bataklık gibi hem açık hem kapalı bölgeler ile bayağı geniş alan sunuyor. İlk oyuna göre fazla ama başka oyunlar ile karşılaştırıldığında belki ufak bulabilirsiniz. Bazı bölgelerde suyun içinde dahi ilerleyebiliyoruz. Nefes sorunu dışında karşımıza düşmanlar çıkabiliyor. Suyun içindeki düşmanlarla ya bomba atarak ya da özel bir silah ile çarpışabiliyoruz. Hem sıkıntılı hem zor bir durum ve biraz rahatsız edici. Genel olarak görsel kalitede artış yerine mekân çeşitliliği sayesinde büyüleyebiliyor. Gece gündüz döngüsü ve hava değişimiyle birlikte yaşayan ada hissini fazlasıyla veriyor. Kaplama kalitesini düşürmediğinizde gizli tuşlar ve gizli işaretlerdeki kayıpları yaşamadan keyifle adayı gezebilirsiniz. Sadece oyunun ikinci bölgesi olan ormana giriş yaparken ani kare sayısı (FPS) düşüşleri yaşanabiliyor. Bunun dışında görsel olarak hiçbir sıkıntısını görmedim.

Bilmece ve bulmaca dolu gizlilikler, biraz da düşman

İlk oyunda olduğu gibi bol tutulmuş. İlk oyuna göre daha fazla düşman ve alan olduğundan gizliliklerde ki ödüller bir hayli dolu. Ayrıca toprağın altına gömülü sandık ve eşya gibi farklı gizlilikler eklenmiş. Bazı noktalarda bu olay sizi sıkıntıya sokabiliyor, mezarlık gibi. İlk oyuna nazaran yazılı bilmeceler kadar beceri odaklı bilmecelerde bol tutulmuş. Ulaşamadığımız butonlu zeminlere, ışınlayıcılara, görünmez yollara veya demir parmakların aralarından taşları fırlatıyor veya bırakıyoruz. Bazı eşyaları bulmak için düşmek ve yaralanmak gerekirken bu oyunda -oyunun en kıymetli yeniliklerinden ve nimetlerinden biri- ip sayesinde hasar almadan katları inebiliyoruz.

Yaratık çeşitliği artmış. Çoğu düşman bir sonraki kareye hareket edip dönmek yerine direk dönüş yaparak bir sonraki kareye geçiyor ve ardından saldırı yapabiliyor. Bu da bizi sürekli bulunduğumuz alanı değiştirip vurmak yerine biraz daha planlı hareketler yapmamızı gerektiriyor. Uzaktan saldıran düşmanların işlevselliği daha fazla olduğu için özellikle bıçak fırlatan farelere karşı tetikte olmakta yarar var. Saldırıları çok hızlı ve mesafesini korumak için kaçabiliyor. Birkaç tanede özel saldırıyla ölen tatsız düşmanlar dışında her şey gayet iyi. Bölüm sonu düşmanları olduğundan da bahsedelim. Toplam dokuz tane var ama aynı bölüm sonu düşmanlarıyla ikişer defa çarpışınca ve bir tane normal düşmanı mitoz bölünmeyle önümüze sundukları için ben altı tane var diyorum. Bölüm sonu düşmanları güzel düşünülmüş, çarpışması keyifli ve zorlu. Şöyle iki tatsız durum var. Aynı bölüm sonu düşmanlarıyla iki defa çarpışmak tatsız bir durumlardan biri. Diğeri ise hiçbiri tek başına olmuyor. İnatla yanına normal düşmanlardan çağırıyor ve bu da işi bir hayli zorlaştırıyor. Ben özellikle sondaki bölüm sonu düşmanına bayıldım. Yaptığımız hamlelere göre konuşması ve heybetli bir müzikle çok heyecanlı bir savaş oluyor.

Tat Kaçıran Not: İki tane son bulunuyor. Adayı derinlemesine araştırmayı unutmayınız.

Boyuna posuna kurban olduğumuz karakterler

Minotor (Boğa adam mı desem), kertenkele (Ejder mi desem?), böcek ve insan ırkı dışında fare ırkı eklenmiş. Sınıf seçimindeki artışla birlikte daha çeşitli karakterler yaratılabiliyor. Yetenek ağacı ise basitleştirilmiş ama kullanımı daha rahat. Her yetenek ağacına beş yetenek puanı veriliyor. Yetenek ağacının sağladığı özelliğin kullanımını güçlendiriyor ve genelde ikinci puandan sonra her yetenek ağacı farklı pasif güçlendirmeler sağlıyor. Ayrıca bazı silahların özel yeteneklerini kullanmadaki şartı da karşılıyor. Tavsiyem bir tane büyücü ve simyacının olması.

Silah çeşidi fazla olmasına rağmen zırh çeşitliliğini az buldum. Oyun, ağır zırh giyebilen karakterlere daha fazla üstünlük sağlıyor. Bir tane de büyücü ve avcı zırh seti var. Parça zırhlar bulunuyor ama sağladıkları koruma puanı çok az. İlk oyuna nazaran büyü sayısında bir tane artış olsa da büyüler çeşitlendirilmiş ve büyü kullanımı kolaylaştırılmış. Bazı büyüleri kullanmak için hem hava hem de ateş sınıfında ustalaşmak gerekiyor o yüzden yetenek puanları dikkatli verilmeli. Ben yinede büyü çeşitliliği yetersiz buldum. Merakı olanlar için tabancalar, tüfekler, minigunlar dışında savaş topu olduğunu da belirteyim.

Kartograf olduğumuz zorluk seçenekleri

Oyunu yeteri kadar zor bulmazsanız "Ironman" seçeneği ile sadece kristallerde kaydedebilir, "Single-use" ile bu kristaller tek seferlik aktif olabilir, "Old School" seçeneği ile haritayı kapatıp kareli defterinizde çizebilirsiniz. Ha, harita demişken oyunun haritası daha aktif kullanılabilir olmuş. Ünlem, soru işareti ve çarpı işaretleri koyarak haritada farklı notlar düşebiliyorsunuz, ufak fakat güzel bir rahatlık. Oyun süresi ortalama 18-20 saat kadar. İlk oyunu oynadıktan sonra forumları gezdiğimde fark ettiğim ve benim de zamanla rahatsız olduğum bir sorunu da ekleyeyim. Hızlı kullanım tuşları yok. Bu durumda sürekli fare ile karakterlerin silah kutucuklarına tıklamak, sürekli büyü sembolleri çizmek ve iksirleri envanterde tıklayarak içmek zamanla rahatsız edebiliyor. Oyuna bir miktar zorluk katıyor ama rahatsız ediciliği daha baskın.

Eğer ilk oyunu oynamadıysanız, bu oyunun ardından ilk oyun sıkıcı gelebilir. Ben her iki oyunu da sırayla oynamanızı öneririm.

Puanım 90/100
 
Duşakabin Adam
460 produits enregistrés
0

Recommandé
74.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 mars 2019
TL;DR: 9/10 The game is great, I'd recommend it to anyone that likes party based RPG games.

The game has a really good difficulty curve, as long as the player doesn't cheese fights or drop stuff and forget where they put it (I dropped a certain staff that ended up being essential and spent about an hour finding it).

I made a save on the normal difficulty, with Ironman, Single-use crystals, and Old school all turned off. I completed the game in about 17.5hrs and spent about a further 10hrs going around the entire map finding any collectables that I missed during my main run, and then did the extra things for the true ending (more later [spoilers will be marked]). The run itself was so much fun that I decided to have another run, with a few different settings and my own characters, as opposed to the default characters that you can use.

Save 2 was on normal, with Ironman, Single-use crystals,Old school, and custom characters turned. Not having the map was a bit of a pain, and I started playing the game a lot less too. Due to only being able to use each crystal once, I made sure to only go on the save if I'd play for at least a couple of hours, so that my limited saves were worth it. I finished that save at around 15hrs, and quickly pressed on to the last save.

Save 3 was on easy, just to get the Gluttony achievement. Nothing special, took about 2hrs.

Save 4 was on hard. I made my own characters, and got on my way. The save took about 15hrs to complete, not entirely focusing on secrets or any special loot (aside from 2 sets of endgame heavy armour because of their usefulness).

So spoilers for the true ending:
You get 16 Power Gems and make the elemental essences, and head to the castle for the "final" boss before the game can be finished. The Lindworm drops a Power Gem, and the wizard oddball says some stuff about not making it to the Nexus. If you had been paying attention to all of the hidden texts around the game, you'd know there's a fifth shrine, "Balance". Casting the Balance spell (the centre block in your spell grid) when standing in between all of the essences will teleport you to the fifth secret shrine, where you need the 17-20th power gems to create the essence of balance. Doing so opens up the door in the hub to fight the Island Master and the trashy Trickster that's been lurking around all throughout your run. Killing them offers up the key to the Nexus, which is accessed via the portal as soon as you enter the castle.

The game looks beautiful, runs well, and was great to play for whatever my playtime is of it. Having fully completed the game, I won't be playing it again anytime soon, but I'll be recommending it to people and seeking out new games just like it.
 
Phat Cocc Matt

Recommandé
30.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 juillet 2015
1편을 못 해본 사람이라면 -
Lands of Lore나 Eye of the Beholder같은 고전 1인칭 타일이동형 RPG를 현대적인 감각에 맞춘 게임이라고 보면 대강 맞음. 동시에 진행이나 숨겨진 장소를 찾는 퍼즐을 상당히 중요시한 방향성.

1편을 해본 사람이라면 -
1편보다 스케일이나 컨텐츠가 방대함.
밸런스는 전작과 비슷할 정도로 잘 못맞췄는데 와중에 클래스나 컨텐츠가 많아져서 더욱 안 맞는 방향. 그래도 할만 함. 퍼즐은 전작과 비슷하지만 너무 사방팔방 돌아다니면서 힌트를 얻어야 하는 장면이나 너무 은유적인 퍼즐이 몇군데 있음. 전투는 전작보다 나음. 그래봤자 타일이동의 한계를 벗어나진 못하지만, 2X2에서 멍청하게 맞기만 하는 적은 별로 없음. 현실성이나 긴박함의 감각보다는 짜증만을 돋구는 부상 시스템.

딱히 전작보다 엄청 나빠진 점은 없으면서 컨텐츠나 전투는 확실히 괜찮아졌으므로, 전작보다 컨텐츠 외의 부분에서 좋아졌기를 바라지만 않는다면, 1편을 해봤을때처럼 신선한 즐거움은 없겠지만 충분히 재밌을 듯.
 
Tiren

46.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 juillet 2015
Не играл в 1й гримрок, тч сравнивать не с чем. Игра понравилвилась, графика шикарная, 4к приветствуется. Головоломки сложные, но если не пытаться решить их с наскока то вполне решабельные. Обычно если встречал нерешабельную головоломку то просто бросал ее и возврашался к ней позже, уже с найденными листочками подсказками. Но все же 3 головолмки разгадать не получилось, как открыть чертовы ворота на кладбище без ютюба я так и не понял. Бои интересные, но только на 1е прохождение, поиграв одним классом 2ой раз его пикать не хочется, особенно бекстаб рогу. Играл сразу на нормале, бои трудные, но при правильном позиционированнии не особо сложные, единственные момент, точность у всех кроме мага должна быть прокачана на 30 иначе мисы сэйв\лоады и боль. Боссы порадовали, дратся с ними долго/сложно и инересно, но у всех один и тот же изъян, ловим на муве - даем прокаст - повторяем, все таки ближе к концу игры надоедает, нехватает автоатки, очень сильно нехватет. Игра 9/10 убила все мои выходные, включая ночные часы, всем поклонникам жанра рекомендую. Вот еще бы сюжет полглубже\покарсочнее, но это я уже придираюсь наверное.
 
BADmicro

37.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 mars 2017
Игра довольно простая по своей концепции и много о ней, пожалуй, не напишешь. Поэтому сразу к сути - игру я категорически рекомендую, причем даже тем, кому не понравилась первая часть, так как в LoG2 дизайн уровней просто на голову выше. Это касается и визуальной части игры - приятно, знаете ли, после душного подземелья прогуляться по берегу моря - и самой логики и "архитектуры" подземелий. Их интересно исследовать, интересно "обыгрывать" монстров с минимальными потерями, а уж загадки, понятное дело, заставят вас поломать голову (некоторые, правда, заставят этой головой побиться о стену). На нормальной сложности игра вполне доступна среднестатистическому игроку, который мало знаком с олдскульными кравлерами вроде Wizardry и M&M, и проходится "ролеплейной" группой воин-рыцарь-вор-маг. На высокой сложности и с включенными "хардкорными" опциями придется, конечно, подбирать манчикинскую партию и играть в разы осмотрительнее. Из минусов могу отметить только несколько чрезмерно, на мой взгляд, мудреных и не очень логичных паззлов (особенно в самом замке Некс) и то, что "простая" концовка мне нравится больше чем "тру эндинг", который, на мой взгляд, слишком мрачный и как-то смазывает радость от того, что мы наконец-таки одолели загадки и монстров зловещего Мастера.
 
VHS

47.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 mars 2020
Тот самый случай, когда разработчики взяли то, что понравилось игрокам оригинала и приумножили это.
Но как же они это накастовали, и сколько маны на это ушло?
Первый «Гримрок» несомненно шикарен в своей олдовости и привлек игроков своим энтузиазмом, с которым создатели вернули времена «раньше было лучше». В нем провисали некоторые геймплейные элементы: было множество бесполезных предметов, отсутствие подачи чего-то нового для игрока во время приближения к финалу. Будем честны: олдскульные подземелья-уровни интересны, но им свойственно со временем надоедать. Сиквел практически избавляет нас от прошлых недугов.
Say Hello to My Little Friend 
Une capture d'écran de Legend of Grimrock 2
Par : Rexxarius

«Дальше, глубже и выше» - теперь девиз наших приключенцев. Игра стала менее линейной, карты огромны и переплетены друг с другом. Если бесконечные спуски в подземелья – не Ваш случай, то просим Вас в наши… пирамиды.

«Island crawler, is that you?»

Игрока ждут на этот раз целый остров для исследований, вертикальный геймплей и соответствующая многоуровневость карт. Если поверхности Вам мало, то готовы ли Вы прыгнуть в пропасть и провалится в прямом и переносном смыслах? А искать секреты под водой без воздуха, без возможности атаковать, посреди врагов? Если даже это Вас не пугает, то новый «Гримрок», как и оригинал, будет поощрять самых жадных до секретов игроков. Паззлов стало куда больше, да и весь этот остров поначалу пугает и может сбить игрока. Грамотный же менеджмент ресурсов во время прохождения может сыграть с игроком… хорошую шутку. Как бы Вы быстро не прокачивались, опыта для навыков будет всегда мало. Имбу создать сразу трудно, поэтому расточительством на «флакончики» лучше не страдать.

Недостаток остался всего один. Несмотря на богатые возможности жанра для поиска предметов, раскрывающий лор мира, игра использует соответствующие элементы, лишь для секретов и «хождений вокруг-да-около». Концовка же, несмотря на свою эпичность, разочарует тех, кто хотя бы мало-мальски ждал какого-то подобия закрученного сюжета.
Максимально банальная история, пытающая иметь под собой глубокое дно.
*пытается найти лестницу под водой*

«Legend of Grimrock 2», следуя заветам предшественника, дарит незабываемые впечатления от олдскульного геймплея, но опять чуточку не доводит до игрока тот объем впечатлений, который мог быть.
 
Rexxarius

Recommandé
33.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 octobre 2018
[++] Exploration is rewarding (You will find a lot of cool stuff).
[+] Puzzles are great, except a few which were meh.
[++] World and level desing are exemplary (The best since Dark Souls 1).
[+] Character progression is good, you get the feeling that your party is becoming stronger as the game goes.
[+] Looks awesome and has a great atmosphere.
[+] Soundtrack and sound effects are nice.
[+-] Character creation is not bad, but there isn't many viable builds which may reduce replayability.
[+-] Combat is good but has some minor annoyances (Managing your party's health, mana etc. while dodging a dozen enemies is really awkward).

Overall, it's one of the best RPGs released in the last decade and definitely worth checking out.
 
Aenthran

Recommandé
69.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 mars 2020
(English is not my first language, I apologize for possible writing errors)

One of the best RPGs i played in the last years. The first impact could be strange if you're not used to old-school grid-based games, but you just need to get used to it. Once done, you can enjoy a very polished and well-made RPG. It has a perfect balance between fights and puzzles, some of which will request a lot of thinking, expecially thinking out of the box. Solve a puzzle you have been stuck for hours is really satisfying, only to find you have one even harder after that or that you have freed a horde of monsters!
Character creation and progression is one of the best aspect I personally found in the game: characters can be customized by you preferences and their development is really important and need long-term pianification, since the difficulty is higher then many other RPGs.
The game is full of secrets to uncover, in your first playthrough you will find maybe not even half of them, encouraging backtraking and exploring the game world.
Graphics and design are beautiful for its genre, level design is really curate and rewards attenction for details and exploring.
Combat is the classic of grid-based RPGs, but in some ways revamped and improved. It's really nice to play and can be quite challenging, expecially in boss fights.
As I said, difficulty is higher than other RPGs, even at Normal. Hard is really tough, and there are options to make the game even harder, to people to like challenges! (Or masochists...)
Story is not so deep, but as you approch to the end you will find some lore about the franchise. The game has also multiple endings.
The game can be completed in around 20 hours, but to find all secrets you will need a lots more. After that, the game has an editor where you can create your dungeons, wolrds and campaigns, and you can also play the ones created by other players, some of which are very well-made!

I can't recommend this game enough. Give it a try, is really good!
 
Tom Collin
0
57 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Non recommandé
32.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 avril 2016
Look - I'm no newcomer to old-school dungeon crawlers. I have played and finished Dungeon Master 1 & 2, Eye of Beholder trilogy, Realms of Arkania trilogy, Lands of Lore, Wizardry 7... and of course Grimrock 1. Some of them were pretty challenging, especially W7 and DM2. Yet it was nothing compared to this game.
The combat is not the biggest issue. It's quite hard and I have to admit I suck at real-time micromanaging everything - attacks, potions and spells while running around avoiding enemies and traps. But at least you can restart on easier difficulty.
The biggest problem is the design of the puzzles. Especially in the second half the game starts to throw puzzle after puzzle at you, each more and more complex and cryptic. With extremely vague clues, sometimes with no hints at all.
I don't think I've ever needed a walkthrough while playing Grimrock 1 but here I had to check it constantly. I mean, in the final area I wasn't able to solve a single puzzle! And after looking up the solutions I was pretty sure I would have never figured that out.
EDIT: The first rule of good puzzle games is that they have to provide sufficient number of clues. So that I don't have to rely on guessing and brute force.

This was also great - to access one of the maps you need to use a specific weapon located in a completely different map on the other side of the game. But the weapon is not marked as a quest item, it's just a standard staff. And because it sucks, I did the only logical thing - I threw it away somewhere. Imagine my surprise ten hours later when I discovered the staff is required to progress. I actually had to spawn it using a developer console to be able to continue.

This could have been a great game like the first one. Instead it turned to be such frustrating experience I actually had to force myself to finish it.
 
Petr Stránský
1,248 produits enregistrés
4
15 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
95.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 octobre 2014
This first-person dungeon crawler manages to look beautiful while incorporating the best features of an ancient genre. An absolute must-play for old school gamers who are fond of complex puzzles and some high-quality RPG action. The inventory system is surprisingly user-friendly (without being simple), and the open-world grid is definitely an improvement on the level-based model of the previous installment. Last but not least, the game enjoys competent writing which makes for some very effective storytelling. All in all, one of the best games in recent years, as far as I'm concerned.
 
Alex

Recommandé
40.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 mai 2017
This game is a straightforward fantastic example of its genre. Anyone who has encountered rpg's of this kind will find that it is exemplary, and those who have not encountered them will find themselves a rare gem and newfound appreciation for what this playstyle has to offer.

As for specific clarification for newcomers, the game is grid-based, and people's ablity to act is on a cooldown, making it essentially turn based in a certain sense. So think a strategy and jrpg mix, with the best of both genres mixed together. IE you can dodge and manuever in 3d space but actions are predicated in an orderly predictable fashion. And all your men occupy one space so you don't spend a half hour manuevering people around like in Shining Force.

Outside of the combat the exploration is puzzle based, and no puzzle is so obtuse you can't figure it out on your own. The game is tempered to the extent that any non-fooligan can complete everything by themselves, but still contains enough secrets locked away for the more conscientious player. And the game shines because of this fact.

Outside of this, the games' outdoor setting is a straight upgrade to its predecessor in the sense that,"it isn't dark and unhappy all the time", and it uses it's new environment to add puzzles, complications, and scenery that wouldn't be afforded to a strict cobblestone backdrop.

All in all I find it difficult to find any fault with this game, and the mod support means there is even some community campaigns worth trying. It's worth a buy for anyone even vaguely interested in this type of game, or even rpgs in the broader sense.
 
Judge Cudge
0
