Recommandé
273.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 février 2021
Super fun game that improves on the original's mechanics drastically. The game manages to pull off a grid based system fairly well in the outdoor areas, and just as good as the previous game inside dungeons and indoor areas. Puzzles now are more environmental based, and rewards players who take the time to explore areas, due to the slightly less linear level design from its predecessor. The game is surprisingly long as well. Many times i'll start a new file and not even make it to the midgame despite putting hours into each session. The lore of the Isle of Nexus is fun to interpret and to look into, if you're into that stuff, and the lore from the prior game is also expanded on.

Some negatives with this game compared to Legend of Grimrock 1 are that the outdoor areas can feel pretty weird. I can understand the grid based system for the first game as it was solely a dungeon crawler - having you walk through cramped tunnels and corridors, but seeing these wide, open environments and having them tied to grid based movement feels off. Sometimes there are places where you really should be able to walk through. Other times you can get stuck in little gap in the terrain and you don't know how you got in there, because it looks like any direction could've gotten you into that spot. Besides that, however, the system still works.

Combat is expanded on and is more enjoyable as enemies now can mix up their movement, or can have multiple attacks. Enemies feel more mobile and threatening because of this. Enemy types have been expanded on. Some enemies can't physically hurt you, some are used for interesting puzzles and some act as minibosses. The first game seriously lacked this diversity, so it's good to see in its sequel.

Definitely, the one thing I love most about this game (and the series) is it's replay value. There are way to many classes and weapons to use in one playthrough, so you can go back and try out interesting combos in your next. I personally had the most fun when i broke away from my usual Warrior/Rogue at the front and Archer/Magician at the back for some of the new classes brought into this sequel. Also, another thing that keeps me playing its the surprisingly in depth level editor. Im guessing the devs ported their editor that they used to make each level directly into the game for the player to try out. I still don't understand how to code or anything advanced, but I love designing puzzles, decorating levels and making a cohesive map in my free time. I know most players haven't touched the level editor, but I'm glad it was expanded upon in this game. If you love making custom maps, definitely get this game!

TL:DR: Overall this sequel is a massive improvement from its predecessor (which was already a great game to begin with). It manages to be fresh and smart with its level design and puzzles. It improves on the systems that Legend of Grimrock 1 had, and has been one of the most enjoyable games I have ever played on steam. I hope the developers seriously think about making a Legend of Grimrock 3, since I cant get enough of this series! (Please consider it AlmostHuman. I know it's been 6 years but a man can dream.) Sorry if this became a rant, but I really like this game.
 
Finger
0
9 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
44.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 juin 2019
For those who aren't in the know, LoG II is a very particular kind of RPG in the vein of 1987's Dungeon Master. It's classified as a Real-time party-based Dungeon Crawler RPG which is a very niche subgenre of RPG; it won't appeal to every RPG player. Whereas most RPGs will will put an emphasis on combat quests and story, LoG II puts an emphasis on exploration and puzzle solving. If you come in with the expectation of finding towns populated with NPCs who will charge you with quests, or if you expect to find a grand sweeping narrative in the vein of Final Fantasy, then prepare to be disappointed because you will find none of that here.

What you can expect to find is a content-dense world populated with interesting puzzles. The combat is serviceable but if you're looking for a tactical experience look elsewhere. I'm not saying that these things makes LoG II a bad game (I think it's pretty close to a masterpiece) but if you come in with the wrong expectations it can dampen your experience.

What this game does it does exceedingly well. I have little doubt that a puzzle game fan would have a blast with this game. People coming from games like the Witcher III though might not. They might, but if they do it will have nothing to do with them liking the Witcher III because this is different beast.

In summation, get this game if you like: Talos Principle, Portal 2, and the like (however, expect a lot more exploration and combat than these games offered).
 
SalientAlien

Poi è arrivato Legend of Grimrock 2.

67.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 septembre 2021
Legend of Grimrock 2 holds such a dear place in my heart. I became attached to my custom party, and explored an island of treacherous and brilliant design. The enemies are ruthless, the traps are enraging, and the puzzles can be genuinely mind boggling. This series is for anyone who enjoys a world where the plot had occurred before your time and you must work to see the job done.
It can be difficult to find out where you are going since it takes a much more "open world" approach. The bright side is that the game offers portals, and you will do more than enough traveling to generally memorize the entire map. This being said. There isn't much to complain about and if you need to look up a guide for some things, the rich atmosphere and dangerous encounters more than make up for some of the more challenging riddles.
10/10 Probably one of my all time favorites to revisit with different builds, classes, races, and play styles.
 
Green Bell Pupper

Évaluation publiée le 11 décembre 2015
Había jugado al primero, y me gusto bastante.
Esta segunda parte mejora mucho los graficos y sigue la dinamica del primero.
Escoges 4 componentes de tu cuadrilla, y que habilidades tienen, para explorar, hacer frente a toda clase de monstruos, buscar tesoros y zona secretas.
Me gusta el sistema de combate, y como van creciendo en habilidades los 4 que componen la partida.
Las zonas esteriores como las playas estan muy bien.
En general los puzzles estan bien, pero no me gusta tanto que algunos puzzles sean demasiado dificiles y sean una sucesion rapida de acciones, que como falles una la fastidies.
Otra cosa que me gusta mucho, es la ampliacion de la durabilidad del juego a traves de workshop.

Évaluation publiée le 7 novembre 2014
Gives you a retrogasm. A truly awesome game which does everything right. You gonna have a blast if you are a) an ancient gamer from the 80s/90s or interested in retro gaming because dad has this weird grin when he talks about Lands of Lore. God, how i have missed this kind of RPG. Its like the designers opened a bag of fun filled with a well thought game design, puzzles that actually make you think instead of looking on your mini map where your goal is already marked and a combat system that dares to kill your party if you dont shape up and think how to get rid of a nasty monster.
Everyone who loved Eye of the beholder or Dungeon Master should buy this. Support what they created here. This is made for gamers, not for share holders.

11.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 novembre 2017
ARACHNOPHOBICS STAY AWAY.
The Sequel to Legend of Grimrock is a great addition to the grid based dungeon crawler genre. It is very hard, even on low difficulty, and you will curse at your party multiple times for breaking a leg - again - in the middle of a fight. The dungeons are neatly built, some puzzles are easy to understand, but some need a lot of brain power. Progression is a bit weird, and you definitely need to read a party creation guide, if you don't want to start over after 10 hours. There are also console commands available, for the worst case... . Between stunning looks, good puzzles, somewhat interesting plot and a lot of turtle meat, LoG2 is a true gem, and it even has workshop support!
Shame that I will never see the ending, or even half of the game. Just because some ♥♥♥♥ in developement had the great idea to include monitor wide spiders screeching into my face. And oh, let's make them realistic enough to trigger everyone with the worldwide widest spread fear of all, so a significant percentage of our customers can't complete the game without having nightmares for a month! WHY DOES THIS KEEP HAPPENING? Just use beetles, centipedes, butterflies for all I care. But DO NOT INCLUDE ARACHNIDS. (PS: I actually didn't look at the screenshots on the page, because LoG1 was so good, I just bought LoG2).
So, I entered the mines, fell down a pit, quit and deinstalled. Real pity, because I was enjoying the game a lot!

Follow my curator at http://store.steampowered.com/curator/28337205-Fair-Minded-Witness/?appid=251730

109.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 mars 2016
I rarely, RARELY, ever say the following:

The sequel was even better than the original.

I can't put my finger on just one thing that makes it so much better, but I really enjoyed the entire experience. If you like dungeon crawlers on a grid, like (and I'm going back to the 80's here) Bard's Tale, Wizardry, Dragon Wars (Amiga 500), Heroes of Might & Magic Series, etc, you should try this game.

The one adjustment to get used to is combat is in real-time, so it is not turn-based like many games in this genre. You'll need to get good at moving your party to a dead-end to prevent being attacked on multiple sides or become quick with the WASD keys to keep moving so you don't get hit much.

Going back to why I think this game is better than the original Legend of Grimrock: I like that this game had environments that took place on the surface. You explore forests, deserts, even underwater at times. This was a fun change from the first game where you are underground traveling floor to floor deeper into your prison/dungeon. It also means you will frequently revisit areas and as time goes by some of the monsters will respawn giving you an opportunity to pickup some extra xp and food. This helps make food an easier resource to obtain unlike the first game where I was stressing about running out more frequently.

Inventory management was easier for a loot hoarder like me because there is an area called the Hub which you can revisit. There are no creatures there, just a small chamber where you can drop off the extra things you may wish to save for later.

I hope there is eventually a Legend of Grimrock 3 as I really enjoy the series and look forward to whatever else the developer may come up with to keep the series fresh and entertaining.
 
Spankface
1
9 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
50.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 novembre 2014
A huge, epic adventure that fans of first-person dungeon crawlers will devour. Designed with nostalgia in mind, but also sleek and shiny with modern graphics and great sound design. Better than the first game in every way, and worth it if you're even remotely interested in this kind of game. Play the first game before this one to help you ease into the mechanics and appreciate the improvements.

The challenge level is steep but fair, and difficult enemies can be taken down through tactics and manuvering rather than brute force. There are tons of secrets to find and an overall sense of mystery and wonder in every dungeon and area. Atmosphere is thick and the sound really makes the world feel alive, and threats ahead can be anticipated with keen ears. Overall the presentation makes for a immersive experience coupled with solid gameplay and combat.

The puzzles are mostly logical and can be figured out with a little thought and experimentation, though a few are so unclear that guesswork is almost neccessary. I'll fully admit I had to consult a guide for a few spots, and while some solutions made me feel stupid, a few just made me go "really?". It's much more satisfying to work through the puzzles yourself, but some of the nastier ones can get frustrating enough to encourage cheating.

A few minor balance issues made me rethink my initial party and start over after a while, but I'm terrible for that in any game like this. Almost any party combination can work, but some weapons are simply found more often and in better quality than others. Consulting a guide or a friend before setting out with your party can help a lot, especially since a few of the classes don't necessarily work the way you might expect them to.

Being out in a bright, open world makes the grid-based movement seem a bit strange, where it mostly made sense in the confined halls of the first game. It's not just there for nostalgia though - the movement system and the logic that governs it is central to the combat and puzzle-solving systems and removing it would have required a complete overhaul in design. The game wouldn't work otherwise.

The more open-ended design makes for a lot more exploration, but it can be overwhelming. Puzzles that need keys or information from elsewhere to solve don't always indicate that clearly, and if you leave the game for too long and come back to it, you'll likely be hopelessly lost. The progression path isn't clear, but that could be said to just be part of the game's philosophy. Here's an island full of monsters and traps and secrets, good luck.

Nostalgic, polished, immersive, and challenging enough to deter some players, this is almost everything you could possibly want in a dungeon crawl and one of the only modern examples of the genre. Worth the purchase, and then some.

 
Beaky
1,304 produits enregistrés

Évaluation publiée le 1 novembre 2014
Ok, This game is one of the best 20€ ever spent. I'd write summary at the start for tl;dr guys. If you like dungeon crawler you have to play this game. If you like Legend of Grimrock 1 you have to buy this game. If you like whatever what is like might & magic or any RPG and you don't mind it's a grid system rpg you're gonna love it. If you are a Hardcore dungeon crawling player, you'll see big potential in this game and maybe you'll notice some small ♥♥♥♥ but they're not important for the whole game. 9/10

Pros:
- It's like expansion of LoG1 in everything
- Beautiful scenery
- Great combat system
- Perfectly balanced combat system (on nomral - every combas wasn't too much hard neither too much easy)
- Gameplay time
- Workshop so you can play the community maps
- Hardcore Challenges (Single use crystal, iron man, old school player - no map, or all of these)
- Graphics (same as the LoG1 BUT it doesn't mean the design is same)
- Level Design is really good
- Ending(s) (in my opinion atleast)
- Treeskill with traits (I like the idea how they did that)
- Day/Night cycle

Ok enough of pros. It's just a great game now some negatives

♥♥♥♥: (it's gonna be details)
- I'd say ppl with firearms will be a littlebit pi**ed because sometimes they'll run of ammo. But when it will happen you have already prepared second type of attacts instead of firearms (throwing,missile or light weapons).
- Just a few usable spells "fireburst,fireball,meteorfall,light and some protection spells" but the others are almost useless or they dont have higher level of them. So if someone starts max earth magic he's gonna have a hard time.
- There are only sh*tty maps in workshop for now (sorry guys but you spent just a few hours for making your whole map/mod, that's ridiculous and you can't finish a good map in that time). But it's only question of time. The game is still pretty new.
- I don't know if there's something like afterstory (I mean after second ending) there could be something like last huge dungeon for crawling through it'd be amazing (I feel there's nothing like that)

Ok It takes me so long to write some ♥♥♥♥. Why it's not 10/10 is just these things (especially the 'spells' part). As I said it's improving of LoG1 in everything. Everything what they can improve they did. Actaully I wonder if they think about LoG3. I have some suggestion for another sequel - like Cities, some NPCs quests (whole quest system ofc), dynamic weather. More sceneries It'd be great aswell. But anyway LoG2 is one of the best Dungeon Crawling RPG what you can buy right now!

V prvním díle jste si jen tak chodili po dungeonech, sbírali předměty, likvidovali monstra, levelovali své hrdiny a na konci Vás čekal celkem slušný bossfight. V druhým díle děláte prakticky to samý akorát je toho jednou tolik a má to o 200% větší grády. Pokud Vás nadchl první díl, tak druhý Vás přímo vtáhne do sebe a teprve až Vám začne padat hlava únavou, si řeknete: ,,zítra je taky den''. Víc monster, víc lokací, víc předmětů, víc secretů, pozoruhodnější hádanky a ke konci bossfight na který budete ještě hodně dlouho vzpomínat. Dvojka je prostě jako jednička akorát je na ni všechno vylepšené a tím myslím opravdu všechno. Škoda jen, že takových her s tímto žánrem není víc. 10/10

Recommandé
30.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 juin 2016
Produit reçu gratuitement

I got Legend of Grimrock 2 as a gift around two years ago, played it until I killed the Viper Roots, put it down, and didn't touch it for another two years.

After resolving to pick it up again and not set it down until I was finished, I can say that LoGII does everything from LoGI, and more.

While LoGI was entirely set in the claustrophobic confines of Grimrock, a giant dungeon built in the mountains, LoGII takes place on the Isle of Nex, with over 10 unique environments, 5 bosses, and more of the fun rune-based magic, hunting for rare items, and secrets that made LoGI so great. The level design and puzzles are on point, reminescent of classic dungeon crawlers like Dungeon Master. Many old enemies return from LoGI, with a few new ones to mix up the joyful shuffle-foot slice and cast combat routine of the original.

My only real complaint about Grimrock II is the difficulty: either I don't recall how difficult LoGI was, or this game is on steroids. Enemies deal insane amounts of damage and are bulky as hell, making combat difficult if you get pinned between two enemies or a wall. Nostalgic enemies as well, while great, seem to be added in as sort of a fanservice thing (the Herder's Den comes to mind as such, as well as the Crowverns that only appear in one area.)

Despite that, Legends of Grimrock II is more of the same greatness that made LoGI so fun, now with added plot outside of "escape the Dungeon." Would heartily reccomend, if you're a fan of the original or looking for a good Dungeon Crawler.

Just remember to plan your characters properly, or else you'll be in for a bad time.
 
Evil Squid

Recommandé
29.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 février 2016
“Их тюрьма внутри их, и потому они в тюрьме”

Legend of Grimrock (LoG) была потрясающей игрой, но смотря на вторую часть становится понятно, что первая была лишь пробой пера.

Запутанные лабиринты первой части, сменил открытый мир потрясающий воображение (пускай и также сделанный дискретным, то есть с передвижением по клеткам) с не менее ломающими голову лабиринтами и отлично сделанными 3D головоломками, ориентированными в том числе и на исследование, чего, пожалуй, действительно не хватало первой части.

Именно так и должна была по сути выглядеть Might & Magic X: Legacy в идеале, но к сожалению не сложилось.

Боевая составляющая практически не претерпела изменений за исключением прокачки, новых скиллов и кучи нового оружия. Появился так же новый класс: алхимик - без которого ваше приключение скорее всего закончится так и не начавшись так, как только он может готовить зелья. Появились новые дебаффы, теперь помимо эффекта отравления, болезни и т.д. вы еще можете получить травму к прыгнув с большой высоты, а прыгать вы будете часто и вам понадобится много зелий, чтобы лечить травмы.

А этот мост не так прост как кажется. 
Une capture d'écran de Legend of Grimrock 2
Par : Mihail_Lapin


Головоломки стали гораздо больше, шире и невероятно сложнее чем в первой части. Тут есть все: от выкапывания кладов и открывания золотых замков до бега по шипам, игрой света и тени, ну и пробежкой сквозь комнату с магическими стрелами.

Стоит также упомянуть, про совсем уж дикие головоломки наподобие “пробеги под мостом два раза, затем повтори, затем над ним затем повернись на 360 градусов, затем сделай сальто назад и прочие…” - как вы могли догадаться из этих слов, если в первой части надо было быть супергероем чтобы разгадать все загадки, то тут надо быть просто супергероем в квадрате, потому что самому догадаться как выполнить эти головоломки невероятно сложно.

Игру очень выдает, тот факт что изначально часть контента предназначалась для первой части в качестве DLC, ведь есть много повторяющихся вещей из первой частью, к счастью их не слишком много, но и недоработки старой части, новая тоже захватила, отсутствие людей, квестов, личных историй, взаимодействия между персонажами пожалуй в этом плане игру все же обгоняет M&MX.

Наловили полный мешок рыбы. 
Une capture d'écran de Legend of Grimrock 2
Par : Mihail_Lapin

Сюжет все так же подается в виде записок, только в нашем случае уже не записок Турума, а хранителя острова. А магические сны заменили на каменных мудрецов, разбросанных по всей карте, чьи слова стоит читать крайне внимательно, а лучше вообще записывать отдельно попутно, отмечая их на карте, так как без них вы вряд ли дойдете до финала. Концовок к слову две. И только самые упорные игроки, не побоявшиеся решить все загадки и тайны, дойдут наконец до истинной концовки.

Голод благодаря открытому миру вышел на качественно новый уровень, так что вам придется осторожнее подходить к заготовке провизии по сравнению с LoG, иначе останьтесь без еды в каком-нибудь дандже полном скелетов (несъедобных).

Очень большое количество секретов и пасхалок, в том числе и к первой части. Отличные и очень сложные ачивки, которые интересно достигать. Завезли воду, в связи с чем игра только усложнилась, ведь появились подводным головоломкам.

В игру я наиграл в два раза больше чем в первую часть, и я одновременно расстроен что игра закончилась, и одновременно рад что я наконец-таки закончил этот невероятно жесткий 30 часовой вызов, потому что повторю еще раз - игра действительно сложная, особенно если вы включите при старте все усложняющие модификаторы.

Ух, как же я испугался. 
Une capture d'écran de Legend of Grimrock 2
Par : Mihail_Lapin


И если вы хотите вызов, то эта игра определенно для вас! Очень приятно видеть работу над ошибками от разработчиков, также стоит отметить поддержку мастерской в Steam, так что даже если вы завершили игру, вы можете продолжить свои путешествия в приключениях от других игроков, благо возможностей для этого по сравнению с LoG стало только больше.

+Сложные головоломки
+Открытый мир
+Динамичная боевая система
+Много секретов
+Мастерская Steam

-Слишком сложные головоломки
-Новый класс алхимик обязателен для игры

10 из 10

Кураторская группа: http://steamcommunity.com/groups/IKCB
 
Mihail_Lapin

0
Non recommandé
24.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 mai 2017
Still playing through the game, but I feel like I'm so close to the end that I can't feel like my opinion would change at all from here until I finish the game.

Legend of Grimrock 2 is mechanically the exact same as #1, albeit with more spells this time around and special moves that items have.

The graphics are slightly upgraded from LoG1 as well, but a lot of enemy assets have been re-used (mushroom people, twigroot enemies, spiders, cudgels etc). There's so many new things added and their fidelity is quality enough that I don't care, and it doesn't detract from that game at all especially if you haven't played #1 yet (lots of these enemies have new tricks up their sleeves too).

Enemy AI has been upgraded in LoG2, where enemies are harder to kite because most of them have been equipped with side-swipe attacks and the rest of them will hesitate to move in front of you if they know you're camping a square trying to get a free side hit on them. The latter is bad because it drags out gameplay in what is an otherwise core mechanic of playing Grimrock.

I feel that the gameplay is too slow; at the point I'm at, enemy encounters are a slog because each common enemy I fight can take upwards of 3-4 cycles from my party members. Stuff like frogs stealing weapons out of your party members hands, but then subsequently only dealing 3 damage per attack is annoying when it means that 1/4 of your DPS is taken away for a while; considering that these frogs respawn, it gets old really quick. The same goes for the blue lightning lizards that deal AoE damage to your party while you're walking around the hub world, and the blue gremlins who lurk in the water who block underwater paths until you kill them in the hub.

Boss battles are new to Legend of Grimrock 2, but are a bit underwhelming. The majority of them come down to rushing the boss down while tanking his minions (if they summon them constantly), or just crawling into a corner and fighting all the enemies one at a time (if the minions are non-respawning). Like I said, when each common minion takes 3-4 cycles of your entire party, then you'll understand how boss fights get annoying really quick.

Stat boosts through crystals, potions, and spells feel useless. There are only maybe two enemies in the game who deal shock damage that I've encountered so far, and armor that gives only +4 protection and maybe some points into vitality negates their damage so much that I don't understand why I'd brew potions or cast spells to negate their baby damage any more. By the time I walk to wherever I want to go, I'll heal it back anyways.

The overworld is a really nice addition to LoG2, and I really enjoyed it... at first. By the time you complete two of the main areas, you'll be so tired of walking back and forth from untracked dungeon #698 to untracked dungeon #699 that you'll wish it was streamlined like LoG1 was. Beyond that, it's hard to tell which dungeons are required to progress and which ones aren't. You'll end up in a dungeon that takes you thirty minutes to complete just to get some power crystals (which are used to progress the game), but your inventory is probably full of them by now so there's no reason to grab more.

Like I said above, armor is kind of bungus in this game. You're better off just getting health on your characters who you want to tank. Lots of skill trees feel useless to me, especially when my party is only specializing in very specific characteristics. My light weapons character had light weapons maxed out at level 5, and is now throwing points into skills like accuracy (because literally every other attack in this game misses for some reason, I don't know). The problem with accuracy is that the "milestones" for this skill tree give me perks like "can attack from the back row" which is useless because my melee attacker is already specced to be in the front row. I'd have to be hella early in the game for that to be useful, back before my mage got spells and my alchemist got good guns. And early in the game, there's no point in attacking from the back row because you won't have enough weapons OR have enough skill points to use said weapons.

Every character runs into this problem where late-game speccing is just everywhere and there's no skill point reset at all. So if you put one single point into the wrong ability and want to change it later, you're SOL. My Heavy-Weapons character ran into it, my Alchemist ran into it, and my Mage is running into it too I don't have any desire to teach my fire-mage any air magic, but after you max the fire damage tree the only other good option for Mage to be able to sling spells better is just adding +20 mana to your pool per level. Spell at my rank cost like 40 mana per cast, so you can see how this is sub-useless at the point I'm at.

It's really easy to get lost and have nothing to do in Grimrock 2. After you complete a dungeon, you're left scouring the hub world map for little spots you haven't covered, or maybe some puzzles you might have accidently not seen. I had to look up a guide just because one mandatory area had a puzzle in the entrance. The clue, which is the only way you could solve the puzzle, was hidden in a dungeon that I had already completed apparently. It was a piece of paper that I had overlooked on the ground after a tough fight, and I just totally walked past. I was walking around the island for two hours trying to find out what to do until I came across it because I resorted to using a guide for help.

Save-scumming is basically a necessity in Grimrock 2 unless you want to be repeating hours of gameplay after every single unexpected ambush death. Get ready to press F5 + F9 a lot.

This might just be me, but I feel like a lot of the puzzles this time around make less sense. Not all of them, but some of them have such niche solutions that you'll know the answer that the designers want you to think of, but you won't know how to express it in-game (without spoiling anything, a good example of this is in the cemetary).

I mentioned special attacks, but here's my issue with them : In Grimrock 2, to perform any kind of attack you need to right-click on the characters weapon (or drag your mouse over a set of runes in order to cast a spell). To use a special attack, you need to hold down the mouse on a single weapon for around 1.5-2 seconds. In the time it takes to charge up a single special attack, I could have probably used my entire team's regular attacks including my Mage. If my Minotaur guy winds up an attack to deal 210 damage instead of his regular 120, but it takes so long that I have to miss an entire team rotation (60 damage from my light attacker, 40 damage from my alchemist, and another 140+ from my Mage), then there's no point in wasting that time; especially because if I miss the attack (which special attacks can and very often will miss) you basically cut out a quarter of your damage if not more. Special attacks should be able to be queued up, like how spells can be queue'd up before you cast them. That way, if I want to just blow up a small enemy with a barrage of special attacks I won't have to waste time with kiting a single petty mob.

Enemy health values are a bit ridiculous in Grimrock 2. One particular enemy you have to fight in a mandatory dungeon has such a high protection rating that neither of my hard-hitters hit above 1-damage on the enemy for the entire fight; I had to use my mage, who completely ignores armor, and spent five whole minutes just walking circles around this particular enemy just waiting for my spells to recharge. There's all kinds of cheesy enemies which I won't go into detail about how ridiculously time consuming it is to deal with them.

TL;DR GRIMROCK 2 IS FUN, BUT GET IT ON DISCOUNT BECAUSE IT'S ALSO NOT FUN SOMETIMES. PLAY IT AT YOUR OWN DISCRETION, BUT PLAY GRIMROCK 1 FIRST BECAUSE IT WAS HONESTLY BETTER JUST FOR BEING MORE STREAMLINED EVEN IF IT HAD A LITTLE LESS CONTENT.
 
The Ridiculous Rav
0
7 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
16.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 décembre 2021
If you’ve never played the first game, I would highly recommend you play it first, as Grimrock 2 offers more complex customisation for your characters, as well as open environments which change how you can play and figure out puzzles.
The Legend of Grimrock 2 or TLoG2 is an indie DRPG developed by four people. At its core, it is a puzzle game with some combat, though don’t be deceived when I say some – combat plays a big role in fighting bosses and dealing with certain puzzle elements. Going forward from TLoG1, TLoG2 has updated visuals and environments, starting on the beach of the Island of Nex. You are then chasing down the Master of Nex all the way through the game – seeing a mysterious figure every now and then, that’s always just out of reach.
A lot of the puzzles are fairly simple when it comes down to it – find the button, press it, get to area. Others though are much more complex with how they’re actually set out. For example, there are bouncing bolt puzzles where you’ve got to use teleporters (aka Windgates) to delay the bolt from getting where it needs to so you can cross a magical bridge, or timing the bolt to go between two closing gates which you control. There are also cyphers to decrypt which I found a little tedious, but they’re important for entering the Cemetery, the Archives, and digging up a relic from the past (though how it got to the Island of Nex and how long it has been since the original game is all left up in the air).
One thing I really love about the Grimrock series is that you can be flanked by enemies. You can absolutely put yourself in a situation where you have completely ♥♥♥♥♥♥ yourself over. No amount of potion guzzling will fix that. The combat has a focus on physical frontliners – your knights, barbarians, and fighters – and your missile and magic backline – your rogues, alchemists, battle mages, mages, etc. There’s even a joke class called the Farmer – which if you do want to do that achievement, bring him to Herdman’s Cove where there are constantly regenerating fungi monsters that provide food (how you level the Farmer). I made the mistake of assuming the battle mage was a frontliner, and suffered for it (the character died a lot), but it was extremely useful to have that extra magic constantly.
But actually talking about combat, it is a hazy wash of a thing at times – do you deal with enemy A in front of you, or enemy B, who while weaker, is closer to another stronger enemy like enemy A? How do you manage your team? And make sure you fire your spell between attacks or you’ll hit yourself. The micromanagement of the team and getting spells right is very important; as I had a water/ground and fire/air mage, they knew different spells, and sometimes I’d flub the combo on both of them, meaning I lost precious time in a difficult battle. I recommend fire/air mage, cause while water has freezing utility, and ground has poison utility, the stronger spells are locked to fire/air.
And that’s the fun bit about combat – it keeps you on your toes and keeps you making decisions like you were a party in trouble in high stakes situation.
So while I haven’t really discussed the puzzles (because I think its better to go in and experience them for yourself), they are definitely the centrepiece of TLoG2. There are so many maps, so many secrets, so many variations on the same puzzle that really work without making it seem like the same thing you’ve done over and over again, it really is a treat and a huge step up from TLoG1.
Just to talk quickly about TLoG1 – it’s the same deal but instead you’re in the titular prison of the Grimrock. No chance of escaping, the prison was built to keep people and monsters in. The major difference is the puzzles are much more focused on paying very close attention to your environments as you delve deeper into the game. There’s no rope, and sometimes falling is the only way forward.
Overall, I thoroughly enjoyed The Legend of Grimrock 2. Its nothing too crazy, but games in this genre are rarely as polished as this series is. If you like gridbased games, or are a fan of puzzle games, I would highly recommend both in the Grimrock series.
 
Hackle
0
12 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
37.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 juillet 2015
If you like dungeon crawl type games, this is must play (the first game too).

Great experience, interesting puzzles and exploration, challenging monsters. The only thing I didn't like is the HARD end battle (there is also optional another hard battle, but I'm talking about the one you can't miss). It is much harder than rest of the game, so be prepared.

I'd recommend the game of course. Looking forward to LoG 3!
 
Sneaksie(RUS)

Évaluation publiée le 30 aout 2016
・総評
三ツ星レストランの高級フルコースを胃が破裂するまで食べさせられるようなゲーム

・ゲームシステム
自体は（1と同じく）ふつうにダンジョンをカサカサするだけなのだが、
マップデザインやパズルに対する熱意/狂気が尋常ではなくバランス調整もほぼ完璧でヴォリュームたっぷりにときどきイラッとするほど美しく作り込まれている。

またある程度のフリーローミングが可能になっている。
私はこの手のゲームだとエリア難度をできる限り無視して歩き回るのがいつものことなので、あっちに行っては詰みこっちに来ては詰みとなにがなんやらどこに行けばいいのか分からなくなることが多々あった。思い返してみればいい思い出になったが当時は大変つらかった。

・雰囲気
よい。また1に比べてバリエーションが圧倒的に増えた。

・スリル
ある。ギリギリの戦闘が楽しめる局面も。ただし初殺も多い。
クイックセーブ忘れからのロールバックパターンで何度も投げそうになった。

・ストーリー
かなりあっさりとしたものだが、思いをはせる余地のあるバックグラウンド設定はある。


時間があってかつこの手のゲームに飢えている人にオススメ。

生半可な覚悟で手を出すと、美人だし尽くしてくれるけどなんか愛が重たくて自然消滅みたいな別れが訪れかねない。全く攻略情報を見ずに全エリアをクリアしようとするなら40-50時間くらいのプレイ時間は見ておいた方がいいだろう（私は最後の方詰まり疲れになっていくつかの謎解きで攻略情報を見た）。
 
[PYD]HCP
0
12 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
39.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 janvier 2015
硬派なダンジョン探索型の RPG。日本語化不可だが、中学生程度の英語力でプレイ可能。

前作から正常進化。様々な面がよく考えられており、丁寧で隙の少ない作りになっている。

一部の謎解きが難解で苦しめられる可能性があるが、無視しても良い謎解きも多いので OK かと。

難点は、ロード時間がやや長いのと Air Elemental がほぼ無敵なので非常に厄介(詰む可能性があるので、まめなセーブ重要)。それ以外はとても良くできている。近年まれに見る傑作かと。

また、甘えの効かない設計なため難易度は高めで腰を据えてのプレイが必要な所にも注意。

テーマソングの力の入れようから本気度が伺える。
Vidéo YouTube™: The Legend of Grimrock 2 Main Theme 
Vues : 110,883
The main theme of the Legend of Grimrock 2. Please support the developer team and buy the game, preferably on the developers website - http://www.grimrock.net/buy/#log2 or...


2015/03/23
しばらく放置していたが、ようやくクリア。名作ですわ、これ。
 
Spooky

31.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 décembre 2014
Degno seguito di un grande GdR old school!
Il primo LoG ha stupito per l'eccellente revamp di un genere dimenticato; questo secondo capitolo riesce ad alzare la posta ♥♥♥ un mondo ancora più grande, enigmi più ostici e numerosi, mostri più impegnativi e situazioni che vi costringeranno a pensare in maniera creativa.
I meccanismi di questo LoG2 sono simili a quelli del primo ma ♥♥♥ qualche novità di tutto rispetto che vi lascio scoprire. Strutturalmente si è deciso di abbandonare la verticalizzazione alla Ultima Underworld, in favore dello sviluppo orizzontale alla Eye of the Beholder 2 e Lands of Lore: una grande foresta collega le aree e i labirinti in cui dovremo fare avanti e indietro per ritrovare le disperse 20 gemme degli Elementi (scopo ultimo del gioco).
E' richiesto il sapiente uso della mappa (scriveteci sopra gli appunti per non lasciarvi indietro nulla!), strategia nel movimento, ma soprattutto spirito d'osservazione per non perdersi pulsanti e anfratti segreti.
Un'ottima sfida per i fanatici dei GdR e Dungeon Crawler in prima persona; sconsigliato a chi non si vuole impegnare a fondo...
 
Fbs™

Évaluation publiée le 20 mai 2017
Legend of Grimrock II es una excelente continuación del primero pero mejorando muchos aspectos del juego y convirtiéndolo en un juego más grande, abierto y variado.

Es un juego que recupera un género olvidado "Dungeon Crawler", podemos decir que es lo más parecido al Rol antiguo de papel y lápiz. Además tiene un editor potente que podemos usar para crear nuestras propias mazmorras o descargar las de otros usuarios, lo que alarga la vida del juego. Quizás no sea un juego del agrado de todos, ya que requiere que el jugador se concentre en muchos detalles que se encuentran en el entorno, que tienen que resolver puzles para avanzar y que tienen que gestionar muy bien al grupo de personajes para las combinaciones y estrategias que quieran seguir. Es un juego ♥♥♥ una gran ambientación, banda sonora e inmersión.

Actualmente estoy haciendo una serie del juego en mi canal de youtube que podeis seguir desde el siguiente enlace:

Vidéo YouTube™:  
Vues : 0

447.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 novembre 2020
I can't believe I haven't recommended this. Hell yeah I do! While I'm not huge into the 'old school dungeon crawl' style, this game makes the box bigger.

Originally I played a game called 'legend of skullkeep' which I believe was a sequel to 'dungeon master' or a renaming of 'dungeon master 2' (I'm not sure). Anyway! The reason I mention this is because I LOVED Skullkeep. SO MUCH.

I didn't 100% go wild for the dungeons or the end game, but a lot of the game takes place outdoors. And if you know old school dungeons crawls you'll know that a lot of them take place exclusively indoors. (hell, Legend of Grimrock took place mostly indoors!) However, Skullkeep was mostly different. It also had some really interesting elements including some really bizarre boss where you had to lure them into a side passage and crush them basically.

ANYWAY, moving back to Legend of Grimrock 2...I adore the outdoor sections! Even though the game is gridlocked (lol) it still feels very organic because of how fluid the movement is and mixing with the outdoors. It feels so good to walk around outdoors! Not just that, but the aesthetic is great!

I think my biggest complaint about the game is that it's just a bit content light. There aren't a ton of spells, the main game is just a tiny bit short and in general the game is just a little light. That's ok though! Even for it's current asking price I am still happy with it. (Though one thing I WIIIIIISH The game had was weather effects and it's missing vendors!)

If there was one game that I wish there was an expansion pack for in the current days, this would be it. I'd also LOVE to use this engine to make a game of my own too if I could.

Overall I love to see this game in the modern era and I want more!
 
Sanglaine

Évaluation publiée le 19 octobre 2014
전작을 재미있게 하셨던분이라면 강추!

완전 일직선 진행이었던 전작에 비해 약간 갈수있는곳에 자유도가 늘어서 젤다 비슷한 느낌이 되었습니다.
덕분에 템포가 살짝 느려지긴하는데 그만큼 어느정도 자유도가 생기는거니 호불호가 갈릴듯.

기존에는 상하구조를 쓰려면 무조건 다른층을 활용했던 것과달리 한층 내에서도 높고낮은곳 개념이 생겨서 좀더 입체적인 퍼즐이 많이 생겼습니다.

깨알만한 스위치의 비중도 이전에 비해 적어졌고 (없진 않습니다. 슬픔..)
전투의 비중도 살~짝 늘었습니다 특수기술도있고.

전작을 안해보신분을 위해 약간더 설명을 하면 던전의 기믹과 퍼즐 나름의 액션만이 전부인 게임이니 이런거 좋아하시는분은 강추이고 감동적인 스토리 같은걸 바라시는분은 구입하지마세요 이게임 3시간동안 스토리라고는 '내 섬에 온것을 환영한다. 밤길을 조심해' 이거 한마디밖에없습니다.

58.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 octobre 2014
Писалось до выхода
Сейчас 16:42 и я жду. Еще 3 часа и 16 минут до запуска. Я не знаю что делать. Это ожидание просто сводит меня с ума. А еще эти летсплееры. "Ой, мы уже играем. Посмотрите тут еще прибавили классов. Алхимики у которых травка в сумках растет и минотавры-фермеры." Подонки. Они еще сильнее распаляют во мне желание поскорее поиграть. Ааааааа! Я и без них знаю что игра то супер.
Первая часть, игра в стиле Dungeon crawler, ремейк какого то там Глаза. Офигенная ж игра. Ты играл за рабов которых кинули фиг знает куда, голыми, голодными, где все тебя пытается убить. Клаустрофобия, звуки вращения механизмов потайных дверей, записки дневника какого то безумца в стиле "-Лапки пауков закончились, перехожу на сапоги". А в конце вас ждала встреча с одим из персонажей игры Portal. Жуть неописуемая. Поэтому все и играли.
И вот вышла вторая часть.
  • С такой же красивой графикой, перенесенной из грязных каменных подвалов на просторы внешнего мира - это ж представляете какой вызов был перед разрабами, вместо рисования одних лишь обоссаных троллями каменных стен взять и начать рисовать целые замки, леса, джунгли, пляжи и т.д.? Они с этим справились.
  • С отшлифованной и дополненной механикой развития персонажей. В игре теперь можно сделать корову-паладина! Прям как в варкрафте!
  • Новыми загадками.
  • Большим количеством врагов.
  • Новым оружием. Да, в игре теперь есть огнестрел!
Но при всех этих плюсах все же есть ощутимый минус. В игре нельзя сыграть за дворфа. Как разработчики могли пропустить этот момент? Добавили каких то крыс, но о гномах не подумали. И это в игре про подземелья. И...
Вы все еще читаете обзор? Бегом покупать, тем более пока скидка есть! Игра полностью себя окупает.
Думатойн вас сохрани.
 
Dworfkin

Évaluation publiée le 15 aout 2022
While not as good as the first it was an ok game.

Didn't like almost all of the changes from the first game:
-No more elemental arrows/bolts.
-Weapons got split up into light/heavy and 1/2 handed weapons, pretty weird decision .
-Implementation of power moves, at this point i don't even know if they were in the first game but i used them to get the achievement and that's it.
-I feel like heavy armors weighted more compared to the first game, if so i don't like this change.
-Firearms were so useless didn't even bother with them more than a test.
-A LOT of backtracking, but you do have a hub that helps you teleport to 4 general areas but it's still really annoying how much backtracking you have to do.
-Hated the fire kamikaze spirits, the wind/leaf spirit was annoying to deal with since i didn't have dispel and only the etherial dagger.

Off those were a lot of negatives, but i did like the game and what they tried to do with the island. While the first ending is pretty straight forward the second one requires of you to complete everything on the map to have enough power gems to access the secret area of the trickster.

Liked the little easter egg with the 'relic' that is actually the machine boss from the first boss buried in the desert.

It was an enjoyable game, but not as good as the first. Hope they do make a third game since this was a bit of a let down.
 
Setorrs The Lollygagger

Recommandé
27.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 décembre 2016
Wow, just wow. I have had my eye on this series but since the first installement seemed too much of a dungeon crawler, I didn't end up bying it. Now got this from the humblebundle and had to play it from start to finish in just few days. Although I consider myself a gaming veteran this genre is totally unknown to me. So for me everything was pretty much new. For me the closest thing that is anything similar would be Dark Souls with a touch of Baldur's Gate.

I started the game with premaid party and normal difficulty. Turned out to be the just right option for me as the game was challenging from start to finish although it never had moments where I felt that I couldn't get forward without leveling. LoG2 is basically a grid based action rpg, where you guide 4 man group in a hostile island. Island's master taunts you in every turn to beat his monsters and puzzles. The game is a hybrid of sandbox and tunnel, most areas have a clear starting point and path from there to finish, yet one can visit most of the areas in any order. There is a certain lack of interaction with the world, meaning there are no characters to talk to or dialogue. There are random pieces of information scattered all over the island that helps with puzzles, finding treasures or taking the next step to completing the mystery.

As one can see from the screenshots, the game looks stunning and has atmosphere in almost all levels. Although the island is a very hostile place, it never feels as unwelcoming as in Dark Souls. Clearing enemies guarantees some peace for a time and there's rarely any rush to explore or go forward. Because the game is gridbased it gives a player certain guarantee that quite many dead ends and awkward corners actually contain something valuable. And since there are no excess of stuff in game apart from late game, one feels compelled to search every corner and try to figure out even the vaguest of puzzles.

In a sense the game sucks you into the world just by being interesting. Although some might argue that without any narration and clear direction the game is too open, I say that it is exactly the reason that kept me going forward, just like Dark Souls. The loot is interesting, varied(although hardly exciting) and actually quite rare. Although the game gives the player a decent amount of stuff to handle, it feels like that most of the items could've been useful if my characters were different or I had arrived there earlier. There are no stores or shops and almost no respawning items, so one cannot just spend stuff because the situation needs it. The more sensible way is to play the situation again and try to beat it with better solution. So unlike most of the current generation RPGs where loot is abundant and totally redundant, this game makes you go after it even though it might hamper you by losing some items most likely needed later in game.

Like I said, the items are oddly boring, and so are the characters. Although I used premade, there isn't too many options to make it different enough to play it again any time soon. Items are mostly just "axe, sword, bow" with different stats, and even the special items are somewhat lacking or "too special", meaning one must drag that dispel dagger with you unless you know the secret of dispel spell. I would like to see more imagination put into the weapons and items in game, so that there would have to be a real building of a balanced group. Now I could just take the best items and forget most spells. Most enemies take damage from all sources, apart from some elementals. So basically taking the best sword or axe is enough.

The game is puzzle heavy, if these are not your thing, you're not going to enjoy the game much. Most areas contain multiple puzzles to crack and most of the time tips to solving are scarce or vague. For me this was the biggest flaw. Although most of the puzzles were interesting and challenging there was just too many pressureplates and hidden buttons. I ended up watching too much of the same wall textures just to find a secret button to secret room or throwing rocks in certain order to pressure plates. In the end it felt somewhat tedious. Some puzzles had clues way too far away to make any sense and considering the fact that moving in this game isn't exactly fast and consumes precious food, I felt compelled occasionally to skip solving the mystery. Towards the end I started using walkthrough to 'skip' some of the more vague puzzles(under under over and all over again) and to get few achievements.

Another problem is something that is a problem in most of the rpg and action rpg games. The mechanics are not explained. It would be fine if this was real world, but these games have different rules and finding out what works and what does not, takes too much time even before we can actually solve the puzzle. So basically few puzzles are not about finding the solution but finding the key mechanic that hasn't been introduced before. This is mostly because they want you to play the game and then play it again knowing most of the stuff, but that's not the case these days. Most games are not played again, so I would like to have a full experience without going to some wiki to find out what is actually what and how it works. Although this game is a lot clearer than most, I still had to go check how wizardry was supposed to work, after using 100 times the fire spell and nothing else.

What I found odd was the fact that although being a gridbased game, the game acts in real time. This gives the player a huge advantage over the enemies who rarely knows sidestepping and seem somewhat playing with turn based rules(as if taking turns while the player does not). I found this a weird design choice although it worked in making the situations feel more urgent. I actually most of the time just decided to stand there and take the beating rather than dancing around the enemy and hitting him from the side just because it felt like fairer for the enemy. Although there are moments where multiple(Even dozens) enemies are coming at you one rarely loses control because the grid gives option to tunnel the enemies into something more manageable.

Even with these flaws I felt I'm not going to play anything similar and as good as this one until they come up with LoG3. Definately one of the best games I've played this year, although I feel like I exhausted the mechanic for some time now and might not return to the Island until the third one.
 
perato
646 produits enregistrés
0
7 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
132.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 octobre 2014
Hi there,

this review is special designed for people who like LG 1 and aren't quite sure to buy it.

I played LG1 with much pleasure and was so hyped when they announced LG2. I thought even if LG2 would be the same like LG1, it would be (imo) a great game.

But what they have done is such an amazing polished game. Here my favorites improvements:

1. New Skillsystem which is imo much better than LG1, because you have more freedom and could try some different ways of leveling.
2. The new class: Alchemie. I love this one. To have with him much more herbs aka potions is such a great thing.
3. New monsters, and more than one bossfight (first in the first 2 hours of the game, second will be the final boss...maybe there are even more ^^)
3. No more empty flasks (maybe some others don't like this decision but i like it)
4. Spells, you don't have to take all the scrolls with you or use other sides in the internet. Learn the spell and Tada on the Traits Rooster you can always read them.
5. Overall the new way to cast spells --> really great game design. They beware the feeling of LG1 but this way it is much more like it used to be :)
6. New Tooltips on weapons, special the description which attribute will improve the damage
7. Outdoor, Indoor, Day and Night Cycle --> Overall much more variety in dungeon design (ladders!!)
8. And i don't know why but i have the feeling that the fights (so far 7h in the game) are much more different between two monster arts. I use much more movement or all ways of making damage as in LG1.
9. New Map + and the new signs to make notes --> Great idea. Obverall the map is so much better.
10. Digging. This way there are a new way to find secrets.

I'm not done yet but if you like LG1 --> B U Y - T H I S - G A M E

You played dungeon master? --> B U Y - T H I S - G A M E

You like dungeon crawler --> B U Y - T H I S - G A M E

You like difficult games --> B U Y - T H I S - G A M E and turn on a few options to make it real hard :)

You don't like difficult games --> B U Y - T H I S - G A M E and turn off a few options or play in normal/easy
 
Nagumo

Évaluation publiée le 13 septembre 2015
Moins claustrophobique, plus riche et complexe que Legend of Grimrock 1, ce second opus s’adresse encore plus aux vétérans du genre, avec un niveau de difficulté plus élevé, et une aire de jeu beaucoup plus grande, à en perdre la tête. C’est pourquoi je recommande aux débutants de commencer par le premier épisode. Et si l’aventure vous a enchanté comme de très nombreux joueurs, alors, Legend of Grimrock 2 est la suite qui répond à toute vos attentes. Des dizaines d’heures de jeu sont nécessaire pour en voir le bout. Et quand il n’y en a plus, il y en a encore, avec l’éditeur de niveaux et les nombreux donjons créée par la communauté.

Évaluation publiée le 4 septembre 2015
Plus élaboré et varié que le premier, notamment grâce aux accès extérieurs. Mais... la sauce ne prend pas, et l'ennui vient vite. La variété des décors ne suffit pas à empêcher la monotonie du gameplay. Un jeu de rôle sans PNJ, sans dialogue, sans personne, moi, ça ne me botte pas. C'était bien il y a 25 ans quand on avait que ça, mais là bof.

A bout de 13 heures de jeux, j'abandonne, ça ne m'amuse plus.
Dans le genre oldschool case par case, j'ai largement préféré le dernier Might & Magic.
 
Redd
793 produits enregistrés

6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
26.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 octobre 2014
Dungeon crawling in the style of Eye of the Beholder at its modern finest. A fantastic sequel to the first legend of Grimrock. Almost everything from the original returns, and almost everything has been improved upon.

The developers have spared no effort to improve upon the foundation set in the first game. Let's start with building a party. There is significantly more depth this time around. This new game has 8 classes up from the original 3, 5 races up from the original 4. But it doesn't end there. Tool tips provide more information. Classes no longer lock you to a set of 6 specific skills. Rather, there are 16 total skills that you are able to choose between to customize your character how you see fit. You want a frontline knight who also can cast a poison bolt here or there? Done. The number of options also leads to a large number of interesting choices. Sure, an insectoid has great mental stats making for a natural wizard. But they can also get superior armor, making them easily able to play the tankiest of tanks.

All these options will warm the hearts of anyone that loves to get deep into the numbers. While I find building a party great fun, don't worry if that is not your cup of tea. The game provides a default party that you can use, and it doesn't take a lot of work to make a barbarian that focuses in strength, damage, and more strength.

As an aside, the character portraits have gotten a major and much needed overhaul. Your party will look much better than last time around, guaranteed.


Once you have a party you are dumped on an island. Filled with common pirate tropes the designers do a good job of pulling you in, with a steady stream of monsters, loot and puzzles that all gradually increase in strength. The monsters are a major improvement over Grimrock 1. There is a greater variety right out of the gate. In addition this game has added memorable boss encounters, something the first game in the series lacked. The environments too are more varied, adding above ground areas to the strictly dungeoneering of the first game. And the maps are much larger.

There are new options and attention to detail everywhere. There are now day and night cycles. You can dig for treasure. Combat now includes firearms and dual wielding. New kinds of puzzles. Larger variety of weapons and improved weapon descriptions. Tons of new loot. You will need all of your new toys to succeed, because like the first one combat can be tough for the unprepared.

Top to bottom this game is an improvement over the original. This is a modern take on classic dungeon crawling that is very satisfying for fans of the genre.

10/10
 
Random
0
19 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Non recommandé
105.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 décembre 2021
This is one of these cases why I (and it seems I'm not alone) would appreciate somewhat more resolution in the scoring system, or at least a "neutral" scoring option. The game certainly isn't terrible, and the amount of work that went into creating a game as huge as this one, in particular in comparison to its predecessor, is reason alone for giving Almost Human some credit.

This being said, while I initially enjoyed it, I had to force myself to continue and to finish it and I simply cannot recommend a game that feels like a chore. Still, I did finish it, and I am, as such, expecting the occasional moronic comment saying "So you give a thumbs down to a game you have spent more than 100 hours playing, lol?". Just as I would expect a movie critic to watch the whole movie before reviewing it, I cannot understand why this should be any different for a video game. I have bought the game and I am entitled to play it to the end and still have an opinion about it that might deviate from yours. Still, it is, obviously, my personal opinion that has been shaped by the copy of Eye of the Beholder II, which I got in 1993 and which is, arguably, one of the greatest grid-based dungeon crawlers of all time. This experience has set me on a quest for a similar experience, which I was unable to obtain up to now.

So, here we have it, the good, the meh, and the ugly.

The good:
- The graphics are very good and the surroundings are diverse, especially in comparison to LoG1.
- The music is immersive and very suited for the type of game.
- Some of the puzzles are rather inventive and puzzles are certainly not repetitive.
- The bestiarium is varied.
- At least there is some story, in LoG1 there was none at all. In the beginning of LoG2, the game feels driven by a bit of mystery ("Where am I?", "Why am I here?", "Who is doing this and why?"). However, it wears off pretty quickly (see below).
- The game world is huge.
- The idea of the farmer class and its leveling is really inventive.

The meh:
- While the game world is huge, it also is very connected. An item in area 1 could be a key item you'd need in area 2 on the other end of the map, sometimes without a clear hint.
- The amount of puzzles is so high that you might wonder whether Almost Human really wanted to create a Dungeon Master kind of game or rather something like Myst. While I was able to solve most of the puzzles independently, for some of the puzzles, the hints were really way too vague.
- While there is a considerable amount of spells that can be learnt, they are all pretty much the same in the end.
- The firearms skill turns out to be a major letdown.

The ugly:
- It feels very strange that attributes (strength, dexterity, vitality, willpower) are raised much more during the course of the game than skills. E.g., while my minotaur barely managed to maximize three skills (15 skill points in total) by the end of the game, his strength went up from 25 to 65.
- Still no NPCs, which also implies that the party you start out with is up to 4 characters and cannot be extended, nor changed during the course of the game.
- Almost all monsters, from the beginning of the game to the end, have a ridiculous amount of hit points and really do tons of damage. Even your level 15 party can be brought down by just a few of the earlier monsters surrounding you.
- As the story really never develops, it blands out very quickly and the interaction between the party and the main antagonist is mostly limited to taunting notes that are left behind by the latter, revealing no plot at all.
 
allwrong
0
7 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0

Évaluation publiée le 21 aout 2016
Thank you, thank you, thank you!

Playing this game (and the first iteration) has been a wonderful glimpse back into my childhood. I was an avid Dungeon Master, EoTB, Black Crypt, etc player on my trusty Amiga500 and no game since now has ever brought back the pure immersement I enjoyed with those. Legend of Grimrock 1 & 2 are an absolute joy! How can I be sure of this? I would say the utter heartbreaking feeling I felt upon completing every inch of the game and realizing I would have to wait for the possibility of more sequels in the future...

Please, Grimrock 3?

31.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 juin 2016
Better than the original Grimrock in pretty much every way. As long as you enjoy this kind of old-school RPG, you can't really go wrong with Grimrock 2. On the other hand, between the challenging puzzles and the overall diffuculty this game is certainly not for everyone. I played through the game on normal.

The good:
- Nice varied locations
- While still not perfect, the RPG mechanics are a big improvement over Grimrock 1
- Lots of puzzles and secrets

The bad:
- Some of the enemies force you to rethink your tactics, but overall the combat is still fairly clunky and heavily based on kiting. This was certainly the weakest part of the game for me
- Loot distribution felt off, there were huge caps in the game where there were no upgrades for certain weapon types

The ugly:
- Many of the puzzles are very obtuse, this is the one area where the game is probably even worse than the original
 
Masa

Évaluation publiée le 19 octobre 2014
A couple of years ago I could compare Legend of Grimrock to Eye of the Beholder, only with more customization and gorgeous visuals.
Today I can easily compare Legend of Grimrock 2 to Eye of the Beholder 2: The Legend of Darkmoon. The comparison stands, and guys from Almost Human truly deliver a masterpiece which would make its predecessors proud.

It's almost like it is nineties again, when my party members explored the vast temple of Darkmoon. Only it's 2014, and I'm totally immersed in the atmosphere of the island of Nex and its lush vistas and deep dungeons.

Truly, worth every penny and then some more.

Not going to list pros and ♥♥♥♥, little things don't matter in this grand adventure.

82.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 octobre 2014
EDit- Let me add a quick Eng comment to the game: Grimrock 2 its a very well done dungeons crawler game. Like most titles with this kind doent have huge storyboard or dozen quests to keep track of because the main reference its Dungeon Master itself, not past mid 90' "evolutions". That gave the DevTeam the chance to focus in maze design and puzzles concept, instead of creating a world, filled with dozens, but often flat, quest giver. Hard to give a "difficulty rating", the game have many challenging puzzles and riddles, but almost each one just need player focusing about details, visual,sound, reaction by the environment to player actions. Puzzles like " The Runemaster Trial " or "The Archives " rises Grimlock 2 as a masterpiece. Keep the Good Work ^^/


Il videogioco in questione si candida a mio avviso come lo “stato dell’arte” nel suo genere. Riuscire a riproporre ♥♥♥ efficacia meccaniche di gioco così antiche, non è cosa da poco. I tizi della Almost Human hanno saputo realizzare un videogioco che omaggia il genere, riprendendo molti elementi da titoli del passato, distinguendosi però ♥♥♥ la qualità degli enigmi, la cura dei dettagli, la complessità delle mappe. Il livello di sfida potrà sembrare elevato ai neofiti del genere, che potrebbero avvilirsi e bloccarsi molto presto. Un solo consiglio per loro: staccate la spina. Quando sarete convinti di aver cercato ovunque, provato tutte le combinazioni, interpretato ogni vago indizio, spegnete tutto, fate una passeggiata, un sonnellino o – se proprio avete tempo da perdere – un’altra sessione su Destiny. Quando riavvierete Legend of Grimrock 2 posso quasi assicurarvi che, riosservando la mappa, ripercorrendo aree già visitate, rileggendo gli stessi indizi, otterrete risultati diversi e migliori. Enigmi quali “Runemaster Trial” o “The Archives”, tanto per fare due esempi e, mettervi in guardia, rappresentano l’ossatura del gioco e, ne sono convinto, lo renderanno un videogioco indimenticabile, non solo tra gli appassionati del genere.


Recensione completa qui : http://www.nrsgamers.it/recensione-legend-of-grimrock-ii-dungeon-crawlers-strike-back/

Évaluation publiée le 25 octobre 2014
3Dダンジョン探索アドベンチャー。またパズルアクション。

ありとあらゆる点でIに圧倒的なボリュームと改善と進化を与えた作品。
地上探索、水、職、魔法、銃追加、バランス調整、仕様改善などなど・・・
Iが楽しめたならIIも絶対に楽しめると確信を持って言える作品です。

パズルは英語が読めなくても大体は大丈夫です。一部難しいですが。
戦闘難易度は難しくなりました。
敵の種類の増加、ボスの増加、いつもの嫌らしい敵配置、幅広いトラップ、やり応えがあります。

Iをやっていなくても問題ありません。
この手のゲームに興味ある方は是非。
価格分の価値は確実にあります。

113.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 mars 2016
Спустя 90 часов и раздумий всё-таки созрел для обзора.

Что особенно порадовало - открытые пространства. Признаюсь, в первой части частенько уставал от постоянных подземелий. Здесь же такого нет.

Дух приключений и исследований витает на каждой клеточке карты. Хочется обследовать всё и вся. Ведь секреты стоят того, к тому же облегчат дальнейшее прохождение. Но при всем при этом, легкой игру язык не повернется назвать.

Загадки отличные, некоторые сложные, некоторые легкие, но самая главная загадка, которую мы решаем на протяжении всей игры (я об скрытой концовке), просто приводит в неописуемый восторг. Когда ты полчаса/час/три ходишь и думаешь, что "головы" не просто так расставлены, а затем догадываешься до истины - невероятно. Еще после про себя говоришь - "Ну это же очевидно!!".

А такой поздний обзор связан с тем, что навыходило на данный момент много очень качественных модов. Перечислю несколько: Eye of the Atlantis, Mystrock Artisans Path, Finisterrae, The Crack of Doom, Korus Island, The Legend of the Lost Dwarf Kingdom of Kahrak'arul.
Так что сейчас отличная возможность вернуться в полюбившуюся игру после долгого перерыва, чтобы вновь ощутить радость приключений и секретов. А также подождать выхода 3 части =)
 
UnfoRGiveN

9 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
50.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 décembre 2014
This is too much of a good thing.

The Grimrock games are grid-based first-person RPGs, with roots in classic table-top D&D. Build 4 characters from a number of stats & specialties, start with no gear & explore an entire island of traps, monsters, dungeons & puzzles.

The game, though fun, quite often feels overwhelming. The open-ended exploration (until you're stopped or stumped by a puzzle or locked door) often leaves me at a loss as to where I'm supposed to go.

The much more linear structure of the 1st Grimrock (moving progressively downward in one dungeon) was a lot more manegeable.

The game is a lot of fun, but its greatest challenge isn't the combat, it's the tedium of re-treading the same steps over & over again.
 
grislexian
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
134.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 aout 2022
ProJared gave this a 10 out of 10, but I am not so sure. Too many times you will have your progress hindered by extremely obscure puzzles, with even more vague and confusing "hints", or no hints at all in the case of the "Temple Of The Highborn puzzle" which has to be the stupidest, and most unfriendly puzzle in any game I can remember...How are players supposed to know what to do Devs??? You will spend a lot of time back-tracking through empty areas trying to find where you went wrong. Also the water "swimming" sections are a complete joke as the party walks about underwater...before they either find a ladder or drown. The "square dancing" combat is more frantic than tactical, and staring at every wall looking for buttons is not fun.

A decent game, but don't let nostalgia blind you to it's faults.

Recommandé
36.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 janvier 2015
It may sound counter-intuitive and contradictory by its nature, but this is a square-based open world game. Of course it is not “Skyrim”-like open world, but you actually can go wherever you like, do there whatever you want, and you do not need 100% completion to see the end titles. Of course, the game is still square-based, you can’t expect to be able to put basket on someone’s head, actually there are no NPCs at all, it is still a dungeon crawler. And of course completing 100% percent of the game gives you more immersion into the world and story.

What I personally really like is limitations the mechanics make you work around, tactics you should learn and skills you acquire (to never need them again naturally!). What I disliked is the no problem of throwing away an item you’re going to need later without knowing it and without an easy way to find it later.

Role playing system of the game is massively reworked in comparison to the first installment, so one may need a couple of test runs to decide which party to go with. The world looks astonishing. And yes, secrets in the game are mostly very satisfying, though some can be really difficult to get. That might be actually the main reason to play it.
 
garvarg
1
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
64.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 avril 2023
Almost Human Games один из немногих разработчиков, кто делает именно для игроков, любящих данный жанр и не пытается добавить кучу лишнего хлама и механик, лишь бы угодить всем (домохозяйкам, любителям клубнички, 5 летним карапузам, которые уже научились нажимать на кнопки, ЛГБТ сообществу и т.д.). Парни, низкий поклон Вам. Только не останавливайтесь. У Вас есть своя аудитория и она ждет третью часть. Ну а теперь об игре. Слышали что-то о Stonekeep. Если нет, поздравляю Вас, вы еще очень молоды. Ну а если взглянуть на эти игры, то они очень похожи по механике и тем, кто зависал в Stonekeep однозначно советую. Игра по механике так же не сильно отличается от первой части Legend of Grimrock. Тот случай, когда разработчики взяли все самое хорошее из первой части и сделали ПРОСТО ШЕДЕВР. В этой игре практически нет недостатков, но начну все таки с плюсов.

Основные плюсы. 1. Сюжет не сказать что вау, но он есть и он достаточно неплох. 2. Достаточно наполненный мир, количество разных мобов, количество боссов хватает (конечно же всегда хочется больше, но и этого хватает, чтобы насладится игрой). 3. Достаточное разнообразие уникальных характеристик для отыгрыша выбранной роли каждого из 4 сопартийцев. 4. Достаточное разнообразие доспехов, оружия в игре, достаточное разнообразие магии. 5. Достаточное количество уникальных локаций. Локации среднего размера и не успевают надоесть. 6. Очень много секретов, тайников и спрятанного снаряжения, игра награждает за разгадку всех элементов, да и к тому же пройти на последней сложности без соответствующей амуниции будет очень тяжело. 7. Очень классная музыка коллектива Scoring Helsinki до момента начала игры. В самой игре музыка отсутствует из-за необходимости передачи информации о перемещении и нахождении врагов по близости и других элементов игры. 8. Неплохая боевка, практически ни чем не отличающаяся от описанных выше игр, за исключением того, что здесь чаще можно ходить по квадрату и наносить урон мобам без получения урона сопартийцами. 9. Очень неплохая графика, каждая локация настолько классно передается, прямо ощущается своя атмосфера (я в большом восторге).

Основные минусы (по моему мнению они тут есть). 1. Ограниченное количество некоторых важных ресурсов (мухоморов – из них делается зелье лечения). И если проходить игру с невосстанавливающимися кристаллами на последней сложности , то к концу игры понимаешь, что все капут, игра не будет пройдена, ну или нужно стать суперменом и больше не получать урон. 2. Очень много секретов, которые чтобы найти, нужно излазить все стены, что иногда напрягает, особенно в закрытых кирпичных помещениях. 3. Так и не понял зачем нужен фермер, только для получения достижения? Или у него есть какая-то миссия. Он совершенно бестолковый или я не разобрался. 4. Порой для отгадки некоторых ребусов дается очень мало информации. Приходится много тыкать вслепую, прежде чем разобраться.

Однозначно РЕКОМЕНДУЮ всем любителям РПГ с олдскульной боевкой в стиле Stonekeep. Такой ШЕДЕВР пропускать нельзя. Кто играл в первую часть и Stonekeep однозначно к прохождению (200% что не пожалеете).

Оценка: 10/10.
 
Wayfarer
863 produits enregistrés
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
59.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 février 2022
Legend of Grimrock 2 brought me back to my gaming beginnings, to Eye of the Beholder serial that I played a very long time ago, and loved it completely. So, this game has a unique movement mechanics. You will found no game today that works that way. The whole map is divided into squares and you move one square at the time. You have four people in the party, in formation, 2 in front row, 2 in second row. Second row characters basically can not use melee weapons cause they can not reach the enemy.

Sure, there is skill that you can take that you can use second row guys to attack with swords, but it is better to use them as a mage and/or guy that uses pistol or musket. Or throwing weapons. You have many options what and how to use. This is a classic RPG, with skills and upgrading and items, and this great movement way, that was considered in the past as something that is not so cool. But actually, it is.

I was so happy that I found this game, and got to the point that I actually installed it and played it. It brought back all the nice memories when I was discovering what games could really be. And how they can advance, and be greater and better things. Even though now is February, this game is for me game of the year. It has excellent riddles, and it offers you a lot for your money.

If you are RPG fun, if you are old school gamer, hell, even if you are newbie, you should check this game out. It has such a nice atmosphere, it is wrapped in mistery, and it offers great satisfaction with every small victory and with every small upgrade of your characters. Maps are huge, riddles are many, and you will have 50-70 hours of pure joy, way more then other game can offer nowadays (they mostly offer 25-35 hours of single player gameplay for price of 60€). You seriously can not miss with this one. Pure gem.
 
CleonHR

483 produits enregistrés

12 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
58.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 novembre 2014
If you haven't played the first game, stop looking at this page and go play that first. It's a great dungeon crawler and will help you enjoy this game so much more. Grimrock 2 is a major improvement over the already enjoyable first game. Compared to the first game, you will now see:

  • An open world island with different dungeons, rather than one single linear dungeon. You will revisit most areas now
  • A serious overhaul on the atmosphere to make it feel like there isn't even a grid system
  • Textures that look like they're 4k resolution
  • Harder puzzles and riddles, making it very possible that you will not find all of the secrets on your first run
  • Chests instead of randomly placed stashes
  • Much more monsters, including new mini-bosses
  • Much more items (Firearms as a new weapon type)
  • Magic works like swype keyboards now, making it faster to cast
  • Weapons now can be charged to use their special abilities, rather than having you randomly do the effect.
  • A new race that can fit almost any role
  • 5 new classes, one of which is completely unique and makes the game somewhat harder
  • New difficulty settings, like only saving at crystals and one-use crystals
  • Very smooth optimization and the game only requires 1 gigabyte
  • More hours of gameplay. My first run took about 38 hours on hard with ironman turned on
  • More workshop possibilities with the updated development kit

I seriously can't think of any downgrades from Grimrock 1 to 2, other than the removal of set effects on some of the early armors like leather. I would have also liked the ability to change voices for characters to fit your own custom portraits and the ability to create your own classes and races, but the large amount of races and classes is fair. This game is beyond worth $24.
 
Oxami
565 produits enregistrés
0

Évaluation publiée le 6 novembre 2014
✓ Пройти Legend of Grimrock 2 на максимальной сложности, не пользуясь гайдами.
✓ Потрогать трёхдневную щетину и понять, что это был тяжелейший theдротский пароксизм.
✓ Всё равно остаться довольным ^_^

P.S. Исследуя тайл за тайлом этот без дураков живописный мир, чувствуешь себя первооткрывателем; после успешного решения некоторых местных загадок — грёбаным гением, хотя в сущности они не такие уж и сложные. После двух сражений с Мастером буквально болят пальцы, а, всё-таки найдя The Relic, понимаешь, что только что выполнил Квест с большой буквы, ибо настолько эффектно были спрятаны подсказки. Было потрачено немало времени, но это определённо того стоило.
*epicface*
