1
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
51.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 janvier 2018
Legend of Grimrock 2 is an old school tile-based dungeon crawler that innovates and improves on old design.

The Good:
+Fantastic level design which is an equal mix of puzzles, secrets, and combat.
+Lots of starting options for characters and classes.
+Lengthy campaign and big mod community.

The Bad:
-Music is decent, but it gets repetitive and there are way too few sound effects.
-UI is clunky and sifting through for inventories for potions is too much, a hotbar would solve this.
-Save often, the devs are downright cruel and will spawn deadly enemies way above your level.

Bottom Line:
Legend of Grimrock 2 is a niche title that does an old genre proud, but it is not for everyone. I recommend playing with a walkthrough nearby so you don't get stuck on puzzles for too long, as this can easily break the pacing.
 
RustyRaven
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
40.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 novembre 2023
Main menu music slaps harder than the first game.

Played this game immediately after the first. I gotta say, I have somewhat mixed feelings about it.

First, the good!

- bosses are awesome
- soundtrack is awesome
- environment is awesome
- combat is fun (and awesome)

now the reason i have mixed feelings:

Unlike the first game, several of the puzzles in this game are just downright cryptic and vague. Not to mention, since this game is "open world", puzzles can span across the entire island making you run around looking for what's what. And even then, half the clues or even start of the puzzle can be completely hidden from view. I had to look up how to solve a couple things only to find out there was a pressure plate that I couldn't see because the game's lighting wouldn't let me see that far.

The biggest problem is that it isn't a "d'oh! I'm so silly, I should've seen that!" It's a "I literally couldn't have seen that." Not just lightning too. Like i mentioned, some puzzles were EXTREMELY vague and made no sense even with a guide to explain it. (Especially that stupid pillar/lever puzzle in the castle. what the heck was that?!)

Anyways. I think I prefer the first game, to be honest. However, this one is really good too. It looks gorgeous and added some QoL things missing from the first game. Actual boss fights, music, a lot more variety of monsters, weapons and gear.

I would definitely say get the first game. If you loved it, get the second to atleast try it out. It's 100% worth playing through to the end. Even if you get stuck and have to look up some guides ;)
 
Gay Lord

Wertung: 9/10

Non recommandé
37.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 février 2022
Feels like a long chore whenever I go back to play, which is a shame because I really want to like this game. The puzzles start to get very vague to the point where you're 100% going to be wandering around like an idiot looking for small keys or hidden wall switches that the devs couldn't seem to get enough of.

The spells are overall very underwhelming with wacky damage scaling and it gets to the point where they're mostly useless unless you have an Alchemist making a bunch of Mana Potions so you can spam spells. The firearms are disappointing in comparison to dinky looking swords and large wooden clubs which makes zero sense since they're shooting BULLETS! Speaking of, oh man this combat...

The combat began to take me out of the game completely because it quickly devolves into "square kiting the big dumb mob" or "square kiting while making sure you don't get cornered because it's a mob trap room" over and over again... Or you get the really stupid mobs that you just have to walk side to side for because their AI gets so easily confused to the point where their in-game model is literally turning directions in the same position because they don't know what to do...

I'm going to play more of this game till I beat it, but the puzzles and combat really take away from everything else in the game, which is pretty bad since that's all it seemingly has to offer.
 
Jelq Frost

Recommandé
17.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 octobre 2014
It´s games likes these that save the overused label "retro game" from becoming irrelevant and trivial. Legend of Grimrock 2 takes only the strong and healthy roots from the RPG-past and nourishes them to grow into something utterly fun and motivating. A clever modernization that swings the once bumpy genre into todays comfort zone, a challenging difficulty and a huge world map with a crazy amount of details not only make Grimrock 2 a much better game than it´s predecessor, it´s also one of the best RPG-experiences you´ll have this year.

Anbo-Jyutsu
2,343 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
33.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 avril 2020
The Legend of Grimrock 2 is an excellent sequel that doesn't just provide more of the same but also greatly increases the scope of the game.

The first Legend of Grimrock was a fun mixture of dungeon crawling, RPGing and puzzle solving that had few shortcomings, mainly that there wasn't much diversity in environments and combat was rather dull. Now the combat in LoG 2 is basically same as it was in the first game, however there is a much larger variety of enemies (there are even boss battles) and the enemy AI has been improved so the combat isn't as dull as it was in the first game. Consequently I found the game to be more challenging than the first game but it was still manageable.
Still the combat is hardly he selling point of the game but fortunately the game shines on other aspects.

The environments in this game look much better than in the first game and there is a much larger variety of different environments. Instead of taking place in a single dungeon the game takes place on an island with interconnected areas and dungeons. Because of this the exploration and searching for secrets is significantly more fun.

The RPG options have been greatly increased and now there are several different classes whereas the previous game only had three. Skill system has also been reworked and there are few new skills such as alchemy and firearms. Skills also provide more noticeable benefits so every level up feels significant.

The puzzles naturally make a return and puzzle solving is definitely my favorite part of the game. There is a large variety different puzzles and they all feel fun to solve (well there's one that's bs in my opinion). Some puzzles require the player to carefully examine the environments, some require outside of box thinking and some are riddles. My favorite puzzles were "treasure hunt" puzzles. Every now and then the player discovers a map or a note with more or less vague hints on how to find a treasure and finding the treasure feels very satisfying.

Now I do have few bugbears with this game. Firstly the spellcasting feels awkward. In the first game you had to click different symbols to draw a shape to cast a spell. In this game you have to hold down the mouse button while you drawing the shape and I found it to be rather annoying when I was simultaneously trying to avoid enemies and managing my other party members.

Secondly the boss battles were somewhat disappointing. Most bosses come with a horde of enemies and the difficulty comes solely from managing the mobs rather than from the actual boss itself. Usually the boss becomes completely trivial after you have dealt with the enemies. I'd preferred more bosses with unique behavior and AI. Now there are few interesting boss battles but overall the bosses could have been much better.

Finally there's an enemy in the game that's completely invulnerable against common attacks and it can only be damaged with one specific spell and with one specific weapon. Now I was fortunate and I discovered the spell before I ran into those enemies but they'd have been really frustrating if I hadn't.

Still I'd say that overall the Legend of Grimrock 2 is a delightful mixture of dungeon crawling, RPGing and puzzle solving. I was feeling actually little bit sad after I had completed the game and I wish there was Grimrock 3.

edit: Oh I forgot to mention that the game comes with a dungeon editor and there are few fan made dungeons in the workshop.
 
JJBoren
288 produits enregistrés
0
10 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
55.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 octobre 2014
１が面白いと思った人はマストバイ！な出来のDRPG+リアルタイムアクションバトル+パズルなゲームです。

１に比べて探索MAPが2-3倍になり、地上や水中にもいけ、
しかも攻略順やそもそも攻略するかどうかをある程度自由に決められるように。
ボスキャラや特殊な状況下での戦闘も多くなり色々な戦いを楽しめるようにもなりました。
新職業やスキルなども大量に追加され構成の幅も広がってます。

○秒以内に△に行けみたいなパズルが減って、純粋に考えさせるパズルが多くなったので、
その意味でアクション要素は薄れたかも。

Évaluation publiée le 21 février 2023
Ich vermute, ich bin nicht für so ein Spiel gemacht. Der Style gefiel mir und auch die Kämpfe waren spannend. Selbst die etwas andersartige Bedienung war erfrischend. Aber die Rätsel und mit was ich wohin muss, waren mir zu viel. Häufig lief es auf "trial and error" heraus oder ein Guide nebenbei lesen. Darauf hatte ich dann keine Lust mehr.

_____

I guess I'm not made for such a game. I liked the style and the battles were exciting. Even the slightly different controls were refreshing. But the puzzles and what to do with where were too much for me. Often it came down to "trial and error" or reading a guide on the side. I didn't feel like doing that anymore.

Recommandé
34.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 juillet 2019
J'avais adoré le premier Grimrock, celui-ci est tout aussi bon, mais un peu différent.

Les décors sont plus aérés et changent de l'atmosphère oppressante du premier opus.
La difficulté a été relevée, surtout en hard. La construction d'un groupe homogène est importante pour faire face avec sérénité à la foule d'ennemis du bestiaire.

Un très bon titre à posséder si vous avez aimé le premier jeu. Si vous ne connaissez pas le genre, je pense que Grimrock 1 est mieux pour découvrir les Dungeon Crawlers.

Je n'ai que 5 heures de jeu au moment de l'avis, j'y revindrais lorsque j'aurai fini le jeu.

Recommandé
37.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 décembre 2017
전작을 넘어선 그림락 2
전작보다 퍼즐도 다양하고 복잡해져서 푸는 재미도 더해졌고 피지컬을 요구하던 퍼즐은 줄어서 손고자라도 해법만 알면 모든 퍼즐을 풀 수 있게 됐다.

전작은 직업마다 스킬이 정해져 있어 스타팅 클래스가 중요했는데 이번작은 클래스는 클래스 보너스만 받고 스킬은 입맛대로 찍을 수 있어서 파이터지만 마검사 컨셉으로 키울 수도 있고 마법사지만 간달프마냥 마법은 안쓰고 칼질로 싸울 수도 있다. 이 점은 캐릭 선택과 성장의 자유도가 커져서 꽤 좋았다. 그러나... 나이트나 위저드는 타 클래스에 비해 베이직 보너스가 고자라 이 점은 아쉬웠다. 물론 농부같이 폐급으로 보이나 잘 활용하면 빠른 성장으로 재미를 볼 수 있는 클래스도 있긴 하다.

그림락은 매직 앤 매직으로도 불리는 왈도전처럼 마법의 효율이 좋지는 않다. 일일히 마법창 열고 룬 연결하고 손이 많이간다. 그렇다고 마나가 넘치는 것도 아니라 난사도 못한다. 주로 뭉쳐있는 적을 한꺼번에 털거나 상태이상을 유발하는 cc기로 활용하는 정도라 없으면 뭔가 나사가 빠진것 같고 많으면 난이도가 오히려 헬이 되기에 마이트와 매직의 밸런스를 생각하면 적절하다고 생각한다. 이 마법도 편해진게 전작은 마법을 한번 쓰면 마법책이 닫혀버려서 일일히 다시 열어주고 주문식도 다 외워서 써야했는데 이번작은 일부러 마법책을 닫지 않는 이상은 닫히지 않고 주문식도 정보창에 등록이 되기에 주문식을 까먹어도 정보창 보고 쓰면 된다.

확실히 전작에 비해 발전된 모습을 보여 좋았고 후속작이 나오련지는 모르겠으나 이런 자세로 발전해 나간다면 명작 시리즈가 될 법하다.
 
Hellfire Peninsula
0

Évaluation publiée le 16 janvier 2018
9/10

Dungeon-crawler RPG que segue os padrões de D&D no build, estilão old-school e dificuldade absurda.
Diferente do primeiro, a história aqui está mais interessante!
Legend of Grimrock II passa por diversos ambientes e biomas, cheios de segredos e puzzles interessantes.

Recomendo fortemente!

Recommandé
35.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 novembre 2015
They say more of a good thing is still a good thing. I can attest to that, it's true. Legend of Grimrock was basically an Eye of the Beholder clone, even down to its puzzles and annoying spiders, i.e. a dungeon that started out rather bland and simple, but got progressively more difficult and challenging, as well as varied, as you descended towards the boss fight. Eye of the Beholder II had expanded on that formula by allowing you to experience a greater variety of locations, monsters and puzzles. Legend of Grimrock does the same - it's basically the same game with a large and expansive outdoor hub, multiple dungeons and buildings to explore, the ability to have multiple floors in a single level, a broader selection of monsters and even more mind bending puzzles. There are changes to the game as well: a new race and some new classes have been added, the leveling system has been tweaked to be less all or nothing, skill branches are less deep, weapons and armor have been categorized into broad proficiencies, alchemy has been added and magic has been reworked. But ultimately, it's the same game, just bigger and better. Get it. It's great.
 
NaibStilgar
349 produits enregistrés

32.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 novembre 2014
Produit reçu gratuitement

Non era facile riuscire a fare meglio del predecessore, ma Almost Human Ltd. è andata oltre confezionando un titolo davvero eccezionale sotto tutti i punti di vista.

Praticamente privo di difetti, "Legend of Grimrock II" fa tornare in auge il genere dungeon crawler dando ai giocatori un'esperienza unica nel suo genere che, grazie alla tecnologie attuali, si adatta anche a chi vuole conoscere per la prima volta un genere tanto in voga oltre 20 anni fa.
La comunità è già attiva nel creare nuovi mod grazie all'editor integrato nel gioco che si potranno giocare grazie al collegamento diretto ♥♥♥ Steam Workshop direttamente dalle opzioni di gioco.
Tutto questo non farà altro che innalzare la già più che buona longevità.

http://www.gamesark.it/mostra_rece.asp?c=11120140012445189

Évaluation publiée le 19 octobre 2014
I was up until 1am the night I finished this game. An RPG that tests your thought beyond just number crunching, it has some of the most satisfying puzzles I've ever seen in a video game. There are minor problems that you may need to consult a guide for, but overall it's an immensely satisfying experience from beginning to end. Easily one of my favourite games of 2014 and quite possibly all time.

Évaluation publiée le 25 novembre 2016
Long story short, this game basically improves on the first in every possible way. More varied environments, better UI, streamlined leveling system, you name it.

But most of all the sense of exploration. You have a huge island to explore and backtrack around, the number of nooks and crannies and secrets you have missed growing by the minute!

Much like the first game it is challenging, but not unfair. I wholly recommend to anyone who enjoyed the first game, or to anyone that enjoys a good dungeon crawl in general.

Recommandé
119.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 octobre 2023
I would recommend this game (and surprised I didn't do this sooner) because it's great fun.
There is a mod, Final Adventure, which is largely considered to be an improvement over the vanilla game. It's in the workshop and adds a lot more hours of fun.
I was having a blast until I enabled the console to add some balancing. I wanted a box, and accidentally spawned a chest. My last quicksave was over an hour previously. You can see where this was going - I got blocked in by a chest that the Console command could not remove. Apparently, the dev's built in spawn commands, but did not build in remove/destroy commands - not anything that is intuitive to use, anyway. Unfortunately, the workshop mod doesn't show up in any folders for me to use the Dungeon Editor to simply remove the chest, and furthermore, teleporting my party two steps in front of the chest makes the game crash. Game is ten years old now, so that doesn't surprise me, but I'm pretty salty about it.
Short version: Buy the game, play it, enjoy it. Save often. Check out party guides for vanilla, there are good tips out there. (I myself ran Minotaur Barbarian with heavy weapons/armor, Ratling rogue with strength instead of dex and light weapons/armor, insectoid caster who was my jack of all trades for magic, and lizardman sharpshooter, I think? I focused on firearms but vanilla firearms suck, throwing weapons are superior. He was my alchemist.
Best of luck if you buy and play this. If you like dungeon crawlers with good story and puzzle elements, you should have a good time. Just don't spawn a chest in your way when you're trying to spawn in a box for better organization....and your last quicksave is over an hour prior....../wrists

Recommandé
63.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 octobre 2016
I thought that after playing Legend of Grimrock 1 i would never play anything that good for the rest of my life. I was wrong. Legend of Grimrock 2 is without a doubt the best game ever! Interesting, challenging, rewarding, and fun. All the things you can collect have a meaning, all the doors, levers and buttons lead to something new and exciting. Don't ever throw anything away, 'cause you are gonna need it at some point. Hunger is a serious thing, as is gaining experience and choosing your skill points wisely. Legend of Grimrock 2 has a lot of nice outside space to wander around, but they haven't forgotten good old dungeons. I loved every single minute playing this game, and i always wanted more. At work i thought about Grimrock, at the gym i thought about Grimrock. I even dreamt about it, as crazy as that sounds. I just felt i could never get enough of new enemies, secrets and puzzles!

Today, as i finished this game after 55 hours of playing and leave this epic sequal behind me, i am so proud to be Finnish. Thank you, Almost Human. Loved this!
 
Emma Hautamäki

2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
93.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 mars 2021
Legend of Grimrock II is one of the best old school grid-based dungeon crawler RPGs ever!

I really loved Legend of Grimrock I and couldn’t imagine that it could be improved any further. And then Legend of Grimrock II was released! It took everything that was great about the first game and made it bigger and better.

Exploration in this game is a lot of fun. You can decide where you want to go at any given time. Stuck on a puzzle? Just go somewhere else and come back later. I really like that they basically made the game open world. It has a good amount of puzzles with varying difficulty, traps, secrets, hidden loot and challenging enemies.

The graphics are absolutely beautiful to look at and I really like the atmosphere of the game. In the first game of the series we only had the prison with the same bleak walls everywhere. And in this game we have this huge island with forests, swamps, deserts, mines etc.

There is a good amount of different classes and skills and creating a party of four people allows for variety of gamestyles. There are also more enemy types, each with their own combat mechanics. (These damn frogs in the swamp!)

For a more challenging experience you can disable the auto-mapping feature and draw the map manually instead. I would definitely recommend playing it this way at least once.
 
Inno

42.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 juillet 2020
Vor Grimrock 1 wusste ich nicht, dass es das Genre der Dungeoncrawler gibt. Dank dieser beiden Spiele habe ich etwas entdeckt, das mir wirklich viel Freude bereitet.
Es bleibt zu sagen, dass Grimrock 2 es geschafft hat, seinem Vorgänger treu zu bleiben, aber sich gleichzeitig derartig weiterzuentwickeln und zu unterscheiden, dass es den Titel eines würdigen Nachfolgers verdient.
Absolute Empfehlung für jeden, der gerne düstere Dungeons erkundet, knifflige Rätsel lösen möchte, unzählige Geheimnisse aufdecken möchte und knackige Kämpfe austragen will.

Beide Spiele haben sich einen Platz in meinem Herzen erkämpft und diesen redlich verdient.
Danke dafür, liebe Entwickler!

Évaluation publiée le 2 janvier 2016
Really impressive game. Great throwback to the old school RPG games like the Might and Magic/Pools of Radiance type games. I took the easy route on this and used a guide when I got stumped as well as to see both endings. Even with the assistance of a guide AND being on easy, this game was still challenging. Hats off to the gamers who have solved these puzzles without assistance and put the effort into playing on old school/hard. Worth the pickup if you long to find a game worthy of the old school RPG genre.

Évaluation publiée le 6 décembre 2016
If you've played Legend of Grimrock and you enjoyed that, this game is more of the same. I had that figured out from around a quarter into the game and it didn't exactly fail to meet my expectations. There's not enough innovation really, that I can say this is a successful sequel and not just full priced DLC, and many of the things that were wrong with the first game are still wrong with this one. But it was a good formula to begin with and I didn't exactly get tired of it, I finished the game. I got the secret ending. So I guess I like it. Sooo... Yeah. Thumbs up. Sure.

Fantástico! Melhor que o primeiro jogo da série e tomara que a desenvolvedora faça outros jogos! A história é rica, os personagens precisam ser inteligentemente criados e as conquistas apresentam diversos desafios para o jogador!

O enredo faz sentido e os finais (sim, mais de 1 dessa vez!) são bem bacanas. Uma pena que as armas à distância não sejam tão bacanas e diversificadas, mas nada que atrapalhe gravemente o jogo.

Évaluation publiée le 10 octobre 2015
Easily the best dungeon crawl I've ever played. The original is worthwhile as well, but this one tops it in every conceivable way. The puzzles are always novel -- just when you think the designers can't top themselves they come up with new twists and push you to think of old challenges in new ways. Highly recommended even if you aren't a fan of the genre.

Recommandé
35.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 juin 2018
Having been inspired by masterpieces like Dungeon Master and Eye of the Beholder, and taken LoG 1 even further, LoG 2 is most likely the best orthogonal dungeon crawler currently available.

Recommendation: Consider playing the game on easy if you're pressed on time. Normal mode only linearly scales the effort, so only the number of iterations you need to do something increases (e.g attack an enemy).

♥♥♥:
My only gripe with this game is that I was hoping to complete it without refering to any online documentation but a puzzle forced me to have to check the solution (i.e. "follow the light"). Apparently, the puzzle has *two* design flaws that, if you approach the puzzle from a certain trial&error mindset, it becomes impossible to solve (e.g. doors/wall open events aren't activated even though everything is how it should be).

Verdict: Highly recommended to fans of the genre.
 
randomUserId
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
61.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 avril 2018
Perrisimo juego de RPG de fantasia. La secuela esta mejor que el original y los desarrolladores han hecho un gran trabajo.

Jugar esto por primera vez en modo Ironman, sin mapa y ♥♥♥ cristales que se acaban a la primera vez que grabas, haze que sudes cuando llevas mas de 1 hora y media y cauteloso de trampas y emboscadas que desconoces y cuando te pasa y entras en panico y te acabas tus pociones tratando de escapar PERO ES MUY TARDE los ghouls ya te acorralaron y ahora gritas como loco usando toda tu magia y armas y REZANDO que ganes la pelea o perderas todo ese tiempo!!

El ultimo jefe en su dragon aventandote todo lo que puede para detenerte mientras que evades ataques y avientas tus misiles y armas, usando pociones cuando lo necesitas y al fin usando todas esas bombas que guardaste para esta misma pelea.. uff.. delicioso. y deja tu, hay otro jefe despues de ese "secreto" que tambien te deja pensando que mejor hubieras guardado tus bombas para este hdp.

Los jefes en este juego en modo dificil no se pueden tankear, tienes que evadir, correr, pegar, usar magia, escapar, pegar de lejos, esperar en la esquina, pegarle ♥♥♥ tu mega hacha, correr, rezar que no te mate de un p*t*zo, potear, etc. Todo lo divertido, especialmente que si te mata, pierdes media hora de juego.

Los acertijos estan dificiles y sin guia, vas a sufrir al menos que tengas un IQ de 190 o superior :P y mas cuando un error en el acertijo activa una trampa que te mata y si andas jugando como te recomiendo, sufriras! SUFRIRAS!
Esto no es skyrim donde tienes que enparejar dibujitos de la pared, son mamadas.

Los logros son algo dificiles de sacar pero que logro cuando sacas los mas dificiles :)

Este es un juego donde es importantisimo tener un buen grupo de aventureros te super recomiendo que leas todo lo que puedas sobre las ventajas y desventajas de tus builds para que puedas sobrevivir en modo dificil.

Al principio me preocupaba mucho de la comida, pero al final tenia mas de 50 objetos de comida aun disponibles, es dificil que se te acabe al menos que andes descansando a cada rato. No tengas miedo de usar la comida. Segun lei, los mounstruos vuelven a aparecer si dejas la zona durante varios dias, para que las tortugas, serpientes y sapos vuelvas a aparecer.

Sobre builds, yo pude superar este juego en una sola ida, ♥♥♥ un grupo de dos alquemistas para hierbas para curacion, un battlemaster que era el mago ofensivo y me curaba ♥♥♥ el escudo de cristal (bendito escudo que cura) y no me acuerdo el ultimo pero pegaba ♥♥♥ dos dagas desde atras. Dos insectoides enfrente para que no mueran facil, un minotauro que aventaba shurikens y hachas ♥♥♥ super fuerza y el hombre lagarto que pegaba rapido ♥♥♥ sus dos dagas.

A la Leyenda de Grimrock 2 le doy 6 latigos de 8 masoquitas.

Mucha suerte!
 
Shindragan
627 produits enregistrés
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
22.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 novembre 2016
В современном мире существует множество различных франшиз, состоящих из нескольких частей. К сожалению, часто бывает так, что сиквел оказывается гораздо хуже своего предшественника, и тому есть множество причин: разработчики не смогли правильно передать новые идеи, которые пытались воплотить: их задумка оказалась слишком сложна, в результате чего атмосфера приквела была утеряна. Или же они пошли на поводу у фанатов, что в итоге привело к разочарованию оных. К счастью, такого нельзя сказать про LoG2, вышедший в 2014 году от Almost Human Ltd. Как пишут сами разработчики: «LoG is a dungeon-crawling RPG with a modern execution but oldschool heart», и, пройдя игру, я могу с уверенностью сказать, что против истины они не погрешили. По сравнению с первой частью были добавлены несколько новых, чертовски атмосферных локаций: чего стоит одно только мрачное кладбище, покрытое туманом, или болото, находясь в котором, прямо-таки чувствуешь запах мха и сырости. Вишенкой на торте является саундтрек, который погружает игрока в атмосферу с головой.
Геймплей в игре довольно прост: вы управляете партией из 4-х (хотя число может варьироваться в меньшую сторону) пленников, которым предстоит узнать, какие тайны скрывает в себе Гримрок. Вооружившись чем попало, от палок до заклинаний, вы отправляетесь исследовать остров, на котором вам не посчастливилось (или же посчастливилось?) оказаться. Разнообразные враждебные существа – далеко не всё, что встанет на пути игрока: Хозяин Острова заставит вас поломать голову над разгадкой разнообразных головоломок, встречающихся повсеместно. Не стоит, однако забывать и о простых вещах, таких как голод. К тому же, для любителей хардкора есть замечательные опции, например, одноразовые кристаллы сохранения. Для тех, кто жаждет настоящего олдскула, есть режим с неоднозначным названием „Old School Mode“, отключающий карту, так что вам придётся вооружиться карандашом/ручкой и бумагой в клетку и составить свою собственную карту Гримрока.
По всему острову разбросано множество тайников, которые могут приятно удивить вас своим содержимым, или же попытаться сделать вас своим содержимым, так что помните: „it’s unwise to lower your defenses“.

Итог: Legend of Grimrock 2 – отличный вариант как для желающих познакомиться с жанром, так и для тех, чей второй дом – подземелье.
 
Prichma

As a rule I don't write reviews. Been playing games since ZX Spectrum days and this game is as close to Dungeon Master and Chaos Strikes Back as they come. Having good fun with a decent quality game that took moments to download and begin playing. Too many games these days have lost the fun factor, are overlying reliant on graphics and quickly lose their appeal being shallow. G2 definitely has the fun factor!

0
Recommandé
96.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 avril 2022
Все таки офигенная игра, но не для всех.

Плюсы:
-Геймплей (бои с врагами, разгадывание паззлов и исследование мира)
-Красивое окружение
-Атмосфера
-Здесь можно ловить рыбу под водой
-Здесь можно убить врага штанами
-Интересно экспериментировать с билдами, несколько рас и классов на выбор, различные черты, дающие бонусы
-Тонны секретов
-Разнообразие противников
-Можно выкапывать сундуки и раскапывать могилы
-Довольно большой остров с пляжем, лесом, руинами, подземельями
-Можно ставить метки на карте

Минусы:
-Специфическая боёвка, к которой придется привыкать, она реал-таймовая без тактической паузы, есть промахи и цифры урона, помимо WASD вам придется нажимать QE одновременно кликая мышкой на иконки оружия персонажей, вобщем, лучше бы сделали пошаговую боёвку
-Паззлов уж слишком много, и не смотря на то, что есть подсказки, некоторые из загадок вызывают вопрос: "ну и как я должен был это увидеть/додуматься до этого?"
-Сюжета здесь нет
-Диалогов здесь нет (читать вы будете только подсказки и записки данжон мастера)
-В подземельях легко запутаться
-Есть шанс сильно усложнить или запороть прохождение из за неправильно прокачанной партии

Итог: Если не боитесь непривычной, специфической боёвки, трудных паззлов, обожаете тщательное исследование местности и заглядывать под каждый камень или куст, то эта игра для вас.
 
rawma13

Recommandé
58.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 décembre 2022
First up. You don't need to have played the first game to play this one. Both story lines are exclusive.

Grimrock 2 is a grid based RPG game utilizing an older style of play, that takes full advantage of new gaming mechanics. It is a masterpiece of gaming. It forces you to think outside the box, while also literally forcing you into a box. This game and it's predecessor are worth checking out, but Grimrock 2 is definitely the bigger fish. It has an open interconnected world on top of expanding mechanics from the first game, and upping the challenge on both puzzles and combat.

This is probably the best a sequel can get.

Recommandé
34.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 janvier 2020
To be honest I had a different expectations from this game. I heard it's a very good old-school grid-movement RPG with modern graphic. Well is this like Might&Magic, Realms of Arkania, Lands of Lore, Ultima Underworld, Wizardy, even as Stonekeep? Well, unfortunately no. The story here is very shallow, there are practically no NPCs and such. After a while game just starts to get boring. I'm also not fun of real-time battles introduced here. However there are reasons why this game is so high-rated. The game is all about dungeon-crawling and it does that perfectly. Good graphic, large palette of puzzles, and the specific content allows players to create their own dungeons. Game works without issues on Linux (Steamplay). The basic price is too high imho, but game is worthy to be bought on sales or in bundles.

Tak hurááá za pánem ostrova...

Výborný dungeon a stejně jako první díl novodobá klasika. Čistá herní extáze.

+ bezva prostředí otevřeného ostrova, stereotyp nehrozí
+ opravdu hodně herního času (mluvím za ty, co hrají bez návodu) - za ty prachy požehnání
+ spousta tajných místností, bezva nápad se zakopanými truhlami
+ příjemně drsné hádanky (ale lze je vyřešit)
+ atmosféra, grafika, hratelnost, všechno co lze od moderní hry v žánru očekáváte
+ boss s kanónem a vůbec střelné zbraně

Mínusy mě nenapadají, možná trochu dlouhé loadování pozice i na SSD disku.

Samumu
198 produits enregistrés

6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
92.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 décembre 2014
I've put nearly 42 hours into this game over the course of under a week. Grimrock 1 was a really good modernization of the dungeon crawler that I didn't realize I had been missing. Grimrock 2 is possibly the best game I've played this year, which is drawing to a close at the time of writing.

The game is gorgeous. A lot of fans of the first were put off by the game being even partly outdoors, but there are a lot of touches that disguise the grid-based nature of the game, like uneven sands and the like. I never looked at the game and thought 'Now this here doesn't look good.'

Gameplay is much improved from the first. Gone are the days of circle-strafing around every enemy and cheesing the game. Most enemies function in unique ways and require different tactics to approach... I mean, some of them can be circle-strafed, but it's not a reliable tactic for all of them this time, which I appreciate. But I digress, the biggest improvement comes from game feel in a lot of regards. A major boon that you didn't even know you wanted is that each party member has dual weapon slots ala Diablo 2, so you can switch between gear on the fly without having to pull up a menu every time.

Additionally, character selection has variety now. Gone are the 3 classes to go with your 4 party members, as there are a whopping 8 classes to choose from, ranging from nearly essential to wonderfully bizarre. Variety is the spice of life and, honestly, Grimrock 1 was sorely lacking in this regard.

tl;dr Grimrock 1 was good, Grimrock 2 is one of the better games I've ever played. Now if you'll excuse me I have a second campaign to start.
 
The Toilet Salesman Massacre

Absolutely brilliant!
Finished the game in 24hrs and didn't find all the secrets, extras and loved every minute of it. Takes everything from the first game and improves it all. After finishing I just wanted to start again and keep on playing. Can't remember the last time I wanted to do that with a game.

The gameplay works smoothly and I never encountered any bugs. Some of the puzzles can be pretty hard, but with some out of the box thinking and careful scanning of walls and looking around they can all be solved.

Buy this game, you won't regret it!

Recommandé
39.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 juin 2016
Produit reçu gratuitement

This game brought me back to my early years playing games like Wizardry VII and Might and Magic World of Xeen. But this is an evolution of those games. It uses a real-time combat system that takes a bit of getting used to. It actually is pretty fun and does require a certain skill to master.

The atmosphere is great in this game. And I really liked how this improved on the first game by providing a much bigger world to explore. It also was somewhat non-linear. It gave you a bit of freedom to explore the zones in any order. I actually missed an entire zone but still finished the game.

I highly recommend this game if you like the classic crpgs. But be prepared for the real-time combat system. It can be a bit challenging - especially fighting the various bosses.

Recommandé
53.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 janvier 2021
Интересная игрушка, если разобраться. Косит под олдскул, чем-то напомнила мне игру моего детства "Меч и магия: кровь и честь". Геймлей можно разделить на 2 части: это бои и решение загадок (для прохождения и для поиска секретов). Если с боями все более менее понятно (мансим по клеточкам чтоб тебя не коцали и коцаем в ответ), то загадки иной раз без прохождения не пройти, уж больно мудреные попадаются, не говоря уже про те простанные "подсказки" которые могут быть вообще в другой локации. С одной стороны, чувствуешь себя мегамозгом, когда сам их решаешь, а с другой бывают ситуации, когда ты просто мечешься по локации не зная что делать и куда идти. Думаю, если бы эта игра вышла в те времена, когда не было бы интернета и негде было бы прохождение посмотреть я бы ее вечность проходил. Вторая часть мне понравилась больше первой - много разнообразных локаций, а не только однообразное подземелья + система прокачки приятнее. В первой части тоже не особо объясняется, как чего работает, так что можно сразу за вторую браться-разбираться. Еще есть много неплохих фанатских модов, добавляющих новые уровни, что тоже плюс. Официальной русификации хоть и нет, но можно скачать от ZoG, она тоже хорошая, так что это не проблема.

Grimrock 1 and 2 will forever stand as immediate classics within the world of tile-based dungeon crawlers. Skace
1,262 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
28.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 aout 2020
Brilliant game. Really loved this. If you liked the first Grimrock, you should absolutely like this game much more no problem. It's pretty much exactly the first game just... better. Also, the way the story is, you really do not need to play the first game at all. If you've not played Grimrock 1, don't worry, just jump right in here and you'll have just as good a time if not better. This is pretty much what 1 wanted to be but maybe had trouble accomplishing.

The world is more open ended, letting you solve the challenges and puzzles in your own way for the most part.

The puzzles are really vague and rarely a rarely unfair (I only looked up the answer to about 3 this entire game), but overall I loved them. It captures the feel of really old school point and click type games. There's tiny little secret buttons in walls that open up stone doors walls, there's classic pressure plate traps... that kind of thing. Expect it to feel like an old school first person dungeon crawler, just more modern. There's still some clunk, but honestly, it's part of the charm too.

The RPG combat system is really simple. Level up what you want, use weapons how you want. Not really turn taking, but movement is grid based, so its more reliant on stats than actual gameplay. That's fine, it's what you'd expect. It's not bad, it's not AMAZING, but it's pretty good for what it is.

Now the sound design and atmosphere!! That's where this game shines. That's probably the peak thing about this game. All the sounds and visuals and effects are wonderful. Everything feels really mysterious really ancient, really confusing and interesting. The dungeons can feel like some old-school pyramids at times with the traps and old walls and junk. Lighting is good. Yes.

Downsides are what you'd expect from a game like this. Expect a lot of backtracking (you'll unlock plenty of shortcuts but still), expect some inventory management, expect to be stuck on puzzles for a while and expect yourself to get lost and not know where to go. Take a break, come back to it, you'll figure it out eventually.

Anyway! Cool game. Loved it. One of my favorite games I've played this year for sure. Rec it to people who want the 'classic dungeon crawler' feel or people who just want a fairly chill puzzly/rpg/exploration type thing.

 
Sky
935 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
62.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 31 décembre 2022
やっとクリア出来たのでプレイ中に思っていた事を書きます。
まず前提として私は前作未プレイ、英語力は小中学生以下です。
私がこのゲームを買った理由は

①3DダンジョンRPGに興味があった
②人外の種族を採用しているRPGをプレイしたかった　です。

人外種族に興味を抱かれた方にはまずお勧めしません。
種族毎の特徴と言える要素が薄いからです。

このゲームは一応RPGですが主に"謎解き"に重点を置いていて、戦闘は"コマンド選択式"では無く前進・後退・横移動を交えたリアルタイムで進行。やり方によってはボスも完封出来ますが裏を返せば単調とも言えます。経験値稼ぎは"通常プレイの範疇"では出来ない設計なので、Lvを上げて強くする楽しみ方は基本的に出来ません。

謎解きに関しては

①出題の仕方が下手
②答えへの導き方が不十分
③前提条件がふわっとしている
④どの場所を示しているか分かりづらい

と、不満点だらけになってしまいました。
全てのマップが地続きになっているオープンワールド形式なのですが、頻繁に通過する地点に意味深な場所が多数存在している為に、どの場所のどの事について問題を提示されているのか分からない事が多々あります。不必要に場所を行ったり来たりする事でプレイ時間がかさむのもマイナス要素。

"満腹度"の要素も謎解きと相性が良いとは思えませんでした。
満腹度を簡単に説明すると

：HP･MPを時間経過で自然回復
：時間経過で減少（その場待機でも減少）
：無くなると自然回復しなくなる+攻撃力半減
：いくつかの種族に好物があり与え続けると能力が上昇する

食糧は基本的に敵からのドロップ頼りですが、敵は1度倒すと特定条件を踏まない限りリスポーンしない仕様で、wiki等を見ないと気付かず、食糧難は謎解きの為のトライ&エラーを間接的に制限してしまうので、ゲームとの相性は悪いと思います。好物に関しては、個数が限られている上に"ゲーム内で説明が無い"ので、有って無いような要素になってしまっているのも残念。


最後になりますが、私が一番残念だったのは「特定のスキルにポイントを振らないと解けない謎解きがある」事。このゲームはキャラビルドが自由に出来ますが、上記のせいで1人は自由に出来ないキャラが出てしまいます。ユーザーによっては取得しない事もあり得る中で、それを答えとしてしまうのはダメだと思うのです。この謎解きはクリアにも関わる要素なので尚更ですね。

親切すぎる設計はやらされてる感を感じてしまうのでダメですが、フラグ管理を緩くする、道筋を示してあげる、自由なのは魅力的に見えるけど少しの制限を付ける事で混乱を招かない様にする等、どれだけ頭をひねった謎解きを用意しても、そこで成功体験を得られなかったら人は離れてしまうと思います。

総評としては「前作のファンがやるゲーム」の様な気がします。

英語に関してはwikiに翻訳が載っていますが、全て載っている訳ではなく訳し方で逆に混乱する場面もあるので、ある程度自分自身の英語力が無いと苦労すると思います。
 
tugaru_KC23_TTV
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
88.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 octobre 2014
This guys know how to make a classic ^^ Many thx, I recommend.

Recommandé
9.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 décembre 2014
Esse jogo é simplesmente incrível.

Pra quem gosta de RPG de verdade e não quer que o jogo te pegue pela mãozinha!

Puzzles que te fazem pensar "fora da caixa" com soluções não óbvias. O combate mistura um sistema de cooldowns com movimento em tiles, tudo em tempo real. Gráficos lindos e imersivos, os monstros chegam a assustar de verdade com animações flúidas e texturas bem feitas. Musica e ambientação só ajudam ainda mais a te deixar imerso no jogo.

Incrivelmente bom, supera em muito o primeiro (que já era bom demais)! Recomendo a todos fãs de RPG para PCs!
 
AdrenA
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
58.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 novembre 2018
Огонь!
...земля, вода, воздух и куча головоломок и тварей.

Основное отличие от 1ой части - не коридорная (в этом есть как плюсы, так и "минусы"). Мир очень красиво нарисован и подан. Атмосфера захватывает с самого начала и не отпускает до самого конца. Правда иногда излишняя свобода в перемещении может сыграть злую шутку - если что-то упустил в одной локации (или затупил), то потом можно потратить много времени пытаясь понять - как продвинуться дальше и чего не хватает. Так что советую сразу все надписи, порталы и важные объекты подписывать на карте, особенно если вы будете делать большие паузы в игре в процессе прохождения.
Персонажи достаточно разные, их интересно изучать и прокачивать. Так что повторное прохождение игры имеет место быть. Главное не жестить с комбинацией героев - иначе в к концу будет жесть. Сразу скажу боеприпасов в игре полно, так что стрелка (огнестрелы) можно смело качать.

Короче, для любителей жанра - обязательно к ознакомлению.
 
Crizaliks
263 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
65.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 juin 2015
I love this game. I love it very much. Not everyone will love it, but it's not the sort of game that cares about those folks. It's a reasonably challenging game with some of the most respectable riddles of any RPG I've ever played. The combat is great, definitely more polished over the first game and strikes a nice balance between rewarding strategy, improvisation, and speed. The world is nicely fleshed out with lots of attention to detail. The designs are not extravagent or particularly novel, but they're not meant to be. This is a classic fantasy game in many respects.

But the core of why I love Legend of Grimrock is really how much it respects the intelligence of the player. It expects you to use your brain, and it rewards you for paying attention. It has some flaws with minor mechanics - but nothing that will plague your game experience. As a whole, it's just a satisfying 20 hours.
 
TRUCKFIST

A very nice dungeon crawler that rewards players that ready descriptions and annotate the map. A very rewarding game with lots to it. I liked the puzzles and the secrets. A large game that I very much enjoyed. Much is made of the outside aspect but but its still a grid and makes a nice contrast to the dungeons. Impressive final battles. I would recommend to those willing to spend the time.

Évaluation publiée le 30 novembre 2017
On par with the original. The enemy and combat design are much improved, the boss fights in particular feel well themed and work well with the old-school stilted gameplay style.

The traps and puzzles are strong overall, but the open world drives it more towards complicated exploration puzzles than tense death traps. You don't really get the same sense as the original that the dungeons are trying to murder you and most of the danger is from combat, not traps.

6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
73.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 octobre 2014
If I could play this game until the end I would like it even better, but as it is I've had tremendous fun playing it. It's easily the best game I've played in a long time.

Right from the beginning the game piques your curiosity, you're constantly wondering what might be around the next corner. There's little hand holding, you have to figure things out for yourself which makes the game so much more suspenseful and immersive. There's puzzles and secrets and cryptic messages, trapdoors, hidden buttons, treasures and ominous sounds everywhere.

Creepy creatures and annoying and hilarious ones.

The riddles and puzzles are just challenging enough to make you feel really clever when you solve them. The mazes seem to expand forever. The game is gloriously long!

A warning: if combat is not your strong point, play the game on "easy". Trust me, even then it won't be particularly easy. Especially not the boss fights near the end.

There are safety nets all over: save gems, quicksave, resurrection potions and such. You will not easily get stuck, as long if you persevere.

27.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 avril 2015
In many ways it’s even better than the first. There’s a big Dark Souls inspiration to its intricate world, filled with secrets and understated lore. Many games of this genre, most particularly Dungeon Master 2, didn’t make the smoothest transition to an open world/overland structure. In this game it works extremely well.

The level design is fantastic, and so it the general feel of the game. The only aspect in this game which might be slight inferior to its prequel is the puzzles. They don’t feel as focused, and sometimes they’re a bit aimless and in a couple of occasions I was forced to check an walkthrough, which was something that never happened in the first game.

Recommandé
88.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 aout 2018
Playing this on an iMac Retina, 8GB-3.3 GHz-Core i5, with an AMD Radeon R9 M395 video card & running El Capitan 10.11.6.

If you are interested in picking up Legend of Grimrock 2, then you have probably already played the first game. Grimrock 1 was a very good game that did a lot of things right, but Grimrock 2 improves upon the first game in just about every way possible.

It you had fond memories of playing Dungeon Master & Eye of the Beholder, Grimrock 1 did a great job of recreating those dungeon crawlers of old. The graphics of Grimrock 2 will not match up to today’s photo realistic computer games, but they are perfect for what the game is trying to do. Grimrock 2 opens up the world & takes you above ground, underground, and even underwater! You travel thru misty cemeteries, foggy swamps, (or was that froggy swamps?), and even into the bright and colorful world of castles, woods & beaches.

I never got past level 6 of the first Grimrock, because the one big problem it had for me was that some of the puzzles required quick reflexes more suited to an twin-stick shooter than an RPG dungeon crawler. In Grimrock 1, even when I knew what I needed to do near the end of level 6, like the fighter’s challenge puzzle, I was unable to pull it off. This has not happened so far in Grimrock 2, even after playing for 40 hours. Sure, some of the puzzles are hard to figure out, but once you do, it is possible to complete them.

Everything in Grimrock 2 seems to have more depth than the 1st game. More spells, more weapons, more enemies, more locations. And don’t worry. Even with all the new above ground territory to explore, there are plenty of dungeons. Lots & lots of dungeons.

Not all the new features worked out as well as they could have. Firearms, pistols & rifles have been added to the game, but they work so poorly that you will probably just want to skip them entirely.

And I really didn’t enjoy the underwater portions of the game. You characters just have too few abilities & functions when you are swimming underwater. Still, those parts of the game make up a much smaller portion of your playing time than the parts of the game that work great.

Legend of Grimrock 2 has many levels of content that will give you hours & hours of playing time.

If you haven’t played the 1st game yet, both games are often bundled at a ridiculously low price during Steam sales.
 
kycaver
1,050 produits enregistrés

Évaluation publiée le 11 décembre 2017
Игра хороша как головоломка, хоть и выполнена в стиле старых RPG. Но из-за отсутствия RPG-составляющей, её лучше "принимать" дозировано - в противном случае изучение тёмных подземелий и красочного мира очень быстро наскучит. Всё же отсутствие диалогов, явных заданий и т.п. составляющих ролевых игр несколько демотивирует. Первые часов 5-7 играешь на одном дыхании, а потом потихоньку начинает сказываться однообразие.

P.S. Игра хорошая, но запоем в неё не поиграешь - по крайней мере, у меня это не получилось.

Recommandé
59.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 décembre 2017
An excellent mix of dungeon traversal, monster battling and puzzling.

Unlike the original Grimrock, which was set entirely in one large dungeon, this game is set on an island where there's a single connected overworld and many medium-sized dungeons scattered around the island.
As a result, this game is a bit less linear compared to the original game.
It still steers the player into a relative order by putting stronger enemies in certain areas, but after the second area the player has a higher degree of freedom.

In a way it's easier than the original, but that's not a bad thing because part of the difficulty from the original was due to the difficulty of satisfying hunger and keeping torches lit.
This game has more opportunity to stock up on food by revisting old areas where some of the enemies respawn.
It's also a lot easier to revisit old areas because you're not restricted to travelling up and down between floors - the areas are spread across the 2D overworld.

The original Grimrock set a precedent with its excellent dungeon designer that allowed people to create masterpieces on the workshop.
Grimrock 2 has taken the original designer and turned it up to 11, meaning that even when the main game is over, there's still a glorious trove of adventures to be had.
 
Pharap

1,462 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
27.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 juin 2019
Legend of Grimrock est un dungeon crawler visiblement très inspiré des jeux des années 90: Dungeon Master et Eye of the Beholder. Le but est d'explorer des donjons, éviter les pièges, résoudre des énigmes, trouver des secrets... Le système de déplacement et de combat est assez spécial. On n'a pas à rester bêtement devant l'ennemi et à spammer les attaques (avec cooldown), puisque on se déplace case par case. Donc on peut ainsi esquiver les coups et contourner l'adversaire.

Legend of Grimrock 1 était un jeu sympathique, malgré une dernière partie un peu longue et répétitive.
Cette suite reprend le même concept et est une amélioration sur tous les plans. Cette fois-ci, on n'explore pas un seul donjon mais plusieurs zones variées. Il y a bien sûr plusieurs donjons mais aussi des zones en plein air et c'est plaisant sur le plan visuel et esthétique. La progression n'est pas linéaire et on progresse depuis un hub.

Ce jeu n'est cependant pas sans défauts.
Je le trouve bien trop long et aurait gagné à couper le futile, surtout que les longs combats finissent par devenir lassants.
Beaucoup d'énigmes sont frustrantes, surtout celles où les éléments de solution ne sont donnés que bien plus tard, ce qui oblige à revenir en arrière. On peut certes annoter la carte mais c'est un peu pénible.
Ce jeu est aussi assez difficile et je ne suis pas mécontent d'avoir utilisé un guide pour créer une équipe d'aventuriers qui tient la route parce que c'est vraiment facile de rater son build.

Ce genre de dungeon crawler est vraiment unique et si vous ne vous y êtes jamais essayé, je vous le recommande malgré ses défauts.
 
Arkanthrall
723 produits enregistrés
0
6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
194.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 novembre 2014
In the past few years, I’ve tried several party-based RPGs which were developed by Indie companies and marketed as “old-school”. Unfortunately, these games were held back by clunky/unintuitive interfaces and skill systems, or did not run smoothly despite decent computer specs. Legend of Grimrock 2, on the other hand, is old-school nostalgia done RIGHT. Easily my most-loved game of 2014 (unless something crazy happens in December), Legend of Grimrock 2 is one of the most immersive, challenging and rewarding games I have played.

Gameplay feels very crisp and intuitive. It’s an amazing feeling, to tentatively stick your head out from behind a dark corner, wondering whether that giant Rat-man dressed as a pirate is going to one-shot your squishy party members with his enormous hand cannon. It’s an amazing feeling, to finally put together a bunch of vague clues scribbled on parchment paper, locating a hidden treasure chest containing epic phat loots – and distributing this loot amongst my fully customized party of 4, each with their own distinct fighting styles and weapon/magic inclinations.

There’s a good balance between combat, puzzle solving and exploration in Legend of Grimrock 2, and for me most of the puzzles were difficult, but that’s what made playing this game feel so rewarding. I often found myself saying “I’ll just explore one more area before I quit!” – and that didn’t work out too well. The developers did a fantastic job with level and sound design -- exploring the Laboratory for the first time actually made me very frightened. It’s a game that totally gets you in the zone and allows your imagination to run wild, and I appreciate that.

My thoughts comparing Legend of Grimrock 1 & 2: The first game was a fun, linear dungeon crawler with a rather repetitive environment. Legend of Grimrock 2 is a much larger epic adventure across many different (but always beautiful) environments, both indoors and outdoors. The combat in both games aren’t the strongest selling point – in fact, it feels rather cheesy to constantly “run in circles” around monsters on hard difficulty (as facing them directly would be too dangerous). That said, both games are very high quality in terms of puzzles, atmosphere and exploration, but if you’re on a gaming budget and can only purchase one game at the moment, you may want to play Legend of Grimrock 1 if you prefer a more linear, focused adventure. There was quite a bit of "wandering-around-lost" downtime for me in Legend of Grimrock 2 compared to Legend of Grimrock 1, but it didn’t bother me that much. However, I can understand that if you have limited time to play, you may be looking for an adventuring experience that feels more cohesive – in that case, buy the first game.

I’m pretty close to completing Legend of Grimrock 2 and I’m a little sad. I’ll stress again what I said at the beginning -- Legend of Grimrock 2 is old-school nostalgia done RIGHT.
 
casualmomgamer
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
36.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 octobre 2014
A wonderful sequel to a great game. The difficulty of combat is not balanced well but overall it makes for a perfect puzzle rpg system that still takes you back to the good old days even with its beautiful modern artwork and lighting. The mechanics are largely unchanged but it brings a whole new dungeon palette to the table with a few new mechanics thrown in like ladder climbing. The simplicity of its core design contrasts with the final visual experience in a way that creates a charm all its own.
 
Alturis
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
83.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 octobre 2014
Vous controlez un groupe de 4 prisonniers qui se sont échoués sur une ile mystérieuse. Legend of Grimrock est un dungeon crawler dans le plus pur esprit d'un Dungeon Master, c'est à dire un jeu de rôle où l'on se déplace case par case et où les combats sont en temps en réel.

Pour ceux qui ne connaisse pas le premier épisode :

Ici, il n'y a pas de quêtes, pas de pnj pour vous renseigner. C'est par vous même en trouvant des indices ici et là que vous comprendrez ce qui se passe sur l'ile, qui la contrôle et pourquoi. C'est un pur dungeon crawler truffé de secrets et d'énigmes et je vous conseille de prendre bien votre temps afin de regarder chaque mur afin d'y découvrir un interrupteur ou bien un bouton dissimulé sur la paroi car chaque secret découvert ou énigme résolue est dûment récompensé et vous permettra de vaincre plus facilement vos ennemis futurs. Graphiquement je trouve tout simplement que c'est le plus beau de son espèce et la quantité de succès a dévérouiller est énorme ( 60). Je n'ai que 11h de jeu et pour l'instant je n'ai pas vu le temps passé. Je le conseille à tous !

Pour ceux qui ont joué au premier épisode :

Tout d'abord les + :
- Une race en +
- De nouvelles classes
- Des environnements plus variés
- Un nouveau bestiaire
- Des boss
- Une pelle pour creuser
- Des armes à feu
- L'alchimie légèrement allégé (plus besoin de fiole vide pour faire de potion)
- Une interface légèrement revu avec la possibilité d'une configuration alternative pour les 2 mains. Ils ont également rajouté une petite case dans le livre de sort qui permet d'identifier le sort qu'on lance une fois les runes choisi et ils ont fait la même chose dans l'interface du creuset.
- Certaines armes peuvent lancer des coups spéciaux en fonction de votre niveau de compétence

Les moins - :

- Le système de magie est pas vraiment optimisé on perd pas mal de temps a choisir les runes comme dans le premier
- Texture de certains donjons identiques à ceux du premier.
- Lorsque l'on sort d'une zone on ne sait pas si on a oublié des secrets dérrière nous ( contrairement au premier)
- On ne peut pas importer ses personnages du premier

En conclusion je dirai qu'il n'y pas de grosse évolutions par rapport au premier, si ce n'est que les environnements sont beaucoup plus variés, un peu plus de classes, de nouvelles armes et une race supplémentaire ( les hommes rats), sinon tant l'interface que les principes fondamentaux sont identiques. En gros si vous aviez aimé le premier courrer les yeux fermés et si vous aviez détesté le premier passer votre chemin.
 
caloucool

The lighting, environments, music, and mood were all brilliant.

Non recommandé
48.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 31 octobre 2019
『GRIMROCK ①＞＞＞GRIMROCK ②』という感じでした。

　先程、クリアーしたのですけども、「疲れた・・・」というのが正直な感想。
　オープンワールド化したという意味では、非常に意欲作なんですが、広さが仇になっていて一一何をしたらいいのかで、迷う。そもそも目的が見えないんです。
　会話可能なＮＰＣがいて、物語性があったらなら、かなり違ったとは思うんですけど、感覚としては作業感が強かったです。

　GRIMROCK ①は本編も好かったのですけども、ＭＯＤの『MASTER　QUEST』の出来がすさまじかったので、かなり楽しめました。GRIMROCK ②は、ＭＯＤを探してまでやろうとは思えないくらいに、私にとっては、積極的に楽しむことはできなかったです。
 
curoe_male
0
14 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
37.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 octobre 2014
This game is a tile-based puzzle-RPG with lots of puzzles and quite some fighting. Graphics are very nice actually for todays standards, sound is ok. If you played the first LoG and liked it, you will love this one, it's improved in every way. If not, it may be worth your time if you like this kind of gameplay. You will be exploring multiple areas over and under the surface, while fending off monsters and trying to solve puzzles for treasures and story items. The puzzles are quite challenging at times, especially for optional rewards. I must admit, I had to consult the community a few times, but it is entirely possible to solve everything by yourself if you put your mind and some time to it. Some puzzle hints are quite cryptic, but with some thought and trial/error everything can be solved. The fighting is fun, you have multiple classes to choose from and nicely designed equipment that makes you want to have them all! There is a new race as well, so you could create an obese Rat farmer who gains experience by eating food and extra boni from cheese slices (lol), or an insectoid alchemist who fires giant cannonballs and grows mushrooms in her pockets (disgusting). Besides melee and ranged fighting, you have magic based on a rune system. But if you dont like that extra micromanagment, just make a party of 4 Berserkers and smash everything to a pulp. You can even change the character portraits with your own custom pictures, so visually you can have your dream party of Pokémon or whatever you fancy.
I got almost 40 h of gameplay out of this 20€ purchase, so it was well worth the money. I am actually more content with LoG2 than I was with Shadow of Mordor. It is a lot of fun and I recommend it to every RPG/Puzzle fan. For me personally, this is game of the year so far.
 
Nudelsuppe
0
6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
168.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 octobre 2014
The legend of Grimrock had given a second life to the first person tile-based dungeon crawlers. The legend of Grimrock II has done it again for me. The game already feels "bigger" as you explore, not just a dungeon like in the previous one, but the island of Nex, which is filled with a multitude of dungeons.

If you liked the first game, you will definetely love this one! I clearly recommand this game, which puts even more place to the "exploration" part with outside areas, and more dungeons, as well as a lot of secrets to find.

In term of content, the game already puts the bar higher than its predecessor, giving old items from grimrock, but also a lot of brand new items, which would probably remind of old school games from the 80's-90's, like notably a wodden staff, or also a sling. There are brand new monsters, as well as some from the previous game (According to the website, 44 monsters with 12 from the previous game), and the game feels fresh due to this.
Also, the biggest change in the game is its beauty, as you travel outside, you get to see some marvelous areas, which is better than the 3 area types we see in mount grimrock.

In term of gameplay and difficulty, the game proposes 7 classes and 5 races (1 being new), which is more than its predecessor. The skill system is different though, proposing less perk levels (5 for each) but only 1 skill point per level. Also there is now a "local damage" system, which can prevent you from using a weapon slot, or make you slower, prevent your health or energy to come back up, ect, ect... And most notably for the adventurers who want the hardest challenges, they can set life crystals to be usable only once, and/ or to be the only way to save the game.

In any case, I would say this game simply blows, and, being much more complete than its predecessor, should have an even longer life thanks to the dungeon editor, and the creativity of the community.
 
Anima ^◕ ⋏ ◕^

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
44.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 octobre 2014
Far and away better than the already really quite good original, what you have in Grimrock 2 is an excellent dungeon crawler style rpg - the focus being on combat and puzzle solving in a grid-based, first person fashion.

The combat is improved over the original, but it's still slightly wonky. While the AI is better, you'll still spend most of your fighting time exploiting its behaviour since a straight up fight will almost always end badly.

Where Grimrock 2 really shines, however, is in the exploration and puzzle solving. Gone is the multi-level, single dungeon, where you now have something almost reminiscent of legend of zelda; a roughly open world, where your progression is primarily driven by your ability to explore and solve puzzles.

And those puzzles, you say? Some of the best I've seen in games. While many are challenging, none have inexplicable leaps in logic, and every future puzzle is building on what you've learned previously. Clues are not as obscenely cryptic as in la mulana, but give just enough information for your mind to leap at the solution. There hasn't been a point in the game so far where I've been stuck with no-where to go, and yet many of the puzzles have me feeling like a genius on their solution. The balance of difficulty of the puzzles is meticulous.

Buy this game. It's real good.
 
Stargoat
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
21.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 février 2015
Follow Cob Curates for more reviews!

A great continuation of the first game.

Many people will be turned off by the real-time combat and the "grid dancing" that goes along with it, but Legend of Grimrock 2 (and it's predecessor) are great dungeon crawl games that deserve praise.

My main qualm with this game comes stems from the actual nature of the game itself, but it could just be my ineptitude and lack of experience with puzzle games. Many of the puzzles were very obtuse, and I had to resort to a walkthrough several times to find solutions. Lots of "well these abstract insturctions you may or may not have found on a note 3 zones over explain how to do it!" scenarios. There were a few times where I couldn't figure out where to go, and the combination of these issues almost made me lose heart and stop playing the game.

All that aside, the game is still great. The level design is good and the classes/skills are interesting. I (mostly) enjoyed my time with it, and it's a great game for someone who likes hunting secrets for finding hidden surprises.

Overall, I would definitely recommend this game... BUT, do not feel bad if you have to look something up, or can't figure out where to go next. Have fun!
 
jacob
2,361 produits enregistrés

2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
37.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 juillet 2020
If you have played, and enjoyed, the first Legend of Grimrock, then this game essentially improves on every aspect of the first, from combat and classes to puzzles and maps, and I would highly recommend it.

For everyone else, Legend of Grimrock is a thoroughly well thought out puzzler adventure game that is heavily stylized after old-school RPGs, complete with grid-based movement, using buttons to physically turn, and requiring you to take notes of what is happening on the mysterious island your party of 4 is stuck in.

The game is not for everyone, but I thoroughly enjoyed it and would recommend it to those who enjoy a note-taking, old-school experience.

8/10
 
Jertlemiah

Recommandé
47.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 décembre 2014
GrimRock2 is great fun with appropriately punishing difficulty level. Anyone remembering fondly of dungeon master/eye of the beholder or some such old school dungeon crawler should give this game a try. Game mechanics are easy to learn yet difficult to master.

There are some strategy elements to the real time battles which keep encounters fresh. The puzzles in this game are mostly logical and fun to solve. There are some puzzles that don't make sense(to me) and it's either try all possible options or do some googling.

Only real negative is the games plot which is quite much rubbish. Not that plot matters that much as exploring the game world is fun enough in itself.

There are unique ways to develop the characters in this game. It's possible to have fairly different gaming experience by trying out different party compositions. This is good as even if you intend to play this game only once to the conclusion you can play it your way.

Oh, and the sugar at the bottom is the game includes dungeon creator. You can make your own worlds or try out some experiences made by the fans of this game. The fun will never end.

41.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 décembre 2014
Grimrock 1 but bettererer. Instead of going down the same drab stanky hole theres an (more or less) lush overworld connecting multiple (differently themed) dungeons (stanky holes still to be had), so theres actual freeroaming exploration.

Core gameplay remains the same, Might and Magic style grid based movement blob party. Pick up loots and solve puzzles. Combat still isnt that engaging unfortunately, guys at the front trade blows (if youre not dodging around), back row casts spells with an Arx Fatalis "draw your spell" magic system or shoots bows and guns - in some variation.

Myst with Combat, the refined formula. Solid good fun, recommended.

More variety of puzzle
Graphic quality is as good as before
Multiple option to make game harder (no quick save, single use saving spot)

♥♥♥ :

411 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
55.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 octobre 2014
Like its predecessor, Legend of Grimrock 2 is a tribute to the grid-based dungeon crawlers of yore. Unlike LoG1, however, which was very straight-forward (or straight down, I should say), LoG2 goes for a more open exploration approach. This both works and doesn't work.

It works in giving you the impression that there's always something you've yet to discover elsewhere - hidden treasure, the way to access the next dungeon, the solution to that one puzzle you just can't figure out. It is frustrating, however, when you're not sure whether you already have the means to complete a puzzle in the area you're in or whether the clues you possess apply to a puzzle in an entirely different area. You also can't tell which puzzles are necessary to progress in the game.

The puzzles are mostly very well designed and more varied than in LoG1, partly thanks to the expansion of puzzle mechanics - for instance, a "level" can now have multiple levels (floors) within it. Towards the end, there are a few puzzles that seem a bit obscure.

The gameplay has been polished from Grimrock 1. The enemy design is now better suited to the apparent effectiveness of the side-stepping strategy that could be used to dominate almost any enemy in LoG1 - movement during combat is no longer breaking the game, instead, it is necessary to survive. The skill and spell systems have been reworked. There's much more variety in environments and when exploring the outdoors, the graphics are honestly quite pleasant to the eye.

The lack of hand-holding has its pros and ♥♥♥♥. The feeling of accomplishment after completing a difficult puzzle is uncomparable, but when the difficulty of the puzzles is combined with the open exploration aspect, there is a high possiblity of frustration in not knowing where to go. Still, Grimrock 2 is a great improvement over its predecessor and a worthy contender for being the best dungeon crawler of all time.
 
smashington
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0

Очень советую, и настаиваю эту игру, как доктор доктору.

Recommandé
67.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 décembre 2016
This is the only modern game I know of that managed to capture the essence of classic old school RPG's like Black Crypt or Dungeon Master that I loved playing so much as a kid! And it improved upon it significantly!

The gameplay, immersion and atmosphere are all great, even though movement is square-based and limited to 90-degree angles (which can be off-putting to kids used to today's cinematic animation and take-you-by-the-hand gameplay, hence the few negative reviews).

The game on normal actually is rather difficult, but nothing you can't overcome if you develop your party reasonably and explore the world carefully making full use of the automap. You just need to skim through some guides first to make informed decisions on how to create a party and allocate skill points.
 
Atman7

Recommandé
80.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 juillet 2017
Legend of Grimrock 1 was a very good game.
Legend of Grimrock 2 is even BETTER! Truly... the best classical step-dungeon tactical RPG in a decade!

So... what is new?
Classical things:
- weapons; even huge cannons, rifles, pistols, sleeping darts, etc.
- enemies; like giant frogs, medusas, swarm elementals, mimics : )
- spells and wands (for invisibility)
- bosses (giant rat with a cannon, undead lords, giant meateating vines, tricksters and even dragon!)
- more variable riddles (some of them reaaaaaly challenging)

Best new thing?
OPEN WORLD.
Yes... this "step-dungeon" game is really HUGE! And even in opened area (so You'll see the sun too) XD

And can there be even something better?
Yes... tons of customs dungeon from a STEAM workshop, shere You can import your previous characters!

SIMPLY... this game is really awesome!
...
One tip: make one of your character a fully experienced alchemist (VERY useful skill!)

2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
39.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 aout 2020
Improves on the original.
The puzzles and exploration were the most fun parts and I liked the varied monsters and environments. Annotating the map is very useful (Something I only realised could be done a few hours in) and it is important to be organised such as remembering where a note was from and planning in advance what skills you will need to focus on. Most puzzles are solvable with a bit of thought and patience but I found it necessary to cheat a few times when I got stuck.
Combat is fairly good but does involve lots of dancing around the monsters to get hits in before they can get into position to attack.
Some people will find a game like this frustrating and won't finish it (around 10-20% of players have the achievement for finishing the game) so I think it's fair to say it's quite niche. I however, spent nearly 40 hours on this game for my play-through and can't wait for Grimrock 3 which I hope is being worked on.
Recommended price £5-10.
 
mjb supreme

117.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 avril 2015
Одна из самых удачных, на мой взгляд, игр 2014. Наконец, спустя порядочное время после прохождения, я могу сказать о ней пару слов.

Единственный недостаток, который я могу назвать — нехватка "экшена". Все-таки это пошаговая игра. Однако лично меня это лишь привлекает; LoG2 заставляет думать, причем не только над секретами и загадками, но и над каждым тактическим решением в схватке. Здесь скорость реакции не поможет.

Секретов же здесь великое множество, а механика игры подкупает своей видимой простотой и необъятной глубиной. Помимо прочего здесь очень красиво — мир игры проработан со вкусом и с любовью.

В целом я готов рекомендовать эту игру вообще всем, кто не обделен терпением и готов немного напрячь мозги. Лично я не пожалел ни одной копейки, заплаченной за нее.

Évaluation publiée le 29 février 2016
Better in every way than the first game and especially in combat, this is a must get for any Dungeon Crawler fan. The only things that lets this game down is when it makes assumptions about party composition (you do need someone good at ranged/magic for one particular puzzle, so all fighter or rogue parties that use melee weapons are not a great idea even though the character creation would let you build them) and the final boss fight, which is not as bad as what the first game provided in this area. This is definitely one of the best dungeon crawlers and I would highly recommend it.
 
Kingius
0
9 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
7.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 mars 2015
I have played the game for about 6 hours and I am not convinced that it is as good as many people claim it is.

I find the control scheme very annoying (needing SIX keys to walk around, and needing to right-click on weapons to use them, let alone using magic which requires numerous clicks -- and all of that in real-time). The enemies are kind-of underwhelming, just standing in front of you and hitting you -- unless you ran into enemies that are far too high-level for you, which can easily happen. There are some pretty annoying puzzles (invisible switches, items that are hidden without the game giving any indication of where you have to look, be-fast-and-move-to-the-correct-spot-or-you-die challenges, and puzzles whjch basically require you to die multiple times before you can actually get a glimpse of what you need to do to solve them). The character upgrades are too rare, and it is too easy to make a mistake in constructing your characters (I made an alchemist who uses firearms, but now I find that firearms and ammo for them are very hard to come by, while I have found fantastic bows with reusable arrows that I cannot use). Fortunately, enemies that are defeated do not return, so that's a plus. But overall, I find the fun factor not so high that I am keen to continue.

What REALLY hurts the game is the complete lack of any story. Why are you doing the things that you do? Why do you walk around here? Why not just stay on the beach, build a big fire, and kill turtles for dinner until you are rescued? I don't feel that "exploring for the sake of exploring" is very rewarding. Ultimately, the whole story seems to come down to something like: walk around until you have collected 20 power gems, and then you can unlock the final door. Hooray!

I played the first Grimrock for a while, and that game feels much better. There is an actual incentive for you to delve into the dungeon, and the atmosphere is suffocatingly claustrophobic. While in Grimrock II you are just walking through woods without rhyme or reason. The atmosphere of this game is just off.

All in all, I am on the fence as far as Grimrock II is concerned. It is not that it is a bad game, it is just not as good as the first one, and I rather play something else than more Grimrock II. So I have to rate it down, partly in compensation for all the up-ratings.
 
Flyboy Connor
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

I loved this one as much as the first. Again, I could probably only get 75 - 80% of the game on my own, needed help to complete a bunch of the puzzles, but I really enjoyed the challenge. I really enjoyed the "true" ending as well. So much fun once again, creating my own party, exploring, customizing gear, and leveling up my team. Replay value is very High IMO, as its difficult to find everything / do everything in a single play through. Also.. I plan on a second play through, just to get the full monty achievement, as I didnt look at the achievements until my first play through.

Recommandé
28.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 31 décembre 2015
Grimrock 2 is a beautifully designed game. The basic mechanics of the game are very simple to grasp yet the way they are used to form the gameplay (exploration, puzzles, and combat) is very well thought out. Both the puzzles and combat are consistently challenging the whole way through the game without feeling frustrating or unfair. If you have any interest at all in logic puzzles and RPGs I would highly recommend picking this up.
