Recommandé
23.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 février 2015
Vidéo YouTube™:  
Vues : 0


Legend of Grimrock 2: Legend of Grimrock II is the sequel to Almost Human Games’ previous Legend of Grimrock and, like any good sequel it does everything better than the first one. Both games are very similar with a few differences. If you want more detailed information about the game I would humbly suggest looking at my Legend of Grimrock review. The game sets you on the Isle of Nex as four shipwrecked prisoners (no doubt on their way to Mount Grimrock) and once again you must survive the harsh environment and escape alive. It is hinted at and you soon discover that you are here on someone else’s wishes and whatever plan they have in store for you surely isn’t in your best interest.

The story in Legend of Grimrock II is a lot more straightforward and you will quickly discover what your main objective is and where you need to go in order to complete the game, it’s a welcome addition to the series and all throughout the game it expands on the lore and universe that this world exists in.
The game still has its core elements and players coming from the first game will feel right at home. You now have 5 races and 8 classes to pick from which adds a great dynamic to the games combat. The puzzles in this game almost felt a lot more challenging and stimulating and didn’t feel beyond my ability to solve but, rather a good test of my abilities.

Overall I felt like Legend of Grimrock II kicked it all up a notch with the game being more challenging than the first. Combat is still as engaging as the first, relying on maneuvering in real time and giving you a wealth of weapons, bombs, and spells to choose from. The aesthetics and atmosphere also feel the same but, improved upon, you go to a greater variety of locations and the music and graphics are simple and beautiful, should have no real problem running this game on lower end PCs.

For $23.99 USD and over 20 hours of gameplay, Legend of Grimrock II will give you bang for your bucks and you should feel like you got more than enough value out of this amazing game. It’s challenging and has great roleplaying, survival and puzzle solving mechanics and I enjoyed my time just as much as I did in the first game. Thank you Almost Human Games!


TL/DR; Legend of Grimrock II is the ideal sequel to its previous installment, more challenging gameplay, more content, better graphics and atmosphere, expanding the lore and world, if you like RPGs or the previous Legend of Grimrock or want a challenging adventure then this game is for you! Its $23.99USD full price and you’ll get 25-30 hours of gameplay with great replay ability from the integrated steam workshop. If you don’t have either game but like what you see definitely get the $29.99 USD bundle for both games, that’s a solid deal.

-Double Thumbs up from Royial

Video Reviews At: youtube.com/RoyialNetwork
 
Royial

Évaluation publiée le 13 septembre 2020
This is just a game where you move around and attack things, and as you get better at it, you start doing both those things at the same time.
Notes for beginners: You CAN make a nearly useless character on accident, but with thought you can also make them useful again later. All classes/races are viable depending on play style, but some are more beginner friendly. Think BEFORE you act. If it looks like a trap, it's a trap. If it does not look like a trap, you haven't looked hard enough. And lastly, THE ROPE LETS YOU CLIMB DOWN HOLES SO YOU DON'T NEED TO FALL.
 
armadillosheild
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
33.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 octobre 2014
Beautiful environments, great atmosphere, intricate puzzles and solid RPG battle mechanics and character-customization. I loved the first game, and this game is everything you could wish for in a sequel: More of the same, brilliant ideas, but different enough to feel fresh and new. For me, the best things about the game is that it respects the player and paces itself perfectly. It's never repetitive and each challenge you tackle feels new and different.

Even when you're done with the game, you can go through it again with a new party and look for secrets you might have missed. One thing I've noticed in my now second playthrough is that I'm probably progressing 3x-4x faster than before, meaning knowledge is more powerful than any kind of weapon or equipment you find in the game, which I think is a testament to great design.

If you haven't played this kind of game before, I would actually recommend the first game over this one, simply because it's more linear and easier to get into. When you're done with that, you WILL be wanting more, and then you come back for this one :)

I ran into some game-crashing bugs the first week, but they have since been fixed. There are still some performance issues in certain areas, but nothing major. Highly recommended.
 
Yu

Recommandé
42.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 mars 2016
Одна из лучших игр в стиме, лучший представитель жанра "партийная RPG от первого лица" за последние 15 лет, в этой игре все идеально. Кроме баланса, класс, использующий огнестрельное оружие, становится бесполезен ближе к середине игры. Но этого не замечаешь, так как мир прекрасен, головоломки интересны, боевая система бодра, а от количества секретов, записок, и загадок просто разбигаются глаза.

100% прохождение данной игры заняло у меня 30 часов, ни минуты из которых небыли скучными. Эта игра делает все то же, что и первая часть, но в несколько раз больше, лучше, и разнообразнее. И концовка в этот раз имеет смысл D:.

33.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 juin 2017
Belo e atmosférico jogo no estilo dungeon crawler. Muito imersivo, também. Melhor que o primeiro e com mundo mais aberto. Repleto de segredos e gostoso de jogar na raça, mas uma hora dá vontade de fuçar na net as prováveis coisas que você tá perdendo e puzzles que vocês não tá conseguindo resolver, graças a enigmas do tipo "o entorno da pedra sob a sombra da torre nebulosa próxima ao lago esconde um grande segredo" que te fazem cavar 300 buracos em torno de um lago e não achar nada.

O desafio é bem razoável... se você vacilar, vira patê até pra bichos normais. E tem chefe que te empaçoca mais rápido ainda. Um inconveniente chato do jogo é o limite de peso/espaço que te fazem ficar administrando o inventário mais do que o desejável.

Outra pressão do jogo é a comida. Se você vacilar, dá até pra morrer de fome. Os respawns de bichos que dão carne são bem limitados.

Em suma, excelente jogo. Nota 14.5 de 17

Recommandé
222.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 juillet 2015
If you liked the first one, you'll probably like the second one. It's got all the good stuff (beautiful environments, great atmosphere, sound effects and music) Lots of items, very hard choices about upgrading your characters stats and equipment. Everything is a trade-off and that's good.

It is much bigger and at times I felt lost. It is not a straight drill to the bottom of a dungeon campaign. There are multiple outdoor environments and you are almost free to roam anywhere. I did have to turn to a forum for guidance a few times.

I hope to see this become a trilogy! If they keep building on this engine and add NPCs, shops and quests, we might get someone to finally remake Ultima Underworld as a mod.

Good job guys!

Évaluation publiée le 26 septembre 2016
Legend of Grimrock 2 est un bon jeu dungeon crawler et RPG qui fait son charme en ayant créer plusieurs différents environnement (comparé au LoG1). Les dévelopeurs se sont aussi appliqués sur la texture de la décoration du jeu.
Comparé à d'autres jeux de donjon, je l'aime particulièrement bien car ce n'est pas du tour par tour lors des combats et des énigmes dans l'aventure. Mais comme tout les LoG, l'histoire reste assez mystérieux et s'est ce qui rend ces aventures merveilleux en découvrant l'histoire en progressant dans l'aventure et les découvertes des lieux...
Si vous souhaitez une bonne aventure RPG, puzzles (dur parfois ;-) ), dungeon crawler... et bien vous êtes au bonne endroit :-D

POULtheMAN
0
6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
100.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 novembre 2014
The Legend of Grimrock 2 is the sequel to an award-winning hit series, and it just keeps getting better and better. This series is the new king of dungeon crawlers with hours and hours of content to traverse through.

Similar to its predecessor, the story of LoG 2 is a bit on the lacking side, but is every bit made up for by the gameplay, character design, and intensive replay value. By controlling a party of up to four, choosing from multiple races and classes, you can pick and choose the level of balance (or imbalance) you can have with your team members. Between having a Human Battlemage, or a Ratling Alchemist, a Minotar Barbarian, or possibly an Insectoid Farmer (yes, farmer) if you like the trolling side, you can set up your party how you wish.

A single playthrough of this game will easily take beyond 25 hours of gameplay, and that is if you are cruising through not looking for secrets and treasures. There are puzzles galore, and many are extremely DIFFICULT puzzles that will challenge the most intellectual minds. Most of these puzzles you will have never seen in any other video game, and some especially new in style to the LoG series.

Beyond the extensive puzzle-solving, quick reflexes and a little bit of finger dexterity is needed in this game to survive, especially if you enjoy playing on all of the hardest difficulty settings the game offers you at the start like I have. LoG 2 offers three difficulty levels (Easy, Normal, Hard), Ironman mode, which allows saving only at health crystals, and Single-use Health Crystals mode, where you are only able to use the crystals once. On top of all that, they brought back Old-School Mode back, which takes away your trusty map, leaving you in the dust with nothing but your compass (if you find one) and pencils and graph paper.

The layout of the game is fantastic, as it starts you on the shore of a beach, and the environment takes you into swamps, dens, lairs, catacombs, pyramids, jungles, etc...there is a wide array of refreshing map tiles that will keep you entertained, if not perhaps somewhat confused and lost. Keep your eyes open, though, and look for levers, hidden buttons and switches, and traps everywhere.

This game can be very taxing on the mind and body, but does wonders for the soul. If you like dungeon crawlers, this is the BEST in the genre, and is worth the money.

I rate this game a 9.6 out of 10.
 
MattyVanHalen
0

0

Well worth the full price, and a steal on sale. If you haven't played the first one yet, get the bundle and do that too!

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
60.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 septembre 2018
高難易度ダンジョンクローラーの続編

ダンマス、と言えば通じる人は話が早いので放っておくとして、ちょっとレトロな感じの硬派なダンジョンクローラー。
ダンジョンマスターの精神的後継者。

今回は屋外にも出るのでこれまた分かる人に言えばコズミック・フォージあたりのイメージが近いか。

ちなみにコマンド入力方式のRPGではなく、リアルタイムに移動しながらクールダウン制の攻撃や魔法をぶち当てていく方式となっている。
クイックアイテムスロットみたいな便利な機能はないので、なにげに操作は忙しい。

戦闘、パズル、リソースマネジメントの難易度は相変わらずなので、ちょっとの油断でコロリと死ぬし、消費アイテム管理やキャラ成長を間違えると終盤での詰みもありそう。

「うすうす気づいてはいたが、このビルドは最後までダメだったなぁ」というときのダメージは計り知れないので、くれぐれも注意しよう。

広大なダンジョンの探索は、事実上のノーヒント。
クリアに絶対必要なクエストアイテムがそこいらに普通に落ちていたり、一方通行のポータルでモンスターハウスに放り込まれたり、消費アイテム数が有限だったり、最低限の武装を持つだけで可搬重量ギリギリだったり、とにかく油断がならない。

また、閉鎖空間のダンジョンをウロウロしていたオリジナルからの名残りで、空腹度のパラメーターがあるのが特徴か。
時間経過により空腹度が増し、いずれは餓死してしまうので、モンスターのお肉やらの素材を適宜集めて、食事していかなければならない。

旧作では食料の絶対数が限られており、事実上のタイムリミットとして機能していたわけだが、本作では一部モンスターがリスポーンするようなので、食糧事情はだいぶよろしいようで。
 
OKN
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 décembre 2015
Legend of Grimrock 2 est une référence dans les jeux de type dungeon crawler


Le premier Legend of Grimrock est devenu une référence dans les jeux de type Dungeon Crawler, le 2 l’est tout autant, enfin, selon moi !

Dans Legend of Grimrock 2, vous jouez quatre prisonniers. Vous êtes transporté dans une cage et celle-ci est dans la soute d’un bateau. Heureusement pour vous, il y a une tempête, le bateau se mange des rochers, l’équipage meurt (oui, tous, sans exception) et vous êtes les seuls survivants sur une île mystérieuse.

Combattez, trouvez des passages, enfoncez vous dans les profondeurs des caves et combattez encore. Jusqu’où devez-vous aller pour avoir le droit de vivre en toute tranquillité.

Le jeu est une réussite et il serait bête de s’en priver !

GP - Legend of Grimrock 2 
Une vidéo de Legend of Grimrock 2
Par : Abbadon93
Voici quasiment le premier niveau de Legend of Grimrock 2. Il manque juste la bataille finale. La vidéo dure près de 45 mn. Legend of Grimrock 2 raconte l’histoire de quatre prisonnier qui transportés par bateau sont...


Pour découvrir l’ensemble des mes impressions sur Legend of Grimrock 2.[www.graal.fr]
 
Abbadon93
6,670 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
133.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 octobre 2014
Legend of Grimrock 2 is a sequel to the well received Legend of Grimrock. It is a game for people who like to use logic and have it somewhat easy solving riddles and puzzles, a degree of patience is really a necessity. Some of the riddles are really devilish and will test your mettle to its limit but the satisfaction of solving it - priceless!
The Almost Human crew took a lesson from all the critique as well as pleas made regarding their 1st title and made a really grand improvement. The game world feels much more open and the day-night cycle is just an icing on the cake, the variety of oponents is much greater as are their tactics (AI) and speed. Items as well have been improved both in terms of variety and usefulness. Not only that, the world is huge and varied, nearly each "section" has its own personal flavor and feel, you don't ever feel that every dungeon is the same. Your very first playthrough, assuming one figures the puzzles oneself, will provide well over the stated 20hrs of play time. Uncovering all the secrets this game has to offer will extend the expierince even farther, trust me I did them all.
Due to the non-linearality, various modes, difficulties and some really interesting, possible party compositions it does offer viable reasons for a second or even 3rd playthrough.
Graphically this game looks really, really gorgeus and beautiful. Some of the landscapes will put you in awe. Sadly I noticed 2 annoyences:
  1. due to screen tearing I played with v-sync on and sometimes, for no real reason the fps dropped from 60 to 30 rarely to 20. Alt+tabing was temporarily fixing the issue.
  2. on some occassions the virtually no anti-aliasing really hurts. For people not playing in 1080p this might be even more hurtful issue.
I do hope those might get worked on in future!
Overall, a very worthy heir to LoG1 who took everything from its predecessor and made it even better, bigger, taller, deeper, grander! Personally, this is the Game of the year for me, if I were to buy it again I most certainly would!
 
tyrael
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0

A very enjoyable rpg if you can appreciate the first-person party perspective, turn-based combat and challenging puzzles.

ikstrigoi
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
167.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 mars 2018
Legend of Grimrock 2 is a great follower for the original Legend of Grimrock.

I love how much more variety this game has than the original one. The levels offer a lot of variety including castles, mines, forests and dungeons. The variety is not limited to the scenery. You'll also see a lot of new enemies, weapons, armor, character builds and puzzles. You can also choose the order you wish to complete some of the levels. It is another great example of the variety this game offers.
As someone who likes to create custom levels with the editor, the variety in this game is just amazing.

The only problem with the game was that some of the puzzles didn't make any sense or were borderline stupid. But most of the puzzles are solvable by using common sense and looking at your surroundings.
The fighting mechanism is also a lot more fast paced and requires getting used to. At some points I wished the game to be a little bit slower paced but overall the game was a lot of fun and it has a lot of things to do.

I absolutely recommend this to anyone who bought the first game and/or enjoys dungeon crawlers.
 
Yinitzu
317 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
44.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 octobre 2014
Legend of Grimrock II offers a compelling experience between exploration, a minimalist but endearing story and pretty decent graphics. This sequel manages to cross its own style with a Myst-like experience, where you end up on an island and have to figure everything out. The freedom of movement within the island is quite enjoyable : will you keep trying this dungeon with tough enemies but greater rewards or will you come back to it once you've leveled up a bit ?
The leveling, fighting and magic systems are okay but show their limits around the two thirds of the game. Once you've discovered most of the good stuff and figured out most spells, the game becomes really repetitive. The fact that the fights tend to pile up in the end made me wish the game was shorter, just so I'd be done with it. Apart from this end game tediousness, the clever riddles and the rich exploration are enough to justify playing it.
 
Soupir

Évaluation publiée le 30 juin 2015
I really do not enjoy this game, even if I'm tryng to...while LoG is simple and pretty straight-forward, LoG2 on the other hand feels quite chaotic, dispersive and due to the nature of the game (that keep you searching and looking for small details in every corner or wall) gets really dull and boring after you reach the middle of the game, given the amount of mini-puzzles you want to clear, chest you want to open and area you want to visit. Plus, the default party tends to suck hard even in normal mode and it's REALLY annoying to start a new game.
 
Mr.White
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
9.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 avril 2015
Built in keeping with traditional eye of the beholder type games, this game brings modern technology in to play with improved graphics, and real time monster movement. The four-direction, square-by-square based movement scheme makes for interesting battle tactics as you effectively walk backwards in a square, trying to turn and strike quicker than the monsters in many cases.
Unfortunately, the maps for this game are not randomly generated, nor are the monsters. If you begin playing this game through, and decide to try another party, the second party will go through the exact same gameplay as your previous party. This makes for zero replayability in a game which is only OK as an RPG to begin with.
 
the viking

7.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 octobre 2014
ダンマス、wiz世代、前作を楽しめた人には文句なしにお勧め。
前作はインドアロケーションのみだったが、今作はアウトドアロケーションが収録され、その種類も豊富と視覚的にも楽しめる。
謎解きの楽しさ、即死級トラップのスリル、嫌らしい敵の配置。全てが懐かしく、楽しい。

今作には最初からダンジョンエディタが同梱されており、自分でダンジョンを作成し、Workshopで公開することが出来る。
他の人が作ったダンジョンを遊ぶことも出来るので、3Dダンジョン系のサンドボックスとしても前作同様優秀。
この手のジャンルが好きなら長く遊べること間違いなしの一本。

Évaluation publiée le 5 juillet 2015
Пoслe oзнaкoмлeния с пeрвoй чaстью и приoбрeтённым oпытoм гeймплeя в LoG. Втoрaя чaсть пoшлa впoлнe сeбe глaдкo и пoчти бeз трyдa yдaвaлoсь пoлyчить всё тo, чтo хoтeлoсь пoлyчить. Прoйти тyдa, кyдa и нaдo прoйти, кyдa и хoчeтся прoйти, кyдa пo идee и "нeльзя" прoйти. Хoть и прoпyстил пaрy сeкрeтoв, всё жe мнoгo дрyгих, бoлee 50ти нaхoдил слyчaйнo кyдa-тo yпaв или из любoпытствa oбнюхивaя oчeрeднyю сoтyю стeнкy.

Этa чaсть oстaвилa смeшaнныe чyвствa. С oднoй стoрoны хoтeлoсь прoклинaть рaзрaбoтчикa зa нaвoрoчeннoсть вo всяких гoлoвoлoмкaх, зaгaдкaх (нaпримeр рaзгaдaть кoд в aрхивaх клaдбищa, a eщё рaньшe oткрыть вoрoтa. Щёлкнyть нeскoлькo и бoлee рaз кaкими-тo рычaгaми в Зaмкe Нeксyсa, чтoбы прoйти нa этaж вышe... и нeкoтoрыe пoдoбныe зaгaдки. К счaстью бoльшyю чaсть всeх зaгaдoк мнe yдaлoсь спoкoйнo и бeз трyдa oсилить пoчти нe нaпрягaясь. Вoт. Нy, a с дрyгoй всё жe нe смoтря нa слoжнoсти и зaмoрoчeннoсть, включaя впихивaниe в игрy бoссoв - игрa дaжe стaлa чyткa лyчшe. Дaжe слoжнee. Мoбы нeмнoгo пoyмнeли и бывaлo нe рaз бeспoщaднo зaжимaли в yглaх, гдe я oгрeбaл и зaгрyжaлся, чтoбы испрaвить свoю oшибкy. Oщyщeниe зaжaтoсти в пoдзeмeльях чyть спaлo, хoтя всё рaвнo лaзaть в них тaк или инaчe, нo прихoдилoсь бoльшyю чaсть игры. Пoявилoсь мнoгo aртeфaктoв, oрyжия. Нy и сaмo сoбoю 4рe сeтa - для рoги, рыцaря, бoйцa и мaгa никyдa нe дeлись. yдaлoсь сoбрaть всe. Хoтя кaюсь кaк минимyм нeскoлькo чaстeй сeтoв пoдсмoтрeл гдe нaхoдятся.

В oбщeм. Этo пo идee тoт жe LoG (пeрвый), нo кaк-тo дoрaбoтaнee, aтмoсфeрнee и слoжнee. Мoжнo скaзaть и интeрeснee. Пoэтoмy, eсли игрaлись в пeрвyю. Прoшли yспeшнo. oстaлoсь жeлaниe прoдoлжaть приключeния - тo этa игрyшкa вaм пoдoйдёт в сaмый рaз. Хoтя. Дaжe, eсли в пeрвyю нe игрaли - сoйдёт "нayчиться" и вo втoрoю игрaть.

5 элeмeнтoв всeлeннoй нa 4рe пeрсoнaжa из 10 Нeксyсoв!
 
🐾Weredragon🐲

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
134.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 31 décembre 2014
Hey everyone and this is my review about the game!

This is a Dungeon crawler puzzle game.



Interface/Menu/Settings


There is a dungeon Editor.
There are plenty of different resolution sizes available.
You can play the game in fullscreen, windowed mode or borderless windowed mode.
There is a music volume slidebar available with %.
There is a sound volume slidebar available with %.
You can toggle mute the sound or music.
You are able to turn off auto-save.
You are able to change the controls on the keyboard.
There is old school mode. (You play without a map.)
Able to customize a character, including their stats.
Decent character customization available.
Has difficulty settings.
Has ironman mode and single use crystal mode. (iron mode = only saved at crystals.)

About the game.

Before you are going to start the game, you will be able to chosen to customise a character at your own will and choose how many party members you wish to have with you on the adventure. There are different classes, races and traits/perks. The race of a character is quite important as each race as different stats. Some are good for tanking, while others are better for magical support.`You are able to build the character in the way you want him to build. You and your party members will be dropped into a pit and you will have to make your way out of it. You will have to solve puzzles, fight monsters, level up and survive traps. There is a food and stamina bar. if a party member is carrying too much he will slow down the team and if a party member is carrying TOO MUCH, This will prevent the entire team from moving. Each party member has a hunger bar and needs to get fed. They can't die out of starvation but whenever they are starving their Mana and health will not get regain back). There are crystals around the map. They are used as save stations but they can also be used to heal, cure and revive party members.


Has food and stamina bar (Overloaded = can't move, Starving - no regain).
Has alot of puzzles.
Has secrets and collectables.
Has a hidden character.
Has save stations.
Beautiful graphics.
Decent soundtrack.
Characters are able to level up and learn new things.
Has a day and night Cyclus.

Other things.

You are able to use Custom images as portraits. This only has a cosmetic purpose and it is not giving you any advantages or disadvantages.

-------------------

I Give this game a 8/10
 
Crafozura
0
15 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
46.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 octobre 2014
Legend of Grimrock 2 has definately made vast improvements over its predecessor.
There are more classes, skills and a new race.

Character creation has alot more portraits and more easy to understand skill pathway which much more ease of use.

The level design is gorgeous, and is a complete change from the repeating corridors and shows a more unique and carefully designed environment, particularly in the very start of the game.

The graphics are very visually appealing and well polished, dynamic day/night system makes areas look different and appealing in both dark and light, at night the game makes me fearful for what could be lurking around.

Combat is much more fluid and fun with enemies that have different attacks than the next, keeping you always on your toes to figure out what the next enemy can do. The creatures all look uniquely designed and look amazing. There's even boss fights, absent in the previous game.

New mechanics implemented to encourage exploration and discovery, with secrets hidden around the world as well as digging around to find treasure.

Currently overall, this is LoG, but with alot more improvements both aesthetically and mechanically. Thanks devs for not letting me down with a great sequel!

Finished the game on both endings, needless to say the game ends well and feels good from start to finish.
 
Bluegills
2,293 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
82.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 février 2015
I have both LOG and LOG2 and will say that both are outstanding in just about everyway! Its got tons of puzzles (serious thinking required)and good time consumption for your money at a reasonable price. I also enjoy that the game has i decent difficulty setting as it should never feel as if things are easy....by the way for those that haven't played LOG its got a very interesting combat system where you have to click on weapons/spells to activate them with cooldowns while being in a realtime system from a first person perspective...also you aren't ment to go head to head with enemies as you will most surely die you need to practice heavily maneuvering while attacking almost as if combat is a puzzle as well. There is enough in LOG and LOG2 that you can actually skip some puzzle areas and still beat the game making well for several playthroughs and not being bored!!!
 
josephdw106

2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
168.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 septembre 2016
This is much improved from the orginal, but if you haven't played the orignal you should pick that up too!

The huge enhancement with this one is the dynamic areas, which you really see in compariing the great level building from LOG1 and LOG2. The areas are more dynamic with wall textures, multiple heights, swimming, falling, dieing, etc.

The area does have a mix of dungeons (like the first) but also open areas. They have also included new puzzle complexities and variations, including moveing blocks that activate, more switch variations, boss areas, and the fun pit fall like secrets in the mine (which I think is the coolest dungeon area in this game).

The end game also has some twists and turns. Yes, there is "less" story toward the end, but I think the dungeon/island master realizes he is in trouble and you are winning so he hides out in the castle. In the beginning it seems as if he is just screwing with you but as you progress you hear less and less from him (this makes sense to me).

If you like old school Dungeon Hack, you should get this now.

Évaluation publiée le 23 mars 2015
非常老式的4向迷宫探索地下城玩法，不过本作设计成了3D。
有些谜题有点难，而且转向是个大问题，法师的技能设计简直太麻烦了。
有点耗时间，而且战斗的MISS超级多，玩的有点不耐烦，因为需要一进一退的等冷却时间。
就场景来说，的确够丰富的。

Évaluation publiée le 18 octobre 2014
More equipment, more monsters, cool new spells, several new character classes, a new character race, improved skill sets, double hand slots, and more, and more, and more! And It's still grid-based! More freedom to explore means better chance of leveling up and getting better gear before you even go into the major dungeons! More flexibility in play style allows for self-challenges for improved re-playability. There will be challenging puzzles, but that's what the game is all about! There is no reason not to get Grimrock 2! (Especially if you already have played the first game!)

Évaluation publiée le 15 octobre 2014
First impressions: if you like the first Legend of Grimrock, you'll most likely like this sequel as well. It adds in the one, big element I wanted for the first game and that is the outdoor setting. You still got your dungeons and caverns, but now you can also move outside as well, in the same manner of course.

The controls are pretty much the same, but at the same time the game feels much smoother. Also the monsters seem to have a bit more AI, as they can do the good ol' square dance as well.

Hackstock

10 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
54.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 novembre 2015
This game disappointed me. The first LoG is fantastic. The big difference between the two is that while in LoG you almost always could progress to the next level, and the really crazy puzzles were for secret stuff; in LoGII the crazy puzzles are in the way all the time. Progressing in this game required me looking up in the internet all the time. I never once had to look anything up on LoG to finish it. To find all the secrets yeah, but I didn't *have to*. Additionally LoGII gives the impression that you could complete the 'open world' levels in any order but this isn't entirely true. Some have to be completed in order becasue the solution to puzzles are at the end of one section. However, to know this you have to look it up on the internet. I recoomend LoG the first one, but this one, is just a very very crappy sequel. All the effort seems to have gone to making the graphics look good (which my mac can barely handle at the lowest settings), while gameplay didn't improve. If you play it don't use firearms (they're weak) don't use your golden keys willy nilly and get the snake charmer's rope to go down holes.
 
engineer_rabbit
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
46.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 janvier 2022
Великолепная игра, полная духа приключений, разгадывания головоломок и поиска сокровищ. Понравится даже тем, кто пропустил или бросил на полпути, как я, первую часть. Потому что вместо визуально довольно одинаковых подземелий большая часть игры проходит на поверхности в открытом мире с несколькими локациями, которые связаны множеством троп и которые можно проходить в разном порядке. Порой даже если вы не смогли решить загадку, чтобы войти в крепость через главный ход, дизайнеры заботливо подкинут вам подземный тоннель, который доставит вас туда же с другой стороны.

Случайно купив игру на новогодней распродаже я запоем сидел в ней все праздники. Лучшие потраченные 100 рублей в моей жизни!
 
Pr1celess

Non recommandé
16.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 février 2018
I decided to play this game without a mage but some parts are so frustrating because they basically require you to cast spells or equip a weapon that you might not have found yet. I'm about to quit right now probably halfway through the game because of some stupid air elementals that can only be hit by a certain dagger and a mage spell.

The combat is tile based and it is pretty bad. I feel like I'm cheesing the game by constantly moving tiles and waiting for the enemy to reveal it's side so I can hit it without taking damage. I honestly think this game would've been more enjoyable with turn based combat.

The secret buttons in dungeon walls are stupid IMO. You have to constantly check the walls for buttons which gets old real fast.

I decided to abandon this game halfway through.

I wouldn't recommend this game unless you like old school dungeon crawlers.
 
Tobias Blumann

48.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 février 2020
I'm not gonna add much as reviews pretty much sum it up. Terrific sequel that adds to the OG game but doesn't try to be so different it doesn't give people what they really want: which is just more of LoG.

It does amaze me how people in this day and age, seemingly no matter the price will ALWAYS say "wait for a sale"...it's $23. I challenge anyone to create a game like this. All the Art, the programming, the testing. The software, the hardware, the office, the rent, the bills, the payroll. All of this for months on end. At the end of that process you take this creation and I'm gonna hand you $23 dollars. Then complain that that is way to much and it should be like $12...hell why not $6? That works better for me after all!

It just shocks me and I'm a poor cheap ass. I guess growing up when games went "beep beep" had 4-8 colors and 32 pixels and yet we paid up to $50-70 for 8-bit games that today could be made by 2 people in 4 weeks. Now, we get AMAZING games and $40 is an unholly ask. Good gawd that's AAA prices!! People have ZERO idea the man hours put into a game today and LUCKY we are that prices in comparison have GONE DOWN remarkable in fact. If the curve to work/overhead to what you received had continued a single game today would cost hundreds of dollars. But instead of a little appretiation it's constant: "Only buy on sale...I mean I had fun and spent 20 hours, but it's only worth $12"...Good grief.

Anyway buy this game, support them and appreciate them if you like this kinda game. If not don't but I'd love to see a #3 myself.
 
DoublePlusUngood

Non recommandé
5.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 novembre 2020
So, my feelings about this game are pretty mixed. This game is by all means not a bad game. But what this game is is increasingly frustrating to the point of me not wanting to play this any longer. Allowing players to decide where they want to go in this open world game sounds like a great idea, but for me this made everything just that more confusing. The game has a big map and the puzzles are not straightforward at all. Am i just not looking good enough for clues, or is it not yet possible for me to solve this puzzle? Resulting into me wandering around for what feels like ages not knowing where to go (plus include dying a few times because of random hordes of enemies while I'm looking at my inventory for clues or items that might help me)

Some puzzles are just for loot, but some are crucial to advance in the game. So if you did not pick up that particular item lying around an hour ago, you are screwed. I feel like the hints for puzzles (if you get any) are not hints at all. They are the creators laughing at you for not being able to solve this puzzle for all eternity until you looked over every nook and cranny 5 times and then you still do not get it.

This game would have pretty amazing for me if not for the above. But I did not buy this game to want to flip RL tables every time I am 10 minutes in game.

0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
26.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 janvier 2017
A superb sequel that brings everything the original had back to the table, and adds so much more to enjoy!

While maintaining the atmospheric emersion of the first game, Legend of Grimrock 2 presents us with a plethora of new settings. A bright sunny beach is the first, which will welcome you and ease you into the game. Soon enough you'll be making your way carefully through the dense murk of the swamps, or plumbing the lake depths to see what secrets they hold. Each location has its own personality, and while dungeon crawling through actual dungeons is still a significant portion of the game, the diversity really helps to mix things up.

Speaking of diversity, there are more enemies which have a much broader array of attack patterns. Some can leap or charge at you from one square away. Some can hop over you to attack your side. Some will burrow through the ground to pop out and ambush you. Added to this are a number of bosses! Each has it own powerful attacks, and most also have an array of minions to trap you.

The puzzles and secrets are back in force, and clever gamers will find no end to the rewards that can be found with a little patience and a good eye. Character creation now has quite a number of new and interesting options, including the Alchemist and the Battle Mage. If you're looking for a challenge you can also take the handicap class, the Farmer. Generally speaking the Farmer is intentionally worse than the other classes, but dedicated gamers can make them into forces to be reckoned with!

Legend of Grimrock 2 is truly an excellent game, and I would recommend it to all fans of the genre.
 
Rannen

Excellent sequal to a game. LoG2 expands on everything providing classes, more skills, more unique creatures to fight, better AI, different fighting strategies, more puzzles, everything. It really is a HUGE improvement over its predecessor.

There were many points where I felt like I was playing a D&D crawler / Myst / Riven hybrid.

Excellent game. Would definitely recommend it. If you even kind of enjoyed LoG, you will thoroughly enjoy this.

Non recommandé
2.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 mai 2020
I see why this game appeals to a lot of people.

It's just not for me. I feel like this game has the right foundation to draw me in but fails in several places.

1) In a couple of hours I arrived to a big open area with lots of paths to take, except everywhere you go there are enemies that are far stronger than me. Am I supposed to spend hours just figuring out the next actual path I am "supposed" to take to progress? That doesn't respect my time.

2) The combat mechanic has potential but feels simplistic, just hitting your weapon button when it's available.. hooray. Good luck with casting spells manually too, not fun for me.

3) As mentioned in other reviews, the puzzles are too cryptic, in one of them it seems I've gotten to an irreversible situation and I can't find any way to reset it after 10 minutes of looking around... why?

4) Oh it's a cool weapon, let me pick it up, oops guess what it's a trap you can't escape, you die, haha so much fun.

So yea, not for me but it did take me a couple of hours to figure it out, so try to pick it up on a sale if you do get it.
 
Droiagon
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
77.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 novembre 2014
Grimrock gives you the same feeling as Myst. They both give you a wonderful journey of discovery into a weird but internally consistent world with great puzzles. Overall, it's a wonderful, wonderful experience.

I have my gripes, though. The game is delightfully hard, as in challenging, but also stupidly hard. There are a lot of blind "I lose" buttons that are going to kill playes the first time, every time. You'll also die a lot because there aren't any hotkeys nor any pause button and you have to click really fast through inventory menus. The game math is opaque, counter-intuitive and unbalanced. Did you know that wizards are worse at being wizards than the hybrid wizard/figther class? Did you know that weapon damage becomes irrelevant to how much damage you deal in the second half of the game? Did you know that firearms are useless? Etc. Etc. Maybe the game can be balanced through patches.

Overall, a really great game with some really big frustrations. Maybe the smart choice is to wait until 2015 or 2016 for it to be patched up.
 
Socrates877
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
52.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 aout 2016
Teil 2 ist wie Teil 1, nur besser ;)

Schöne Grafik, leicht verständliche Steuerung, viel zu erkunden, teils knakige Rätsel und schwere Kämpfe.

Wie schon in Teil 1 ist keine umfangreiche Story oder Interaktion zwischen den Helden zu erwarten. Die Geschichte erzählt sich eher aus Bruchstücken, welche über die Insel verstreut sind.

Das Spiel hat vom Prinzip her alles, was moderne RPGs haben, nur eben minimalistisch. Und darin liegt der Reiz. Es ist einfach gehalten und doch kann man sich genug Gedanken machen, wie man seine Truppe ausrüstet bzw. spielt - wobei wirkliches Mikromanagement und Details nur im höchsten Schwierigkeitsgrad nötig sind.
Quests im Sinne hole dies, töte das gibt es nicht. Man ist auf der Insel allein und auf sich gestellt. Wer gerne auf Entdeckungstur geht, ist hier richtig - unsichtbare Grenzen gibt es hier nicht. Lediglich die Gegner bzw. die Stärke der eigenen Truppe entscheiden darüber, wo man hin kann und von wo man sich besser (noch) fern hält.

Insgesamt ein sehr gelungenes einzelspieler RPG.

Gesamt 10/10
 
Kauf dir'n Keks

Évaluation publiée le 8 octobre 2017
Am Anfang hat es echt gefetzt...ABER dann ...KEINE Questmarker ! Keine Hinweise WIE bzw. WO es weitergeht. Das wäre ja nicht soooo schlimm..wenn die "Maps" nicht riesig wären und nach einer Weile unzerstörbare Gegner rumlaufen die einen einklemmen können.Da hilft dann nur NEU laden. Uaaaah ! Ich bin es müde.Es gibt keine Story,keine NPCs mit denne man reden oder interagieren kann,keine Händler.LANGWEILIG. Das Spiel ist eigentlich gut im Ansatz..aber mich nervt es nach über 15 Stunden nur noch..weil man gefühlt überall 2 mal war..und ein Blick auf die Karte auch nicht weiterhilft,um zu erfahren wo denn nun der Spielstrang weiterführen könnte bzw. alles aufgedeckt scheint. Schade !
_ LOG2 ist für Hardcore Rollenspiel Fans !! und dieser SPIELERGATTUNG kann ich es empfehlen. Sonst eher nich so wirklich :I

Ich gebe ein negatives Review...weil ich es für NORMAL (Skyrim,Fallout) Rpg Spieler einfach zu sperrig und frustrierend finde.Wer den Hardcore Oldschool Rpg Kram vermisst ,sollte allerdings ohne zu überlegen zugreifen. Ich hab die 80er hinter mir und keinen Bock mehr auf so UNNÖTIGE Suchaktionen ,wie und WO es weitergeht

Évaluation publiée le 19 octobre 2014
This is my first review on Steam ever. I had to post about this absolutely fantastic game. It improves on the original by leaps and bounds. The outdoor environments alone make it a must-play, doubly-so if you enjoyed the first Legend of Grimrock. The additional races, classes, traits, new "skill" system, weapons, BOSSES, and level of customization depth make this game incredible for anyone who enjoys single player RPGs. I purchased it yesterday and I'm already 10 hours in. What a great game. Don't wait for it to go on sale; it is THAT good. Or better yet, support this developer so they keep making amazing games like this one. This is by far the best game I've played all year.

10/10.

Recommandé
21.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 décembre 2015
Absolutely brilliant! Nice graphics replete with moving trees and greenary, clouds and day/night cycles weather(well fog effects, no rain like DM II though) in the outdoor sections, even water with reflections and clear enough to see into (and although you can explore underwater and activate switches etc (you can even catch fish) however you cannot fight, but beware because there are creatures that can hurt you and you also need to have a way out to catch your breath when needed). Add to that the atmospherics and eerie sounds you have a very immersive environment to play in. The level designs are complex and challenging (open world with the player choosing what to tackle next, and puzzles that require lateral thinking) and the depth of gameplay will have you fully engaged. To cover it all would take alot of space, so to keep it short I will just say it's a "must have" for any fan of the RPG dungeon crawl-party/resource management genre!
 
Slipperyjim
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
28.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 juillet 2016
The sequel to the hit First-Person Dungeon-Crawl RPG, The Legend of Grimrock II improves on the previous game in so many ways! The gameplay, the music, the graphics, the dungeon layouts! Everything! So, let’s go into one of my trademark reviews and see just how much was improved!

Gameplay: If you’ve played the first Legend of Grimrock, then the gameplay is going to feel extremely familiar. It’s the same as in the first game, but with a few minor tweaks that make playing the game so much more enjoyable. Firstly, you’ll notice that instead of being in a dungeon throughout the entire game like you were in the first game, in LoG 2 you spend most of your time outside with only needing to go into the dungeons (you read that right, in this game, there’s not just one dungeon, but a whole bunch of them!) whenever you need to solve some puzzles. The monster AI has been improved and multiple heights in dungeons were added, which kind of takes power away from the whole attack, sidestep/back away from enemies that worked throughout much of the previous game, although still doable to some degree. There’s more weapons and armor and skills and spells to learn, and new classes were added, as was a new race, meaning you have even more customization than you did in the previous game with your party generation. I also like how there are pools of water in the game and you can dive in and explore as if you were still on land but just slower moving. As I said, Almost Human has improved the Grimrock experience in many ways!

Graphics: While the graphics look the same, they’re still really friggin’ beautiful! You have the same graphics engine that was used in the original Legend of Grimrock, but with more enviroments, more monsters, more weapons and armor, and more other stuff but I haven’t exactly beaten the game yet so I can’t tell you about all of the new graphics in the game.

Music: The only music that I really know for a fact was new was the Grimrock II Title Theme, in addition to the new ambient sounds for forests, but that’s all I know of that changed.

Story: I saved the best for last this time! In Legend of Grimrock II, as with the first Legend of Grimrock, your party is a group of prisoners who are accused of some unknown crime and are being transported somewhere (where, I don’t know, I don’t think the game exactly tells you) but during your “trip”, a storm brews and casts the ship your on into the Island of Nex (the game’s setting) and you have to find out why the Island Master has summoned you here so that you can leave. The story is a much better one than the one found in Legend of Grimrock I and, without spoiling the story too much, there’s a twist ending in the game! Even the old-school Dungeon Crawler RPGs that I’ve played couldn’t pull that off! Mind you, I’ve only truly played and beaten the Eye of the Beholder Trilogy (if you can call it that) and they didn’t have any twist endings.

Overall, this is a game that shows just what a game company, no matter how large or how small, can do, especially when they’re this dedicated to improving their games’ experiences and I should hope that, should Legend of Grimrock III ever come to light (and I’m really hoping it does), then may Almost Human improve upon this game’s strengths, and make an even better one. Really, this is the classic story of a game company that could’ve used the Legend of Grimrock I Dungeon Editor to make another dungeon similar to what was in the first game, but they didn’t, they took it a step further than that and completely re-tooled their old Dungeon Editor and make a similar, yet very different, Legend of Grimrock game. Hopefully, other game devs will follow in Almost Human’s footsteps.
 
Jestan Diams
420 produits enregistrés

Évaluation publiée le 11 aout 2015
Подгоняешь браваду из 4 молодцев (две бурёнки, одного неспелого самца и самки) к пропасти и видишь- на другой стороне орнамент, который поможет выбраться из пещеры. Пропасть 20 метров глубиной, упадёшь, сломаешь все 8 ног сразу. Смотришь, выдолблена в камне подсказка: “Пройди дорогой орла!” cказано в ней……, и всё……, и……, бл**ь, чё за н*х?! Сидишь, тупишь. Долбанный орнамент на другой стороне. А до него не добраться просто так! Всё закрыто! Мостов и канатов нет. Сначала лазаешь по стенкам, как в психушке! Секретных рычажков тоже нет! Проклинаешь всё и шлёшь на**р эту загадку! Начинаешь сносить игру вместе с виндой…., и тут.... Ёптетить твою же ш! Дорога еб***го орла! Как же я не догадался то! Орёл, ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, птица! Он же летает! Приводишь браваду обратно. Пропасть смотрит на них, а они на пропасть. И тут ты думаешь: “Я с ума cшедший, пойду, пройдусь по воздуху.” И *уя! У тебя под ногами появляется магическая панелька, и ты такой: “Я Е***ЫЙ ОРЁЛ, ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥!”Курлык, курлык и до фигурки, а потом хочешь вернуться……, ан нет. Н*х! Теперь ты в ловушке. Ворота закрылись и х*р ты куда выйдешь! Видишь, НОВАЯ ПОДСКАЗКА! “Пройди тропой невидимой” И всё…. И ты такой: “ППППППППППФФФФФФФФФФФФФФ, ДА Я Ж ОРЁЛ! КАКАЯ ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ ТРОПА!?”, и ломаешь на**р все 8 ног. Баба у меня маг, но левитировать не может, она не постигла дзен, только пригорание пукана освоила. А вы, что думаете? Она фаером просто так хлыщет? Она пердит фаером, аж после первой загадки! У неё пукан начинает пригорать и она взлетает на жопце, как ракета! Вот вам и орел.... 2 кентавра и хуман стоят и машут, мол, перди до переключателя, может, и откроешь дверь. Ан нет, так легко не будет. Какой - нибудь дух да вылезет и впер**лит магу, и покажет средний палец всей оставшейся партии.
Да, там бывает и такое! Жмешь к примеру кнопку и тебе влетает фаер болл в срачник. И духи кричат: “СТРАЙК!”. Прыгаешь в подвал, а там куча мертвечины. Видишь, лежит ключ, прямо в конце комнаты. Я б сказал: “Ну на**р, пойду на пляж, буду крабами питаться. На какое гузно мне этот остров сдался?”, но партия тип: ”Нам сцыкуны не нужны!”, и ты такой: “Ну еб вашу ж мать, это ж ловушка…”. Подходит уе*ан минотавр, берёт ключ, дверь позади хлопает, и начинают открываться потайные проходы в стенах, а там, куча всякой еб**ни- мертвечины, которая так долго ждала своего уе*ана. И ты такой ”Б*я, че ж делать?”. Видишь люк. Надо сигать, бежать! Но там же тоже может быть ЕБ**ИНА! Делать нечего. Минотавра- уе**на оставляем, а сами сигаем. Прыгаешь вниз, а там плотоядные духи, которые кидаются сосульками! Ещё и крыса мутант в придачу с КАРАБЕЛЬНОЙ ПУШКОЙ!, которая снесла напрочь голову второму минотавру. Остался только хуман. Видит сток в канализации. Либо плавать в дерьме, либо быть кормом для крыс. Пан либо пропал! Прыгаешь в стоки с дерьмом. Выкидывает его в океан. Спасся! Бежишь до кристалла воскрешения и всё по новой..
Опустили смачно))) Сначала закрыли в ловушки, указав на глупость, потом кинули на съедение мобов, чтоб обос*ался, а потом унизили, выкинув в канализацию. Этот чудный жанр РПГ.
10 крысиных каках из 10 этому шедевру! Ибо он действительно стоит внимания настоящих олдскульных игроков!!! И это так =)
 
Djenatan Rin

Recommandé
13.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 décembre 2016
DISCLAIMER: This is a first impressions review, and NOT a full review, if you want a full review, then please read better reviews then mine

After you manage to find your way out and escape Mount Grimrock, you become shipwrecked on an island and your only objective is to find a way out and survive, will you manage?

Legend of Grimrock 2 is a game developed and published by Almost Human Games and is the sequel to the first dungeon crawler game; Legend of Grimrock. Legend of Grimrock 2 puts you in control of a group of four prisoners aiming to find their way out off an island. Search for secrets, find clothes, weapons and armours and continuously upgrade the abilities of your party members

It is a wonderful game if you are willing to immerse into it. But it requires a lot of patience and endurance because it's a very difficult game. The game allows you to set up your personal party, choosing the race and abilities of your members or you can simply start by using a pre-defined group. As an old-fashioned dungeon crawler you can only move one step at a time in one direction

Legend of Grimrock 2 has great atmosphere with nice and improved graphics from the first game and addictive game with extremely good and varied puzzle design with many different and gradually stronger enemies and mysterious hints that gradually reveal the story and are very rewarding

The mazes can be maddening at times but at the same time this adds to the claustrophobic mood the game is trying to portray, however, Legend of Grimrock 2 isn't easy so be prepared to die a lot

Overall, Legend of Grimrock 2 is a fun dungeon crawler to play in bursts and is a great return to the Legend of Grimrock series!

RECOMMENDED :)
 
ThePCGamer

Recommandé
66.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 décembre 2014
While my Steam profile doesnt show it ive raked up a fair ammount of time in the first LoG (Bought it outside of Steam) I both enjoyed and thought it was an excellent upgrading to an old and till then dead genre of game I fondly missed from my youth in the early 90's with games such as Eye of the Beholder 1/2 and Lands of Lore... perfectly crafted to catter to those oldies like myself who played it for the nostalgia factor and for those new players who might have been curious about the strange creature that is grid based, real time dungeon exploration...

Having said that, LoG2 can be summed up in a single sentence...

Better than the first in every regard.

To expand, the atmosphere is better, the graphics are better, the mechanics better, challenge better, puzzles are better (although some are recycled or expanded upon from the first game) the monster you face are better, stronger, scarier (Bloody mimics make me jump every single damn time!.. always).

So if you've played LoG and enjoyed it even a small amount dont pass up LoG2, you'll enjoy it even more... I still havent finnished it and while ive been careful im sure ive missed quite a lot in my journey around the Island, so ill deffinetly be going a second time once ive completed my first.

But yeah, like LoG... get LoG2, its that simple. Won't be disappointed.
 
[88th] ColPresumptuous
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
36.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 aout 2015
In an industry riddled with companies releasing buggy unfinished games, milking their customers with shallow dlc and indie developers making nostalgia pandering shlock, Legend of Grimrock 2 stands as a shining example of the game done right. Ready out of the gate, working, polished product that knows its strengths and weaknesses, it manages to present an old school dungeon crawling experience made with modern standards and excel at it. For a fair price of 24 dollars you going to get a fulfilling product that provides around 30 hours of gameplay, with free dungeon editor and a bunch of well done community made maps.

Compared to its predecessor Legend of Grimrock 2 is doing well to learn on past mistakes and improves itself in many areas: boss fights are now more varied and interesting, level design isn't as convoluted but still contains many secret areas, leveling and class systems provide more room for experimentation, and the whole open world twist is just a great finishing touch.
As with the previous title, each area contains many puzzles and secret areas, so if you're really into treasure hunting you gonna have a good time.

Overall all, I give Legend of Grimrock 2 a heavy recommendation and Almost Human Games deserve some applause for doing so many things right, where others have failed.
 
Lomeo
533 produits enregistrés

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
40.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 octobre 2014
This game is a dungeon crawling masterpiece. It leaves a lot open to interpretation and imagination which I like. The general feeling is between a classic dungeon master style game and Myst. The combat is suprisingly fast paced and interesting.
When I started the game I found it really difficult to get started. I wasn't happy with the races and found the beggining really difficult. Because I wasn't doing much damage at the start and didn't quite understand the gameplay I reloaded a dozen times and remade characters a bunch. This turned me off at first but I'm glad I muddled through as it was one of the most rewarding games I've ever played.
My only other complaint was sometimes the logic on some of the puzzles didn't make sense or only had a very weird clue. I love a mysterious puzzle but there is a thin line between logical puzzles and randomly guessing. The guessing part gets old. Anyways A++ game. I'm extremely happy that a game with this old school feel has sprouted in the year 2014.

-Pros -

great combat (learning curve)
Great envirement (absolutely perfect graphics for a crawler)
Perfect sound (engaging but subtle)
Great Dungeon creator kit and community (if you ever wanted to build dungeons like I did as a kid)
Great puzzles
Never had a glitch, extremely refined game

-♥♥♥♥-

Learning curve
Races aren't as flexible as I'd like
Puzzles quite difficult
Might turn you into a dungeon addict

Évaluation publiée le 13 novembre 2021
This is a great game up until the point where you start to starve to death. See, they did a great job making a fun game, and then they put in a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ joke of a class called "The Farmer." A class that eats food and gains experience for doing so BUT...means they had to design a game where food was LIMITED. And that means that you spend your time building your party up to a high level and THEN...you starve to death because the idiotic limit of "food" has been limited because of the joke class called "The Farmer." And then you die.

Great game ruined by a joke. "Food" limitations in CRPGS are already a stupid idea but thanks to the Farmer class in this game...just finish it fast, or you will starve. Uninstalling, after too many hours. I am NOT calling up console commands to feed my party just because of the "Farmer" class and the stupid limits they put on this game because of it.

Recommandé
80.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 novembre 2014
I may update this review after completing the game, but after 12 hours into it, I feel that my review can do justice to it's greatness.

- The puzzles are challenging
- The battles are challeging, but like the puzzles, are won by using your brain, not by rushing into the enemy.
- The game is long (took me 10h to beat the 2nd boss).
- The visuals are great, especially outdoors.
- The outdoor dungeons and hubs really add more immersion in conparison to the first game.
- The classes feel balanced and every level on a skill makes a difference.
- It's good to LOOK CAREFULLY EACH WALL YOU PASS BY, and this may be an annoyance to some people, but I found that rewarding, because of the great number of secrets (and traps too).


No doubt, my GOTY so far. Not kidding.

29.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 juillet 2015
I went into this game having played the first one and loving it. But this time around I heard the game would mostly take place outside and I was super excited. At first it was awesome just like the first game with the unique combat and nice scenery. But then you get into the game and the entire premise of the game revolves around a very simple, but long task. At first it seems fine, but 15hrs into the game and still doing the same thing it got pretty boring. Then finishing the game the ending didn’t seem to reward all of the monotonous collecting. Don’t get me wrong, the puzzles are mostly great and the scenery is amazing, but overall I finished the game and felt that it wasn’t worth it overall.

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
10.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 décembre 2017
The game starts showing 4 prisoners (you controlling this party) onboard on a ship. After some stormy weather the ship capsizes and you manage to float toward an island on a raft of ship wreck wood, despite being in a big metal cage.

Although this game is fun, I feel it doesn't live up the it's precedessor, Legend of Grimrock (1).
What I liked about the first game was it was more simple I felt with the only environment being the labryinth inside as well as going down level by level rather than in and out and up and down smaller and shorter mazes.

I felt the skill tree system wasn't as good compared to the first one as well as despite being over double the amount of classes, I think it's a bit unnecessary for example the barbarian, knight and fighter classes. I think this should have been limited to 1 or 2 at most.

However, being on an island instead of inside a mountain, there is a day time/night time cycle feature which is pretty cool, not to mention the ability to farm, fish and dig for treasure, weapons and what not.

I'd give the game a 7/10.
 
jackolantern343

JDRiot
198 produits enregistrés
1
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
13.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 septembre 2023
Damn, I really wanted to love this game. My first impressions were SO good. The graphics are much better than Grimrock 1 and everything looks (and actually is) grander.
The problem is the difficulty which is totally out of whack. Grimrock 1 isn't easy by any stretch of the imagination but aside from 1-2 areas everything is "hard but fair". Grimrock 2 basically says "screw this" and delivers one artificially overtuned moment after another. Enemies in this game have so much HP and dish out so much damage which means that your own party constantly struggles back to the last HP regen crystal. You'll be stuck in rooms with a lot of enemies constantly that can easily surround and kill you and because they have so much HP, facetanking is rarely an option. In one very badly designed instance you'll be thrown into a pit full of zombies which sheer number means that you seriously can't survive unless luck makes it so they don't block your way through by their number. In those moments whoever thought this up expected you to just know how to survive (don't know about switches on the walls you all need to activate? Too bad, you died). This all boils down to the most outragious trial-and-error fest I have every experienced in a videogame. It all is manageable in the end - it just isn't very fun.
There are some real puzzle highlights in this game that are sadly totally overshadowed by so many "please think like the developers or be stuck for forever"-moments.

Overall the structure, the world and most of what Grimrock 1 does is here - it's all just guarded by a wall of frustration that the developers mistook for "challenging gameplay".
 
Swimfan

0

Almost Human lo ha vuelto a hacer, un juegazo en todo regla de muy buena calidad que incluso la podría llamar obra maestra. Hacía mucho tiempo que no veía un juego tan bien acabado y tremendamente divertido a la vez que desafiante. Los puzzles a veces me han vuelto loco, pero una vez que los sacas te paras y dices "que hps, qué bien lo tenían pensado", todo está bien hilado y no hay NADA transcendente, si está ahí ese objeto o indicación es por algo.

En definitiva, una obra maestra que se merece pasar a la historia de los videojuegos. Aunque no sea tu género vas a ver un juegazo como hacía muchos años que no veías.

¡Enhorabuena Almost Human!

1,580 produits enregistrés

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
612.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 décembre 2021
良作3DダンジョンACT
マス目単位で動くアクションゲームLoGの続編です。が、直接的なつながりはありません。
1の低予算な感じから大幅なパワーアップを遂げて遥かに手が込んでいます。
謎解きもガチなのが多くてノーヒントだと相当しんどいことでしょう。
序盤が終われば順番がほとんど関係なく比較的自由に色々な場所を巡れるので、
2周目でアイテムの場所も一通り分かっている状態でやるのもまた一興です。

とても面白いのですが、異様に速い敵がいるのとジョブ間のバランスがあんまり良くないのは不満点でしょうか。
特にアルケミストのハーブ増殖は必須なレベルで強く、これ前提でバランスを取っているフシがありますね。
前衛職も色々いるけど実質よわよわな子もいるし、魔法なんかは完全にスキルレベル依存なのでエナジーポーションがあれば誰だっていいです。
特にウィザードなんかエナジーがちょっと多いだけなので入れる必要が全くありません。素手詠唱できるから何？20分でシークレットから杖が手に入ります。

あとは敵がリスポーンするのがちょっと嫌。

ともあれ全体的に色々なステージがあって屋外も多いので1と違って辛気臭くなく、ボリュームも非常にあるため面白いです、オススメ。

★★★MODについて★★★
有志が作った良質なカスタムダンジョンがたくさんあり、手を出すとまさに無限に遊べます。
本編が気に入ったなら是非やるのをオススメ。4GB patchという外部ツールで使用メモリを上げておかないとメモリ不足になりますが。
 
sumaneko
0

Non recommandé
42.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 novembre 2022
Pros:
- It has a undeniable nostalgic charm. If you are looking to play a nostalgic dungeon crawler I guess it can be great.
- On the right settings the game can be challenging, not something I'd say about the majority of games.
- Some of the puzzles are entertaining.

♥♥♥♥:
- Plot...well there's almost. When the nostalgic charm dissipates, the lack of lore, and story and character progression is sorely missed.
- The mechanics and games are getting rather repetitive with time.

In the end, about mid-way through I felt like I'm playing mostly for completion sake, and that's for me is not worth recommending. Even though, I'm sure it can be appeal to some.

Fantastic game but often brutal in it's application of traps. Not just a nostalgic look back to games like Dungeon Keeper and Eye of the Beholder but a significant evolution of the genre. Enemies are not always limited to moving exactly one square at a time and may often surpise you when first encountered. The puzzles range from straight forward to perhaps a bit too obtuse but with all the resources of the internet you wont be stuck any longer than you want to be.

Non recommandé
4.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 mai 2020
I'm the target market for this game. I'm an old, grognardy CRPG player. Unfortunately the combat was not designed for me, and I'd argue it's not designed for anyone. You have to spend all combat staring at the bottom-right 1/4 of your screen, clicking little icons as they become available. This is bad design; you spend combat staring at UI elements instead of the thing you're fighting. Hot keys would have made this playable, a tactical turn-based approach to combat would have made this fun. As is, I don't think this is for anyone.

初代Wizardryが好きすぎて、ダンジョン・クローラーを見つけると、ついついやってしまうのですが、これは期待外れでした。グラフィックはきれいだし、ひかれる要素はたくさんあるのですが、RPGというより、パズルゲーム。しかも、ほとんど一本道で、自由度がとても低い。あっちに行って鍵を取り、こっちを開けてまた鍵を取り、今度はこっちで…という繰り返し。自由度という点では、キャラメークやスキルの割り振りで楽しむしかないです。とても残念。
 
Tokugawa
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
19.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 octobre 2014
I am going to start this review of by saying one simple sentence before i get into the Nitty Gritty of why you should buy this game!
"This game is my personal GOTY for 2014 and every minute is a imerrsive blast of fun that i don't want to stop"

Now onto the review!

Firstly I will talk about the points i think make this game EXTREMELY good.
- Gameplay
- Immersion
- Visuals
- Sounds
- Unique-ness

This game in it's gameplay does something that other games simply cannot capture, from the open worlds of skyrim all the way to one of my personal favourite RPG's (Fallout). What it does is something i don't FEEL in games anymore, it captures feelsing i didn't think a game could make and then encourages me to play the game with the freedom of my own mind.
What i mean by this is the game immerses you completely in it's world, It never feels like you are playing a game but you are a crew of prisoners, fighting your way through a beautiful and luxurious island. Every atmosphere feels unique to the game and immerses you in the adventure, you REALLY FEEL like you are on an adventure, not PLAYING an adventure in a GAME. Like i said, i've loved and played many RPG's buy this is one of the few games that have captures a pure, undying sense of ADVENTURE from within me.
The gameplay is also something i love, the world feels seamless and connected which helps to support and ecourage you to explore and look for secrets. It's like small open-worlds, this way you can explore a lot and look for every secret - without overbearing amounts of land to cover. It's a game where doing puzzles, finding secrets feels extremely rewarding each time.
The combat in this game is what i believe to hit-or-miss, either you will enjoy it or... You will not. It's using an older generation of RPG as inspiration, Q and E to turn, then WASD to move around on a grid. Combat is real time, with a turn based aspect. Meaning you and the enemy attack eachother based on spell and weapon cooldowns. I believe the charm of the game (being the older style RPG) is either hit-or-miss, i myself love it though and it adds a unique charm that no other games capture!
My next point is the class and race system, it's executed so well i needn't say much other than you get a good amount of race and classes to build a squad that suits you, everythign plays completely differently than other classes. Later skill building further increases variation to a point where you can do what you want, and play how you want (and if you understand the farmer class, i assume you are a god at this game.)
Lastly the sound and visuals, they both work well together with the immersion to create a world that looks realistic enough to tottaly engross you, but still fantasy enough to really give off that old RPG feel. The games graphics are not taxing (but then my computer can handle anything) but still manage to blow me away even more than most recent releases ( *cough* Shadows of mordor *cough* )

Overall this game is absolutely a brilliant game, developing it's strengths from the first game and making something near perfect. I have little to no weak points about this game so far and even if i did, i wouldn't bother putting them here simply because they would be as miniscule as; Only skill points and not stat points, or i am bad at puzzles and my brain hurts.
Basically you want this game, it's superb, it's fun, it's beautiful and it does one thing i deem most important.
It's unique.
 
Platinumb
1,361 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
54.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 novembre 2014
Intro: For me, Legend of Grimrock 2 came out of nowhere. I didn't ever expect a sequel to the first game, but when I saw it I picked it up based on how good the first game was. If you are new to Grimrock or new to Dungeon crawling games I recomend playing the first Game. The original game is slower and teaches you the basics much better than its faster cousin.

Gameplay: Much like the first game, you have the same style of dragging and dropping for inventory management. Clicking on characters weapons to attack and drawing patterns in the runes to cast spells. Navigating the menus can be clunky if your in a pinch, but if you use the numbered hot keys you shouldn't have a problem.

Puzzles: Puzzles are a big part of Dungeon crawling games. The puzzles in Grimrock 2 are weaker than the first game. Most of the time with puzzles you won't even know there is anything to solve. The game progresses along until you hit a brick wall and are stuck. And unless you did a super specific thing the game didn't elaborate on you will be stuck. The puzzles are challenging don't get me wrong, but when you don't receive enough information to know there is a puzzle to solve, it's frustrating.

Open World(Not really but we will call it that): Unlike The first Grimrock, the second opens the player up to a bunch of areas really fast. Much like Dark Souls, going to areas you are not prepared for will get you killed. The "open world" gives the player a sence of exploring foreign lands and although the back tracking sucks, it makes the player learn the island and get familar with it as their home.

Random thoughts: This game is exactly as it looks: Challenging, fun, and thought provoking. Prepare your internet browsers, because some of these puzzles are random af. Involving time of day, standing in certain spots for periods of time or digging multiple times.

Conclusion: All in all its a good buy for a fan of the genre or franchise. If your new to these kinds of games, wait for a sale and pick up the first game. Who knows there could be a christmas bundle.
 
Joosh

Old school awesome.

Évaluation publiée le 12 novembre 2014
Hugely expanded sequel to the previous version.

It is much harder in places and you will be tempted to look up spoilers. There are many challenges which feel "too hard". True - there are some that are easier than others, and I would chastise the design in giving too few clues.
As an example, you don't learn the "light" spell for your caster until a couple of hours into the game.

The previous version was a fairly linear challenge. The rule of LoG2 is if you die trying (a few times), run away.
Then, get more skill points, find a better sword and return to the challenge.
 
76561197971680476
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 novembre 2014
As I hoped, developers did a great job by enhancing the gameplay in this sequel. I am personally looking forward to Legend of Grimrock 3 and onward! This game sure brings back memories just as the previous one did.

P.S. And how about a [nearly impossible] challenge - try to beat the game with party of 4 farmers on hard mode. :-)

Évaluation publiée le 10 novembre 2014
If you think that Legend of Grimrock was any good then that's it you don't need to read this review.

New classes,Outside world, New difficulty setup, New firearms weaponry.

The game is richer bigger and better.

At first you will feel like the clostrophobic feeling of the first game is way behind, well don't there's still some caves and castles for you to explore.

After ending the game I had only one wish start the game again with a new team setup.
The game is cruel and you will want to bash your head on the wall with enigmas at certain point, but hey honestly if you are in the donjon crawler type of game you want hard enigmas and good figthing, isn't it?

9/10

Évaluation publiée le 9 novembre 2014
Dungeon Crawler game. A TON of puzzles. I had no trouble with most of the puzzles but some of them were pretty rough or obtuse. I found myself playing this game for many hours and enjoying it. At least the first 10 hours(23 hours to beat).

You will probably end up using a guide if you get stuck.

I had skipped many areas thinking I had to return later but when I returned I had just to solve a puzzle that actually did not require returning later. It is cool in the open worldish aspects it has.

*8/10*

148 produits enregistrés

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
95.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 mai 2015
New content. Much game. So pretty. Much wow.

The expanded content, works well. The large scope of the island. Is intimidating. But the plentiful amount of food, shifts much of the mood of barely suspended dread, into a more casual, explore and adventure game. If you didn't play the first, I'd still very much recommend it. In fact, I'd go so far, right now, after 7.5 hours, as to say that it's a better game. More coherent, and more atmospheric.

I don't mind the square layout of the environment, and a few of the areas are incredibly claustrophobic, simply from atmosphere. You can still make simple mistakes that get you killed. And sometimes pushing a button in the middle of a dungeon or area, can dramatically shift the mood right back to horror.

I think the best way to enjoy this game is to play something like 5-15 hours, on normal or easy, just to get a feel for the new challenges. Then, restart, and choose at least one of the "2nd Wave" like options. These options, if memory serves, affect the regeneration crystals, and quick saving. Definitely helps to shift the mood back to the lost / isolated / tragic ambiance of the first game.
 
Ningauble

LoG2 get's a thumbs up from me!

Évaluation publiée le 4 mars 2021
I was gutted about this game... such a difference from the original and not in a good way.

It was trying too hard, with more visuals, settings etc and it lost it's charm.

Being outside, but still trying to achieve a dungeon feel just didn't work.

The puzzles were difficult and just became annoying and no longer fun.

I don't quit games very often... but I just couldn't be bothered!

Haven't been back since and probably won't try it again.

Such a shame, as the original worked a lot better than this game for me.

It's a no from me, sorry devs.

micco40
373 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
826.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 mars 2015
９．５／１０

良い
手堅いゲームプレイ
難解なパズル（ヒントが見つかれば）
しっかりと調整されているので無駄なレベリングが必要ない
モンスターのアルゴリズムの強化
オールドスクールなゲームによく似合う、正統派ファンタジーらしい造形

悪い
難解なパズル（ヒントが見つからないと）
ただ立つだけでゲートが召喚されるは嘘（数十時間も無駄にさまよい歩いた、おかげで十二分に観光できたが）
Island Master戦だけはレベリングもしくはステータス強化が必要だと思う


ダンジョン・マスターの様なゲームと言っても２０年以上前のゲームなので昨今の若い子たちには分からないだろうが、オールドスクールな３Ｄ視点・移動（方眼紙のマス目を一マスずつ動くようなアレ）のダンジョン・クローリング型のアクションRPG。前作が気に入ったので今作もプレイしてみたが、大当たり。難易度ノーマルで脱出エンドまではレベル１３、１４で８０時間ほど。ネクサスまではレベル１５、１６で１３０時間近くかかり（彷徨いすぎ）、試行錯誤のすえ何とかクリアー。（２、３箇所でヒントが見つからなかった＆解読できなかったのでコミュニティーでヒントを探したりしたが）パーティーメンバーはファイター（ミノタウル）、ナイト（ヒューマン）、アルケミスト（ラットリング）、ウィザード（ヒューマン）。筆者のやり方が悪いだけかもしれないが、現時点ではIsland Master戦はコミュニティーで言われている簡易的な討伐方法はどうも通用しないようだ。

操作メカニックはキーボード＆マウスで行うPCゲームでゲームコントローラーは非対応。

難易度はイージー／ノーマル／ハードの三種でそれに加えてオールド・スクールモード（オートマッピングなし）など縛りをチョイスできる。

職業はお馴染みのファイター、ローグがあり、メイジに変わってウィザード、その他に今作ではバーバリアン、バトルメイジ、ナイト、アルケミスト、農民が追加。それぞれ職業特性があり、自分の思い描くロールプレイがしやすくなった。（やはりというか、現時点では農民が最強）

種族もお馴染みの、ミノタウル（牛）、ヒューマン（人）、インセクトイド（虫）、リザードマン（蜥蜴）の他に、ラットリング（鼠）という、マニアックな種が追加されている。種族も固有の特性があるのでそれを選んでプレイするのも面白い。

右手・左手の持ち物にタブで切り替えられるサブハンドの追加。（アイテムを４つ持てる）

今作では魔法の発動はルーンを一つ一つクリックするのではなく、一筆でなぞる形になった。エンチャント系の魔法が無くなったが、使い勝手が悪いので妥当だろう。

近年プレイしたのRPGの中では最も良く出来ていると思える謎解き中心のゲームプレイで、ゲートの開け方がわからずに本気で途方に暮れることを受け合える。少ない手がかり、ヒントからゲートの開け方や進むべき道を見つけた時の達成感はこういったゲームならではで、他では味わえないもの。今作では謎解きが簡単なものも難解なものもあるので、所詮スイッチパズルだと思っていると痛い目にあう。ヒントがないと絶対に無理だと思える箇所もあるので心してかかろう。また、ヒントが見つかってもヒントを読み解けないと謎は解けないのでコレも心してかかろう。そんな謎解きにはヒントが読み解けた時の得も言われぬ達成感を感じることが出来るはずだ。

戦闘バランスは相変わらずの魔法頼りな調整だが、近接が当たりすぎるとかなり楽になるため（ステータス強化で確認）、近接の当たる確率＆遠距離武器＆魔法の弾数で手応えのあるちょうどいいバランスだと思う。今作では正面からガチで戦っても余程の相手ではない限り全滅ということはなく遊びやすく仕上がっていると思える。今作のラスボスは逃げ道がないので死力を尽くして戦うべし。

今作では立体的なマップ構成がされており、水の中や、一段、二段高い足場などマップにも複雑性が増している。

値段も良心的で、ゲームプレイに水増しはなく、昨今の５～６千円で売られているゲーム以上のボリュームがある。この手のゲーム好きなら定価でも手放しでお勧めできる。ダンジョンエディターも付いているし、ワークショップにも対応。

こんなに手の込んだゲームを作る人達なのに、なんの捻りもないアイランド・マスター戦は残念すぎたが、それでも十二分に楽しくゲームプレイを堪能できるゲームらしいゲームで、RPGや難しい謎解きが好きで、世界観や操作方法に抵抗がなければチャレンジしてみることをお勧めする。近年最高峰の謎解きRPGだ。

日本語非対応ですが、英語自体はそれほど難しくはないものの、きっちり訳せないとヒントを間違えてしまうことに成りかねないので、注意が必要。（筆者は１ヶ所それで失敗し、十時間ほど無駄にした）基本的に文言は全てスクロールかメモ、立て札や看板などに書かれているものだけなので、何度も読み返すことが出来、自身の過失以外では文章を読み落として目的を見失うということはない。
 
兎訛りの兎
205 produits enregistrés

Yeza
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
25.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 aout 2015
Recommended for puzzle solvers - worth the money, especially when on sale.

Old school CRPG taking inspiration from Dungeon Master, Eye of the Beholder, Captive and other "monsters visible on the movement grid" type games (as opposed to the "pop up" encounters of Bard's Tale, Wizardry etc).

Dust off those Dungeon Master 4-step skills and prepare to fight and die ... really quite a lot.

The combat, while mandatory, isn't the real meat of this game - that would be the puzzles, riddles and secret rooms. They start off easily enough with a few simple presure plate tasks but soon become quite complex and taxing. The time to solve is obviously going to vary but late game I was spending probably 60-70% of the time experimenting with puzzles and trying to work out what I was supposed to do and how. The vast majourity of the puzzles felt "fair" in that if you had explored fully you had enough hints to work things out.

Not completed at the time of this review - I reached a point where frustration with a sequence of tricky puzzles and very harsh combats made we want to reach for a guide to "just get this over with"; so I have decided to take a break from the Island.

Terrain looks amazing, puzzles are challenging but logical, combat is pretty much the same as in the first one (wasn't much to improve there), but now there are more weapon choices and overall more class customization.

I highly recommend to buy this game, if you liked the first one, and even if you haven't played the first one, no worries! For stories are not related.
Recommended!

3.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 mars 2016
Je ne recommande pas ce jeu en comparaison de son prédécesseur à cause du systeme de classes :
Dans le 1er les différentes classes ouvraient différents arbres de compétences et beaucoup de skill points pour se diversifier au se spécialiser dnas la compétence voulue. Or dance ce jeu toutes les classes offrent la meme skill pool, avec très peut de skill points. La où dans le premier on pouvait faire un personnage focalisé sur l'armure en y mettant 50 points de skill et obtenir de gros bonus, ici un mage ou un guerrier auront accès à la meme compétence armure, qui se max au bout de 5 points (1 points par lvl).

tl;dr les classes sont foireuses elles régissent toutes les meme skills

It's like the first Legend of Grimrock but better in every way! This is one of the few games that I was very eagerly anticipating since the announcement. That's about as close to a nightmare that I've ever gotten. Once I finish it, I plan on messing with the included dungeon editor to see if I can make a mysterious deathtrap of my own. (I always say that and then never actually learn the tools. I suck.) Be as it may, I am incredibly excited for whatever the next game in the series might be!

Non recommandé
15.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 janvier 2023
If you're some masochist who still enjoys early 90's D&D crawler games before they understood how to make intuitive controls and write stories, go for it, but for me those days are long over. The only 'difficulty' here is figuring out how to min/max (or exploit) the game's poor, clunky mechanics in order to pass 'difficult' parts, and the hardest boss in this game is the controls. Hope you enjoy clicking on tiny icons for every. single. action. And swapping items in a panic because there's no hotkeys.

Avoid this and get a real RPG.

Évaluation publiée le 11 septembre 2017
Having grown up with Amiga and Dungeon Master, Eye of the Beholder, this game is simply a blast!
I finished it several times, never gets old for me.
This is a great RPG with a great setting and atmosphere.
Movement is grid-based, combat is real-time.
I would recommend it to every RPG fan, especially those who grew up with these game type.
